translated: One does not give because of hatred, thinking, I do not want to be in agreement with my enemies, and because of the view that one's enemies will not be happy.🔽One does not give because of hatred, thinking, I do not want to be in agreement with my enemies, and because of the view that one's enemies will not be happy.🔽One does not give because of hatred, thinking, I do not want to be in agreement with my enemies, and because of the view that one's enemies will not be happy.🔽One does not give because of hatred, thinking, I do not want to be in agreement with my enemies, and because of the view that one's enemies will not be happy.

original: de ltar lta ba ni gti mug las byung ba'i log par lta ba yin par brjod par bya'o //🔽de la srog gcod pa ni gsum char gyis rtsom par byed la /
analyzed: de ltar lta ba ni gti mug las byung ba'i log par lta ba yin par brjod par bya'o // de la srog gcod pa ni gsum char gyis rtsom par byed la /
translated: One does not give because of hatred, thinking, I do not want to be in agreement with my enemies, and because of the view that one's enemies will not be happy.

original: @144a * // zhe sdang gis mthar thug par byed do //🔽srog gcod pa ji lta ba bzhin du ngag rtsub po dang gnod sems kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: @144a * // zhe sdang gis mthar thug par byed do // srog gcod pa ji lta ba bzhin du ngag rtsub po dang gnod sems kyang de bzhin no //
translated: One does not give because of hatred, thinking, I do not want to be in agreement with my enemies, and because of the view that one's enemies will not be happy.🔽One does not give because of hatred, thinking, I do not want to be in agreement with my enemies, and because of the view that one's enemies will not be happy.🔽One does not give because of hatred, thinking, I do not want to be in agreement with my enemies, and because of the view that one's enemies will not be happy.🔽One does not give because of hatred, thinking, I do not want to be in agreement with my enemies, and because of the view that one's enemies will not be happy.

original: ma byin par len pa ni gsum char gyis rtsom par byed la /
analyzed: ma byin par len pa ni gsum char gyis rtsom par byed la /
translated: One does not give because of hatred, thinking, I do not want to be in agreement

original: chags pa kho nas mthar thug par byed do //
analyzed: chags pa kho nas mthar thug par byed do //
translated: One completes it only through attachment.

original: ma byin par len pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brnab sems kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brnab sems kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Sexual misconduct, covetousness, and malice are like taking what is not given.

original: log par lta ba ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa rnams ni gsum char gyis rtsom pa dang / mthar thug par byed par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa rnams ni gsum char gyis rtsom pa dang / mthar thug par byed par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Except for wrong views, the other ten are initiated and completed by the three roots.

original: log par lta ba ni gsum char gyis rtsom par byed la /
analyzed: log par lta ba ni gsum char gyis rtsom par byed la /
translated: Wrong views are initiated by the three roots.

original: gti mug kho nas mthar thug par byed do //
analyzed: gti mug kho nas mthar thug par byed do //
translated: One completes it only through delusion.

original: de la srog gcod pa dang 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / gnod sems rnams ni sems can la brten pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la srog gcod pa dang 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / gnod sems rnams ni sems can la brten pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, killing, sexual misconduct, false speech, malicious speech, harsh speech, and ill will are known to be based on sentient beings.

original: ma byin par len pa dang / brnab sems ni yo byad la brten pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa dang / brnab sems ni yo byad la brten pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Taking what is not given and covetousness are known to be based on property.

original: tshig kyal pa ni ming gi tshogs la brten pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig kyal pa ni ming gi tshogs la brten pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Frivolous speech is known to be based on the collection of names.

original: log par lta ba ni 'du byed la brten pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba ni 'du byed la brten pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Wrong views are to be known as being based on formations.

original: de la mi dge pa'i las kyi lam de dag gi mi dge ba nyid ni rgyu gsum gyis shin tu yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la mi dge pa'i las kyi lam de dag gi mi dge ba nyid ni rgyu gsum gyis shin tu yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: The unwholesomeness of these unwholesome paths of action is very complete on account of three causes.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: ngo bo nyid kyi nyes pa dang / gzhi'i nyes pa dang / gos pa'i nyes pas so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi nyes pa dang / gzhi'i nyes pa dang / gos pa'i nyes pas so //
translated: The fault of intrinsic nature, the fault of basis, and the fault of defilement.

original: de la srog gcod pa dang ldan pa dang / log par lta ba'i bar dang ldan pa'i sems pa de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa thams cad ni nyon mongs pa can gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi nyes pas skyon chags pa zhes bya'o //🔽gal te chags pas kun nas dkris pa bdo ba'am /
analyzed: de la srog gcod pa dang ldan pa dang / log par lta ba'i bar dang ldan pa'i sems pa de dag dang mtshungs par ldan pa thams cad ni nyon mongs pa can gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi nyes pas skyon chags pa zhes bya'o // gal te chags pas kun nas dkris pa bdo ba'am /
translated: In this regard, all that is associated with the volition that is associated with taking life up to wrong views is said to be “defiled by the fault of intrinsic nature” because it is the nature of affliction and because it is unwholesome.🔽If it arises due to the predominance of the envelopment of attachment,

original: zhe sdang dang gti mug gis kun nas dkris pa bdo bas 'byung ba /
analyzed: zhe sdang dang gti mug gis kun nas dkris pa bdo bas 'byung ba /
translated: or due to the predominance of the envelopments of hatred and delusion,

original: de ni gzhi'i nyes pas skyon chags pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de ni gzhi'i nyes pas skyon chags pa yang yin la /
translated: it is also defiled by the fault of basis.

original: shin tu mi dge ba dang / 'bras bu shin tu mi 'dod pa yang yin no //
analyzed: shin tu mi dge ba dang / 'bras bu shin tu mi 'dod pa yang yin no //
translated: It is also very nonvirtuous and has a very undesirable result.

original: gal te mthar thug par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te mthar thug par gyur na /
translated: If it is completed,

original: de ni gos pa'i nyes pas skyon chags pa yang yin la /
analyzed: de ni gos pa'i nyes pas skyon chags pa yang yin la /
translated: it is also a fault that is defiled by the stain of corruption.

original: shin tu mi dge ba dang / 'bras bu shin tu mi 'dod pa yang yin no //
analyzed: shin tu mi dge ba dang / 'bras bu shin tu mi 'dod pa yang yin no //
translated: It is also very nonvirtuous and has a very undesirable result.

original: da ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: da ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar gang la la zhig nyon mongs @144b pa can gyi sems kyis gzhan dag la mi 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / mi dga' ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i sdug bsngal nye bar sgrub par byed na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la la zhig nyon mongs @144b pa can gyi sems kyis gzhan dag la mi 'dod pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / mi dga' ba dang / yid du mi 'ong ba'i sdug bsngal nye bar sgrub par byed na /
translated: Because when someone, with a defiled mind, causes others to experience what is unwanted, unpleasant, disagreeable, and unappealing,

original: sdug bsngal ba dang ldan pa'i sems de'i mthus sdug bsngal nye bar sgrub par byed pa'i gang zag de'i sems pa de kha na ma tho ba shin tu chen pos reg par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba dang ldan pa'i sems de'i mthus sdug bsngal nye bar sgrub par byed pa'i gang zag de'i sems pa de kha na ma tho ba shin tu chen pos reg par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: then, by the power of that defiled mind, the person who causes suffering to others becomes defiled by a very great misdeed.

original: de ni de'i gos pa'i nyes zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni de'i gos pa'i nyes zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “the stain of corruption.”

original: de la 'di ltar bdag la sdug bsngal nye bar sgrub pa gang yin pa de kha na ma tho bas reg par gyur cig snyam pa de lta bu'i sems mngon par 'du byed pa med du zin kyang 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la 'di ltar bdag la sdug bsngal nye bar sgrub pa gang yin pa de kha na ma tho bas reg par gyur cig snyam pa de lta bu'i sems mngon par 'du byed pa med du zin kyang 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
translated: In this regard, even though one does not form the thought, “May the one who inflicts suffering on me be touched by misfortune,” still, this is the nature of things:

original: de la reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: he will be touched by misfortune.

original: 'di lta ste dper na rdo khab long ni 'di snyam du lcags bdag gi drung du 'ong yang ci ma rung snyam du sems pa med du zin kyang 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na rdo khab long ni 'di snyam du lcags bdag gi drung du 'ong yang ci ma rung snyam du sems pa med du zin kyang 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
translated: For example, even though a magnet does not think, “Oh, that iron would come into my presence,” still, this is the nature of things:

original: de dang nye ba'i lcags ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa kho nar khab long gi drung du 'gro ste /
analyzed: de dang nye ba'i lcags ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa kho nar khab long gi drung du 'gro ste /
translated: iron comes into the presence of the magnet without any effort on the part of the magnet.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang tshul de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand that this is the way things are in this case.

original: me shel gyi dpe yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: me shel gyi dpe yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The example of the magnifying glass should be understood in the same way.

original: sems pa de la de'i mthu las skyes pa nye bar bsgo ba zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan 'ga' yang mi 'jug mod kyi /
analyzed: sems pa de la de'i mthu las skyes pa nye bar bsgo ba zhes bya ba'i chos gzhan 'ga' yang mi 'jug mod kyi /
translated: Even though the thought does not occur to the magnifying glass, “By my power, a fire will be generated,” still,🔽a fire is generated from it.

original: 'on kyang sems pa de'i 'gyur ba tsam po de'i mthu las gyur par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sems pa de'i 'gyur ba tsam po de'i mthu las gyur par rig par bya'o //
translated: But it should be understood that the mere transformation of that mind is the cause of that.

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: For example,

original: las kyi mthus bskyed pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag gi sra ba nyid dang / gsher ba nyid dang / dro ba nyid dang / yang zhing g-yo ba nyid sna tshogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'byung ba chen po de dag las tha dad pa ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: las kyi mthus bskyed pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi po dag gi sra ba nyid dang / gsher ba nyid dang / dro ba nyid dang / yang zhing g-yo ba nyid sna tshogs pa gang yin pa de dag ni 'byung ba chen po de dag las tha dad pa ma yin mod kyi /
translated: the various kinds of solidity, fluidity, heat, and motion of the four great elements, which are produced by the power of karma, are not different from those great elements.

original: 'on kyang de dag ni 'byung ba chen po rnams de ltar gyur pa tsam kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag ni 'byung ba chen po rnams de ltar gyur pa tsam kho na yin te /
translated: But they are just the transformation of the great elements in that way.

original: de yang las kyi mthu'i rkyen yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang las kyi mthu'i rkyen yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And that should be understood as the condition of the power of karma.

original: las kyi mthu'i rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa'i rkyen kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: las kyi mthu'i rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'i mngon par 'du byed pa'i rkyen kyang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The condition of the power of karma should be understood as the condition of the magical creation of one who has attained magical powers.

original: 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: For example,

original: bdud kyis grong khyer s'a la can gyi bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams kyi sems de de ltar bsgyur te /
analyzed: bdud kyis grong khyer s'a la can gyi bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams kyi sems de de ltar bsgyur te /
translated: The demon Mara has thus changed the minds of the brahmins and householders in the city of Shalla.

original: de dag ci ltar bcom ldan 'das la log par sgrub par byed pa de ltar byed mod kyi /
analyzed: de dag ci ltar bcom ldan 'das la log par sgrub par byed pa de ltar byed mod kyi /
translated: They are acting in such a way as to do wrong to the Blessed One.

original: 'on kyang de dag gis sems dag la sgyur bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i chos lhag pa gang yang zhugs pa med kyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag gis sems dag la sgyur bar byed pa zhes bya ba'i chos lhag pa gang yang zhugs pa med kyi /
translated: However, there is no other phenomenon whatsoever that is said to change their minds.

original: de rnams kyi sems dag gi 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: de rnams kyi sems dag gi 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The change in their minds

original: @145a * // bdud kyis mngon par 'du byas pa'i mthu las byung ba kho na tsam yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: @145a * // bdud kyis mngon par 'du byas pa'i mthu las byung ba kho na tsam yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: should be seen as merely arising from the power of the demon Mara's creation.

original: 'di la yang tshul de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang tshul de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: Here, too, the method should be understood in the same way.

original: de la las byas kyang byas la bsags kyang bsags pa zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa dang / lci ba rnam pa lngas las lci bar gsungs pa gang yin pa de dag ni myong bar nges pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la las byas kyang byas la bsags kyang bsags pa zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa dang / lci ba rnam pa lngas las lci bar gsungs pa gang yin pa de dag ni myong bar nges pa yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Here, it should be said that what is said to be karma that is both done and accumulated, and what is said to be heavy karma by the five aspects is karma that is certain to be experienced.

original: de las bzlog pa ni myong bar ma nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni myong bar ma nges pa yin no //
translated: The opposite of that is karma whose experience is not certain.

original: de yang rnam par smin par nges pa dang / gnas skabs nges pa dang / gnyi gar nges pa yin par brjod par bya'o //🔽de la dgra bcom pa'i mi dge ba'i las myong bar nges pa sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu byas pa gang yin pa de ni sngon so so'i skye bor gyur ba ni de nyid kyi tshe sdug bsngal chung zad tsam mam /
analyzed: de yang rnam par smin par nges pa dang / gnas skabs nges pa dang / gnyi gar nges pa yin par brjod par bya'o // de la dgra bcom pa'i mi dge ba'i las myong bar nges pa sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu byas pa gang yin pa de ni sngon so so'i skye bor gyur ba ni de nyid kyi tshe sdug bsngal chung zad tsam mam /
translated: Moreover, it should be said that karma is certain in terms of its ripening, its time, and both.

original: ngan ngon tsam nye bar gyur pas /🔽de'i rnam par smin pa rnam par smin zin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ngan ngon tsam nye bar gyur pas / de'i rnam par smin pa rnam par smin zin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: In this regard, any nonvirtuous karma of an arhat that is certain to be experienced, which was done in other previous lives, is said to have already ripened, because when he was still an ordinary person, he experienced a small amount of suffering or just a little bit of suffering.🔽By that, the seed of its ripening is destroyed.

original: gnas gyur pas rnam par smin pa'i sa bon yang /
analyzed: gnas gyur pas rnam par smin pa'i sa bon yang /
translated: By the transformation of the basis, the seed of the ripening is destroyed.

original: yang dag par bcom pas ni de thams cad kyi thams cad du mi myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par bcom pas ni de thams cad kyi thams cad du mi myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By completely destroying it, it is not experienced at all.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar myong bar nges pa de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sems kyi rgyud rnam par ma grol ba las brtsams te rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar myong bar nges pa de ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sems kyi rgyud rnam par ma grol ba las brtsams te rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the Blessed One has stated that the certainty of experiencing a result is based on the continuum of consciousness that is not liberated.

original: gang la la zhig gis srog chags lan cig drangs shing gnod pa yang byas la /
analyzed: gang la la zhig gis srog chags lan cig drangs shing gnod pa yang byas la /
translated: If someone were to kill a living being and harm it,

original: bsad cing srog dang phral bar gyur na ci de la las gcig ces brjod par bya'am /🔽'on te gnyis zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: bsad cing srog dang phral bar gyur na ci de la las gcig ces brjod par bya'am / 'on te gnyis zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: should that be called one action or two actions?

original: smras pa / las gnyis zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / las gnyis zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: He said: It should be called two actions.

original: las de gnyis ni myur bar 'jug pa'i phyir gcig go snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'byung bar blta bar zad kyi /
analyzed: las de gnyis ni myur bar 'jug pa'i phyir gcig go snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal 'byung bar blta bar zad kyi /
translated: Those two actions should be seen as one because of the arising of the manifest pride that thinks, “I did this.”

original: 'di drangs la srog dbrog par bya'o snyam pa ni 'phrog pa'i dus na sems pa gcig yin la /
analyzed: 'di drangs la srog dbrog par bya'o snyam pa ni 'phrog pa'i dus na sems pa gcig yin la /
translated: The thought at the time of killing is one: “I will kill this living being and take its life.”

original: 'di la gnod pa byas te gsad par bya'o snyam pa ni sems pa gnyis pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la gnod pa byas te gsad par bya'o snyam pa ni sems pa gnyis pa yin te /
translated: The second thought is: “I will harm this living being and kill it.”

original: gang gi tshe 'dren par byed pa de'i tshe na ni gnod par mi byed la gang gi tshe gnod par byed pa de'i tshe na ni 'dren par mi byed de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dren par byed pa de'i tshe na ni gnod par mi byed la gang gi tshe gnod par byed pa de'i tshe na ni 'dren par mi byed de /
translated: When it is drawing out, it is not harming; when it is harming, it is not drawing out.

original: myur bar 'jug pas cig car ro snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal skye bar zad pas de'i phyir las gnyis su brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: myur bar 'jug pas cig car ro snyam pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal skye bar zad pas de'i phyir las gnyis su brjod par bya'o //
translated: Since the conceit arises that they occur simultaneously because they function quickly, therefore two actions should be stated.

original: tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni mdor bsdu na rgyu gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di la myong bar 'gyur ba'i las ni mdor bsdu na rgyu gsum gyis rig par bya ste /
translated: Karma to be experienced in this life should be understood in brief through three causes.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: zhing rgya @145b che ba dang / sems pa rgya che ba dang / sems kyi rgyud rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: zhing rgya @145b che ba dang / sems pa rgya che ba dang / sems kyi rgyud rnam par dag pas so //
translated: Through the vastness of the field, the vastness of intention, and the purity of the continuum of mind.

original: de la zhing rgya che ba nyid ni rnam pa lngas blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la zhing rgya che ba nyid ni rnam pa lngas blta bar bya ste /
translated: Therein, the vastness of the field should be seen in five ways.

original: sems can rnams la mchog tu phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa la gnas pa las langs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la mchog tu phan pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa la gnas pa las langs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Arising from the superior intention of supreme benefit for sentient beings,

original: byams pa la snyoms par 'jug pa las langs pa'o //
analyzed: byams pa la snyoms par 'jug pa las langs pa'o //
translated: arising from meditative absorption in love.

original: sems can rnams mchog tu sems rjes su srung ba la gnas pa las langs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams mchog tu sems rjes su srung ba la gnas pa las langs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: He has arisen from the highest protection of the mind of sentient beings,

original: nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las langs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa'i ting nge 'dzin las langs pa'o //
translated: that is, from the samadhi of the absence of defilement.

original: mchog tu rab tu zhi zhing mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i 'phags pa'i gnas pa las langs pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mchog tu rab tu zhi zhing mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i 'phags pa'i gnas pa las langs pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: He has arisen from the highest peace, which is like nirvana, that is,

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las langs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las langs pa'o //
translated: from the samadhi of cessation.

original: mi dge ba thams cad mi byed pa'i sdom pa thob pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: mi dge ba thams cad mi byed pa'i sdom pa thob pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: He has attained the vow not to do any evil, that is,

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i sems kyi rgyud shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i sems kyi rgyud shin tu rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: the very pure mental continuum of a stream-winner.

original: shin tu mthar thug pa ni 'di lta ste /

translated: Those who have an impure birth and impure sense spheres are🔽ordinary beings born in the desire realm who are not destined for nirvana,

original: dal bar skyes pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: dal bar skyes pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: and those destined for nirvana who are not born in a favorable time.

original: skye ba yongs su dag la skye mched kyang yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: skye ba yongs su dag la skye mched kyang yongs su dag pa dang ldan pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those who have a pure birth and pure sense spheres are

analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams su skyes pa'i slob pa so so'i skye bo ma yin pa rnams kyi'o //

translated: As it is said, “For a long time you have produced the link of the dead body and taken up the drops of blood.

original: ro'i mtshams sbyor ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ro'i mtshams sbyor ba gang zhe na /
translated: ” What is the link of the dead body?

original: smras pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa 'di lta ste /
translated: It is said:

analyzed: ro'i mtshams sbyor ba zhes bya ba de ni srid pa'i tshig gi rnam grangs yin te /
translated: The link of the dead body is a synonym for existence.

analyzed: des ni kun tu 'byung ba'i bden pa yongs su bzung bar bstan to //
translated: This shows that the truth of origination is included.

translated: The phrase “taken up the drops of blood” shows that the truth of suffering is included.🔽In that chapter of the sutra, the Buddha spoke about the defilement of death.

original: 'chi ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa las brtsams te der bcom ldan 'das kyis lnga po 'di dag ni ma smyos pa smyon pa'i spyod pa dag yin te /

translated: He said, “There are five kinds of insane behavior of the insane.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

analyzed: yan lag chag pa dag 'tsho ba'i thabs gzhan yod bzhin du yan lag gsheg pa'i rgyus 'tsho bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni ma smyos pa smyon pa'i spyod pa dang po yin no // gzhan yang chags shing chags pa'i zil gyis non pa dag chags pa'i gzhi'i rgyus longs spyod par yang mi byed sbyin par yang mi byed par longs spyod kyi tshogs chen po dag spangs nas 'chi ba'i dus byed pa kho nar 'gyur ba gang yin pa de ni ma
translated: When there is another way to live and one lives by cutting off a limb, that is the first insane behavior of one who is not insane.

original: smyos pa smyon pa'i spyod pa gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: smyos pa smyon pa'i spyod pa gnyis pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, when those who are attached and overwhelmed by attachment, because of the basis of attachment, neither enjoy nor give, but only die having abandoned great stores of wealth, that is the second insane behavior of one who is not insane.

original: gzhan yang mtho ris 'dod pa dag lus dang ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyad pas bsdus pa'i mtho ris kyi thabs gzhan yod bzhin du mtho ris 'dod pa'i phyir bdag nyid mer sreg par byed pa dang / chur 'chi bar byed pa dang / g-yang sa nas g-yang du gtong bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni ma smyos pa smyon pa'i spyod pa gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang mtho ris 'dod pa dag lus dang ngag dang yid kyis legs par spyad pas bsdus pa'i mtho ris kyi thabs gzhan yod bzhin du mtho ris 'dod pa'i phyir bdag nyid mer sreg par byed pa dang / chur 'chi bar byed pa dang / g-yang sa nas g-yang du gtong bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni ma smyos pa smyon pa'i spyod pa gsum pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, those who desire high status, while there are other means to high status included in the good conduct of body, speech, and mind, burn themselves in fire, drown themselves in water, and throw themselves off a cliff in order to attain high status. This is the third insane behavior of one who is not insane.

original: gzhan yang thar pa 'dod pa dag 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas bsdus pa'i thar pa'i thabs yod bzhin du /
analyzed: gzhan yang thar pa 'dod pa dag 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pas bsdus pa'i thar pa'i thabs yod bzhin du /

analyzed: sems zhum pa yin ;

analyzed: da ni rab tu dbye ba las ngo bo nyid je brjod par bya ste / ma rig pa ni bag la nyal ba yang yod do //

analyzed: ngo tsha ba dang bral ba yang yod do //

translated: Ignorance is confusion about direct perception, about what is bad, about what is middling, about what is good, about what is beneficial, about what is not beneficial, about the meaning of reality, about the meaning of friends, and about causes and effects.

analyzed: sems can kun tu rmongs pa ni bcu po 'di dag yin te /

analyzed: sems can kun tu rmongs pa de dag gis sems can kun tu rmongs pa thams cad bsdus par 'gyur te /

original: ma tshang bas kun tu rmongs pa dang / g-yeng bas kun tu rmongs pa dang / rnam par g-yeng bas kun tu rmongs pa dang / rang bzhin gyis kun tu rmongs pa dang / mngon par zhen pas kun tu rmongs pa dang / 'khrul pas kun tu rmongs pa dang /

translated: Confusion due to incompleteness, confusion due to distraction, confusion due to distraction, confusion due to nature, confusion due to attachment, confusion due to delusion,

original: kun tu rmongs pa brtan pa dang / shin tu kun tu rmongs pa dang / ma rtogs pas kun tu rmongs pa dang / mngon sum la kun tu rmongs pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu rmongs pa brtan pa dang / shin tu kun tu rmongs pa dang / ma rtogs pas kun tu rmongs pa dang / mngon sum la kun tu rmongs pa'o //
translated: 1. confusion due to incompleteness, 2. confusion due to distraction, 3. confusion due to stability, 4. confusion due to complete delusion, 5. confusion due to non-understanding, and 6. confusion due to direct perception.

original: de la ma tshang bas kun tu rmongs pa ni /
analyzed: de la ma tshang bas kun tu rmongs pa ni /
translated: Among these, confusion due to incompleteness is as follows:

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la mig ma tshang ba'am rna ba ma tshang bar gyur nas /🔽des na mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams sam /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la mig ma tshang ba'am rna ba ma tshang bar gyur nas / des na mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs rnams sam /
translated: For example, when someone has an incomplete eye or ear,🔽he does not experience all forms that are objects of eye-consciousness

original: rna bas rnam par shes par bya ba'i sgra rnams la thams cad kyi thams cad du nyams su myong ba med pa las kun tu rmongs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rna bas rnam par shes par bya ba'i sgra rnams la thams cad kyi thams cad du nyams su myong ba med pa las kun tu rmongs pa lta bu'o //
translated: or all sounds that are objects of ear-consciousness.

original: de la g-yeng bas kun tu rmongs pa ni /
analyzed: de la g-yeng bas kun tu rmongs pa ni /
translated: Confusion due to distraction is as follows:

analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la gnod pa'am /

original: sdug bsngal ba'am nad tshabs che ba'am /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'am nad tshabs che ba'am /

original: tshor bas sdug bsngal ba'am /
analyzed: tshor bas sdug bsngal ba'am /
translated: or is suffering from painful feelings,

original: smyos te sems 'khrugs nas /
analyzed: smyos te sems 'khrugs nas /
translated: or is insane and mentally disturbed,

original: des de legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa dag la kun tu rmongs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: des de legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa dag la kun tu rmongs pa lta bu'o //
translated: he is confused about what he has done well and what he has done badly.

original: de la rnam par g-yeng bas kun tu rmongs pa ni /
analyzed: de la rnam par g-yeng bas kun tu rmongs pa ni /
translated: 1. Confusion due to distraction.

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la gzhan la sems 'brel par gyur pas gzhan la legs par byas pa dang nyes par byas pa dag la kun tu rmongs pa lta bu'o //🔽de la rang bzhin gyis kun tu rmongs pa ni /

translated: Confusion due to distraction is like the confusion of one who, his mind distracted by something else, does not understand what is well or ill done.

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'i 'khor ba na rang bzhin kho nas sdug bsngal ba dang / kun tu 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam dang / gang zag la bdag med pa dang / chos la bdag med pa la kun tu rmongs pa lta bu'o //🔽de @149a * //

translated: Confusion due to nature is like the confusion of one who, from beginningless time, is naturally confused about suffering, its origin, its cessation, the path, the insubstantiality of the person, and the insubstantiality of the dharmas.

original: la mngon par zhen pas kun tu rmongs pa ni /
analyzed: la mngon par zhen pas kun tu rmongs pa ni /
translated: Confusion due to adherence is like the confusion of one who adheres to the self, the sentient being, the living being, the nourished being, the person, the human being, the human, the performer, the experiencer, the knower, and the one who is liberated.

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la phyi rol pa mu stegs can du gyur nas des na de 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rtsa ba las byung ba'i lta ba'i rnam pa dag la kun tu rmongs pa lta bu'o //

translated: For example, someone here, having become a non-Buddhist tīrthika, is confused about the view of the transitory collection and the aspects of the view that arise from the root of the view of the transitory collection.

original: de la 'khrul pas kun tu rmongs pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'khrul pas kun tu rmongs pa ni /
translated: Confusion due to error is as follows.

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la mi 'khrul pa'am /🔽grangs 'khrul pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la mi 'khrul pa'am / grangs 'khrul pa'am /
translated: For example, someone here is confused about things that accord with error,🔽due to error in number,

original: dbyi bas 'khrul pa'am /
analyzed: dbyi bas 'khrul pa'am /
translated: error in omission,

original: kha dog 'khrul pa'am /
analyzed: kha dog 'khrul pa'am /
translated: error in color,

original: las 'khrul pas 'khrul pa dang / mthun pa'i chos rnams la kun tu rmongs pa lta bu'o //🔽de la kun tu rmongs pa brtan pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can du gyur nas /
analyzed: las 'khrul pas 'khrul pa dang / mthun pa'i chos rnams la kun tu rmongs pa lta bu'o // de la kun tu rmongs pa brtan pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can du gyur nas /
translated: or error in action.🔽Firm confusion is as follows. For example, someone here, having become someone who does not pass into complete nirvana,

original: des na de'i kun tu rmongs pa sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang gzhig mi spyod par brtan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: des na de'i kun tu rmongs pa sangs rgyas rnams kyis kyang gzhig mi spyod par brtan pa lta bu'o //
translated: is confused about the qualities of complete nirvana, and their confusion is so firm that even the Buddhas cannot destroy it.

original: de la shin tu kun tu rmongs pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la rtag par rgyun du log par bsgrub pas /🔽log par sgrub pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyis bcom par shes shing mthong yang de nyid la rgyug cing /
analyzed: de la shin tu kun tu rmongs pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la rtag par rgyun du log par bsgrub pas / log par sgrub pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyis bcom par shes shing mthong yang de nyid la rgyug cing /
translated: In this regard, those who are extremely confused are those who, though they know and see that they are constantly and continuously being destroyed by suffering that arises from the cause of wrong practice,🔽still run to it.🔽

original: de nyid la mngon par dga' ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod pa gang yin pa lta bu'o //🔽de la ma rtogs pas kun tu rmongs pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid la mngon par dga' ba dang / 'dod chags la sogs pa spyod pa gang yin pa lta bu'o // de la ma rtogs pas kun tu rmongs pa ni /
translated: Extreme confusion is like the case of someone who, though knowing and seeing that he is constantly being destroyed by suffering arising from the cause of wrong practice, still runs to it and delights in it, and engages in attachment and so on.

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la ma thos pa dang / ma bsams pa dang ; ma bsgoms pa'i phyir chos kyi don la kun tu rmongs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la ma thos pa dang / ma bsams pa dang ; ma bsgoms pa'i phyir chos kyi don la kun tu rmongs pa lta bu'o //
translated: Confusion due to non-realization is like the case of someone who is confused about the meaning of the teaching because of not hearing it, not reflecting on it, and not cultivating it.

original: de la mngon sum la kun tu rmongs pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la 'du byed rnams kyi mi rtag pa nyid mngon sum du yang dag par rjes su mthong bzhin du rtag par 'du shes pa dang / sdug bsngal nyid mngon sum du yang dag par rjes su mthong bzhin du bde bar 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: de la mngon sum la kun tu rmongs pa ni 'di ltar 'di na la la 'du byed rnams kyi mi rtag pa nyid mngon sum du yang dag par rjes su mthong bzhin du rtag par 'du shes pa dang / sdug bsngal nyid mngon sum du yang dag par rjes su mthong bzhin du bde bar 'du shes pa dang /
translated: They see suffering directly and accurately, yet still have the conception of pleasure.🔽They see impurity directly and accurately, yet still have the conception of purity.🔽They see selflessness directly and accurately, yet still have the conception of self.

original: mi gtsang ba nyid mngon sum du yang dag par rjes su mthong bzhin du gtsang bar 'du shes pa dang / bdag med pa nyid mngon sum du yang dag par rjes su mthong bzhin du bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / na ba'i chos nyid dang /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba nyid mngon sum du yang dag par rjes su mthong bzhin du gtsang bar 'du shes pa dang / bdag med pa nyid mngon sum du yang dag par rjes su mthong bzhin du bdag tu 'du shes pa dang / na ba'i chos nyid dang /
translated: They see the nature of sickness,🔽the nature of aging,

original: rga ba'i chos nyid dang / 'chi ba'i chos nyid mngon sum du yang dag par rjes su mthong bzhin du bde bar 'du shes pa dang / gnod pa med par 'du shes pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: rga ba'i chos nyid dang / 'chi ba'i chos nyid mngon sum du yang dag par rjes su mthong bzhin du bde bar 'du shes pa dang / gnod pa med par 'du shes pa lta bu'o //
translated: and the nature of death directly and accurately, yet still have the conception of pleasure and the conception of being unharmed.

original: gzhan yang ma rig pa ni gnas lnga la sgrib par byed pa yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang ma rig pa ni gnas lnga la sgrib par byed pa yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the five?

original: ma rig pa ni de kho na'i shes pa 'thob dang / @149b nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba 'thob pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yongs su 'grub pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten pa rnams kyi tshe 'di pa'i phun sum tshogs pa la sgrib par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni de kho na'i shes pa 'thob dang / @149b nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba 'thob pa dang / 'phags pa'i lam yongs su 'grub pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / 'jig rten pa rnams kyi tshe 'di pa'i phun sum tshogs pa la sgrib par byed pa yin no //
translated: Ignorance obscures the attainment of knowledge of reality, the attainment of the pacification of the afflictions, the accomplishment of the noble path, the attainment of good destinies, and mundane excellence in this life.

original: ma rig pa'i chos nyid kyang gang zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i chos nyid kyang gang zhe na /
translated: What is the reality of ignorance?

original: ma rig pa ni ma rig pa gang dang ldan na rmongs pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni ma rig pa gang dang ldan na rmongs pa zhes bya la /
translated: There is ignorance that is called delusion.

original: gti mug gis brlams pa ma yin pa dang / gti mug gi dri ma can ma yin pa dang / gti mug gi dbang du gyur pa ma yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gti mug gis brlams pa ma yin pa dang / gti mug gi dri ma can ma yin pa dang / gti mug gi dbang du gyur pa ma yin pa yang yod do //
translated: There is also ignorance that is not possessed by those who are not possessed by delusion, that is not defiled by delusion, and that does not come under the power of delusion.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What is that?

original: bag la nyal du gnas pa'i ma rig pa dang ldan pa'o //🔽rmongs pa yang yin /
analyzed: bag la nyal du gnas pa'i ma rig pa dang ldan pa'o // rmongs pa yang yin /
translated: It is the ignorance that remains as a latent tendency.🔽There is delusion,

original: gti mug gis brlams pa yang yin la /
analyzed: gti mug gis brlams pa yang yin la /
translated: and there is also being possessed by delusion.

original: gti mug gi dri ma can ma yin pa dang / gti mug gi dbang du gyur pa ma yin pa yang yod de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gti mug gi dri ma can ma yin pa dang / gti mug gi dbang du gyur pa ma yin pa yang yod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: There are those who are not stained by delusion and are not under the power of delusion.🔽There are those who are confused,🔽those who are possessed by delusion,🔽those who are stained by delusion,

original: kun nas dkris par gtogs pa'i ma rig pa dang ldan pa'o //🔽rmongs pa yang yin /
analyzed: kun nas dkris par gtogs pa'i ma rig pa dang ldan pa'o // rmongs pa yang yin /
translated: and those who are not under the power of delusion.🔽There are those who are confused,

original: gti mug gis brlams pa yang yin /🔽gti mug gi dri ma can yang yin la /🔽gti mug gi dbang du gyur pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: gti mug gis brlams pa yang yin / gti mug gi dri ma can yang yin la / gti mug gi dbang du gyur pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: those who are possessed by delusion,🔽those who are stained by delusion,🔽and those who are under the power of delusion.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: There are those who are confused,🔽those who are possessed by delusion,🔽those who are stained by delusion,

original: ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i las kun nas slong bar byed pa'i ma rig pa dang ldan pa ste /🔽de ni las kun nas bslangs nas nyes par spyad pa des ngo tsha bar byed pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i las kun nas slong bar byed pa'i ma rig pa dang ldan pa ste / de ni las kun nas bslangs nas nyes par spyad pa des ngo tsha bar byed pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: and those who are not under the power of delusion.

original: / rmongs pa yang yin /🔽gti mug gis brlams pa yang yin /
analyzed: / rmongs pa yang yin / gti mug gis brlams pa yang yin /
translated: There are those who are confused,🔽those who are possessed by delusion,

original: gti mug gi dri ma can yang yin /
analyzed: gti mug gi dri ma can yang yin /
translated: those who are stained by delusion,

original: gti mug gi dbang du gyur pa yin pa yang yod de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gti mug gi dbang du gyur pa yin pa yang yod de /🔽'di lta ste /
translated: and those who are under the power of delusion.

original: ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i las kun nas bslangs nas nyes par spyad pa des ngo tsha bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdig pa mi dge ba'i las kun nas bslangs nas nyes par spyad pa des ngo tsha bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they do not feel shame for the evil conduct that they have instigated through the force of the karma of sinful, nonvirtuous actions that arise from the cause of nescience.

original: de na ma rig pa rnam pa gsum gyis ni rmongs pa yin la /
analyzed: de na ma rig pa rnam pa gsum gyis ni rmongs pa yin la /
translated: There, the three types of nescience are delusion,

original: mi gti mug can zhes ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: mi gti mug can zhes ni mi bya'o //
translated: but they are not called “deluded.”

original: tha mas ni mi gti mug can zhes kyang bya'o //
analyzed: tha mas ni mi gti mug can zhes kyang bya'o //
translated: The last is called “deluded.”

original: ma rig pa ni mun nag gi chos can yang yod de /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni mun nag gi chos can yang yod de /
translated: There is nescience that is a quality of darkness,

original: 'di lta ste 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'dod pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: such as that which occurs in the desire realm.

original: mun pa'i chos can yang yod de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: mun pa'i chos can yang yod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: There is nescience that is a quality of darkness,

original: gzugs na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs na spyod pa'o //
translated: such as that which occurs in the form realm.

original: rab rib kyi chos can yang yod de /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab rib kyi chos can yang yod de / 'di lta ste /
translated: There is nescience that is a quality of cataracts,

original: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa na spyod pa'o //
translated: such as that which occurs in the formless realm.

original: ma rig pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the cause and effect of nescience?

original: smras pa / rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cause is as follows:

original: sa'i dngos gzhir bstan pa bzhin du blta bar @150a * //
analyzed: sa'i dngos gzhir bstan pa bzhin du blta bar @150a * //
translated: It should be understood as taught in the Abhidharma.

original: bya'o ; /'bras bu ni srid pa'i yan lag thams cad do //
analyzed: bya'o ; /'bras bu ni srid pa'i yan lag thams cad do //
translated: The effect is all the members of existence.

original: gzhan yang de bzhin nyid dang bden pa'i don mi rtogs pa dang / de bzhin nyid du de nyid la the tshom za ba dang / log par nges nas mi rtag pa la sogs pa la phyin ci log tu 'dzin cing mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gzhan yang de bzhin nyid dang bden pa'i don mi rtogs pa dang / de bzhin nyid du de nyid la the tshom za ba dang / log par nges nas mi rtag pa la sogs pa la phyin ci log tu 'dzin cing mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ram /
translated: they are ascertained in error, they grasp and cling to impermanence and so on as erroneous,

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi phyir ram /🔽bdag khyad du gsod pa'i phyir ram bden pa la skur pa 'debs pa'am /
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyi phyir ram / bdag khyad du gsod pa'i phyir ram bden pa la skur pa 'debs pa'am /
translated: they are filled with pride,🔽they disparage themselves, they deprecate the truth,

original: sgro 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'o //
translated: or they exaggerate it.

original: srid pa'i yan lag lhag ma rnams kyi rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung ni mi snang ngo //
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag lhag ma rnams kyi rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung ni mi snang ngo //
translated: The treatise does not appear to set forth the ascertainment of the remaining limbs of existence.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu ni mig yin la /
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu ni mig yin la /
translated: The Bhagavān said, “The eye is the cause of the arising of eye consciousness,

original: rkyen ni gzugs rnams yin no zhes bya ba nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu ni lus yin la /
analyzed: rkyen ni gzugs rnams yin no zhes bya ba nas lus kyi rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu ni lus yin la /
translated: and form is its condition. The body is the cause of the arising of body consciousness,🔽and tactile objects are its condition.”

original: rkyen ni reg bya rnams yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa dang / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o zhes gang gsungs pa dang / de dang 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu ni de dang 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa de la /
analyzed: rkyen ni reg bya rnams yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gang gsungs pa dang / reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba'o zhes gang gsungs pa dang / de dang 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i rgyu ni de dang 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa yin no zhes gang gsungs pa de la /
translated: and up to “the conditions are tactile objects,” and “the condition of contact is feeling,” and “the cause of the arising of consciousness that arises from that is attention that arises from that.”

original: gang gi tshe mig la sogs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i skyed pa'i rgyu dag ma yin pa dang / reg pa yang tshor ba'i skyed pa'i rgyu ma yin pa dang / de dang 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa yang de dang 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe mig la sogs pa'i mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa'i skyed pa'i rgyu dag ma yin pa dang / reg pa yang tshor ba'i skyed pa'i rgyu ma yin pa dang / de dang 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa yang de dang 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed pa'i rgyu ma yin te /
translated: When the eyes and so on are not the cause generating eye consciousness and so forth, contact is not the cause generating feeling, and attention that arises from that is not the cause generating consciousness that arises from that.

original: 'di ltar de dag gi rang gi sa bon nyid skyed pa'i rgyu yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gi rang gi sa bon nyid skyed pa'i rgyu yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: In that case, their own seeds are the cause generating them.

original: ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa dag mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa dag gi rgyu yin par gsungs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mig la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa dag mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ji skad bstan pa dag gi rgyu yin par gsungs she na /
translated: Why are eyes and so on said to be the causes of eye consciousness and so on?

original: lhan cig 'byung ba gnas su bsdus pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu las dgongs te gsungs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba gnas su bsdus pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu las dgongs te gsungs pa yin gyi /
translated: They are stated from the perspective of being coemergent generating causes that include the abodes.

original: mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu las ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not stated from the perspective of being actualizing causes.

original: 'di ltar lhan cig 'byung ba'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar lhan cig 'byung ba'i mig la sogs pa'i dbang po la brten nas /
translated: Thus, in dependence on the coemergent sense faculties such as the eyes,

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dmigs pa de dang de la 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dmigs pa de dang de la 'jug par 'gyur gyi /
translated: eye consciousness and so on engage their focal objects.🔽They do not engage their focal objects without depending on them.

original: ma brten par mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du lhan cig 'byung ba'i reg pa la brten nas tshor ba rnams skye bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: ma brten par mi 'jug pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du lhan cig 'byung ba'i reg pa la brten nas tshor ba rnams skye bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Similarly, in dependence on coemergent contact, feelings arise.

original: ma brten par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du lhan cig 'byung ba de dang 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa la brten nas de dang 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur gyi @150b ma brtan par ni mi 'byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma brten par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du lhan cig 'byung ba de dang 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa la brten nas de dang 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa skye bar 'gyur gyi @150b ma brtan par ni mi 'byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it does not arise without support, and similarly, eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye faculty and the mental attention that produces it, but it does not arise without support.

original: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyis thams cad du yang lhan cig 'byung ba gnas su bsdus pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu las dgongs te gsungs pa yin gyi /🔽mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu'am /
analyzed: de ltar na bcom ldan 'das kyis thams cad du yang lhan cig 'byung ba gnas su bsdus pa skyed par byed pa'i rgyu las dgongs te gsungs pa yin gyi / mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu'am /
translated: Thus the Bhagavān stated in all cases that coemergent states are the generating cause that produces the basis.

original: 'khor gyi rgyu las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khor gyi rgyu las ni ma yin no //
translated: He did not state that they are the cause of actualization or🔽the cause of the retinue.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar mig 'gags pas ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes pa'i gnas kyi bya ba byed par mi nus te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig 'gags pas ni mig gi rnam par shes pa skyes pa'i gnas kyi bya ba byed par mi nus te /
translated: Because when the eye faculty ceases, it cannot perform the function of producing eye consciousness.

original: rna ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyang de dang 'dra ba dang / reg pa 'gags pas kyang tshor ba skyes pa'i gnas kyi bya ba byed par mi nus pa dang / de dang 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa 'gags pas kyang de dang 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa skyes pa'i gnas kyi bya ba byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rna ba la sogs pa lhag ma rnams kyang de dang 'dra ba dang / reg pa 'gags pas kyang tshor ba skyes pa'i gnas kyi bya ba byed par mi nus pa dang / de dang 'byung ba'i yid la byed pa 'gags pas kyang de dang 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa skyes pa'i gnas kyi bya ba byed par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the cessation of contact is unable to perform the function of giving rise to feeling, and the cessation of the mental activity that arises with it is unable to perform the function of giving rise to the consciousness that arises with it.

original: gzhan yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i go rims kyi rnam grangs ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhis rig par bya ste /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i go rims kyi rnam grangs ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa bzhis rig par bya ste / 'di lta ste /
translated: Moreover, the order of dependent origination should be understood in brief in four ways:🔽as the order of projection,🔽as the order of actualization,🔽as the order of the experience of objects, and

original: 'phen pa'i go rims dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i go rims dang / yul la yongs su longs spyod pa'i go rims dang / sdug bsngal la yongs su spyod pa'i go rims kyis so //
analyzed: 'phen pa'i go rims dang / mngon par 'grub pa'i go rims dang / yul la yongs su longs spyod pa'i go rims dang / sdug bsngal la yongs su spyod pa'i go rims kyis so //
translated: as the order of the experience of suffering.

original: de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed rnams /
translated: In this regard, the formations that are conditioned by ignorance

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'phen pa'i go rims yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba ni 'phen pa'i go rims yin no //
translated: The condition of the formative forces in relation to consciousness is the order of projection.

original: de la rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa'i rkyen gyis ming dang gzugs /
translated: In this regard, the condition of consciousness in relation to name-and-form,

original: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bya ba ni mngon par 'grub pa'i go rims yin no //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kyi rkyen gyis skye mched drug ces bya ba ni mngon par 'grub pa'i go rims yin no //
translated: and the condition of name-and-form in relation to the six sense-fields is the order of actualization.

original: de la skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa /
analyzed: de la skye mched drug gi rkyen gyis reg pa /
translated: In this regard, the condition of the six sense-fields in relation to contact,

original: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'grub pa'i yul la yongs su spyod pa'i go rims yin no //
analyzed: reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'grub pa'i yul la yongs su spyod pa'i go rims yin no //
translated: and the condition of contact in relation to feeling is the order of the experience of the object of actualization.

original: de la tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa /🔽sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
analyzed: de la tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa / sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa /
translated: In this regard, the condition of feeling in relation to craving,🔽the condition of craving in relation to clinging,

original: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
analyzed: len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa /
translated: the condition of clinging in relation to becoming,

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba /
translated: the condition of becoming in relation to birth,

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la yongs su spyod pa'i go rims yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal la yongs su spyod pa'i go rims yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and the condition of birth in relation to old-age and death is to be known as the order of the experience of suffering.

original: phyogs 'di'i gzhung ni de las mi snang ngo //
analyzed: phyogs 'di'i gzhung ni de las mi snang ngo //
translated: The text does not appear in this section.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdas sa'i rgyal po 'char byed las brtsams nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdas sa'i rgyal po 'char byed las brtsams nas /

analyzed: bdas sa'i rgyal po 'char byed bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song nas /

analyzed: btsun pa 'di na dge sbyong dang / bram ze kha cig @151a * //
translated: “Venerable One, here some ascetics and brahmins

analyzed: bdag ga la ba der mchis nas / bdag la mngon sum du yang dag pa ma lags pa dang / de kho na ma lags pa'i skyon dag gis sma 'bebs par bgyid de /

original: yang dag pa ma lags pa dang / de kho na ma lags pa'i skyon dag gis sma 'bebs par bgyid pa na /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma lags pa dang / de kho na ma lags pa'i skyon dag gis sma 'bebs par bgyid pa na /

analyzed: bdag la sems zhum pa ma skyes lags so //

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /

original: gzhan yang dge sbyong dang ; bram ze kha cig bdag ga la ba der mchis nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang dge sbyong dang ; bram ze kha cig bdag ga la ba der mchis nas /
translated: Furthermore, some ascetics and brahmins come to me and

analyzed: bdag la mngon sum du yang dag pa ma lags pa dang / de kho na ma lags pa'i yon tan dag gis spro bar bgyid de /

original: yang dag pa ma lags pa dang / de kho na ma lags pa'i yon tan dag gis spro bar bgyid pa na yang bdag la dga' ba dang yid bde ba dang sems yeng yeng ba nyid ma skyes lags so //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma lags pa dang / de kho na ma lags pa'i yon tan dag gis spro bar bgyid pa na yang bdag la dga' ba dang yid bde ba dang sems yeng yeng ba nyid ma skyes lags so //
translated: When they do so, I do not feel joy, delight, or mental elation.

original: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i slad du zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

analyzed: 'di ltar bdag gis yang dag pa ma la lags pa dang / de kho na ma lags pa'i yon tan de dag bdag la so sor brtags na /

original: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba'i slad du'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rjes su ma mthong ba'i slad du'o //
translated: I do not see them as real.

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze de dag slar mchis nas bdag gcig pu dben par mchis pa na sems la sems kyis yongs su rtog pa 'di lta bu skyes lags te /
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze de dag slar mchis nas bdag gcig pu dben par mchis pa na sems la sems kyis yongs su rtog pa 'di lta bu skyes lags te /
translated: When those ascetics and brahmins have left, I am alone in solitude and my mind thinks this:

analyzed: gal te bdag gis rgyal po'i skyon yang dag pa dag 'tshal bar gyur cing /
translated: If I were to know the king’s faults and

analyzed: rgyal po'i yon tan yang dag pa dag kyang 'tshal bar gyur na /
translated: if I were to know the king’s good qualities,

original: bdag gis rgyal po'i skyon rnams ni mngon par spangs la rgyal po'i yon tan rnams ni yang dag par blang bar bgyi na /🔽gang bdag la rgyal po'i skyon yang dag pa dang / rgyal po'i yon tan yang dag pa dag rgya cher yang dag par ston par rngo thogs pa'i dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: bdag gis rgyal po'i skyon rnams ni mngon par spangs la rgyal po'i yon tan rnams ni yang dag par blang bar bgyi na / gang bdag la rgyal po'i skyon yang dag pa dang / rgyal po'i yon tan yang dag pa dag rgya cher yang dag par ston par rngo thogs pa'i dge sbyong ngam /
translated: then I would have to abandon the king’s faults and adopt the king’s good qualities.

original: bram ze de gang lags snyam pa de lta bu'i sems kyis yongs su rtog pa skyes lags so //
analyzed: bram ze de gang lags snyam pa de lta bu'i sems kyis yongs su rtog pa skyes lags so //
translated: So I thought, ‘Who is the ascetic or brahmin who is able to teach me in detail the king’s faults and the king’s good qualities?’

original: de nas bdag 'di snyam du sems par gyur lags te /
analyzed: de nas bdag 'di snyam du sems par gyur lags te /
translated: With such thoughts, I began to contemplate.

original: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das 'di ni thams cad mkhyen pa /
translated: Then I thought, ‘The Blessed One is omniscient,

original: thams cad gzigs pa lags pas /
analyzed: thams cad gzigs pa lags pas /
translated: he is all-seeing,

original: des ni rgyal po'i skyon yang dag pa dag dang / @151b rgyal po'i yon tan yang dag pa dag mkhyen gyi /
analyzed: des ni rgyal po'i skyon yang dag pa dag dang / @151b rgyal po'i yon tan yang dag pa dag mkhyen gyi /
translated: He knows the true faults of kings and the true qualities of kings.

original: bdag bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar mchis te /
analyzed: bdag bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar mchis te /
translated: I have come into the presence of the Blessed One

original: don de nyid yongs su zhu'o snyam du sems par gyur lags pas /
analyzed: don de nyid yongs su zhu'o snyam du sems par gyur lags pas /
translated: to ask about this very matter.

original: bcom ldan 'das la bdag don de nyid yongs su zhu lags so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la bdag don de nyid yongs su zhu lags so //
translated: I ask the Blessed One about this very matter.

original: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i skyon yang dag pa dang ; rgyal po'i yon tan yang dag pa de dag gang lags /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i skyon yang dag pa dang ; rgyal po'i yon tan yang dag pa de dag gang lags /
translated: Blessed One, what are the true faults of kings and the true qualities of kings?”

original: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bad sa'i rgyal po 'char byed la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: de skad ces gsol pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis bad sa'i rgyal po 'char byed la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One said to King Udayin of Vatsa:

original: rgyal po chen po de'i phyir khyod kyis rgyal po'i skyon dag kyang rig par bya /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po de'i phyir khyod kyis rgyal po'i skyon dag kyang rig par bya /
translated: “Great King, for that reason you should know the faults of kings

original: rgyal po'i yon tan dag kyang rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rgyal po'i yon tan dag kyang rig par bya ste /
translated: and you should know the qualities of kings.

original: rgyal pos ni nyams pa'i sgo dag kyang rig par bya /
analyzed: rgyal pos ni nyams pa'i sgo dag kyang rig par bya /
translated: A king should know the doors to decline

original: thabs kyi sgo dag kyang rig par bya /
analyzed: thabs kyi sgo dag kyang rig par bya /
translated: and he should know the doors to skillful means.

original: 'dod pa'i chos dag kyang rig par bya /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i chos dag kyang rig par bya /
translated: One should know the qualities that are desired.

original: 'dod pa 'dren par byed pa'i chos dag kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa 'dren par byed pa'i chos dag kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know the qualities that lead to desire.

original: de la rgyal po'i skyon rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rgyal po'i skyon rnams gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the faults of a king?

original: rgyal po chen po bcu po 'di dag ni rgyal po'i skyon dag yin te /
analyzed: rgyal po chen po bcu po 'di dag ni rgyal po'i skyon dag yin te /
translated: Great King, there are ten faults of a king.

original: de dag dang ldan na rgyal po longs spyod che zhing rtsa 'jing che la 'khor mang du zin kyang /
analyzed: de dag dang ldan na rgyal po longs spyod che zhing rtsa 'jing che la 'khor mang du zin kyang /
translated: If a king has them, even if he has great wealth, a great family, and a great retinue,

original: skyabs kyi 'os ma yin zhing skyabs su 'gyur ba'i 'os ma yin no //
analyzed: skyabs kyi 'os ma yin zhing skyabs su 'gyur ba'i 'os ma yin no //
translated: he is not a fit refuge and is not a refuge for others.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: rigs mi btsun pa yin /
analyzed: rigs mi btsun pa yin /
translated: He is of low caste.

original: rang dbang med pa yin ;🔽rang bzhin gyis gtum pa yin /
analyzed: rang dbang med pa yin ; rang bzhin gyis gtum pa yin /
translated: He is not independent.🔽He is naturally violent.

original: 'khrugs pa'i shas che ba yin /
analyzed: 'khrugs pa'i shas che ba yin /
translated: He is very agitated.

original: bya dga' chung ba yin /
analyzed: bya dga' chung ba yin /
translated: He has little generosity.

original: dam pa ma yin pa rnams kyi ngag nyan pa yin /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa rnams kyi ngag nyan pa yin /
