original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: They are these:🔽the people’s affection,🔽mastery,🔽subjugation of enemies,🔽physical well-being,🔽and rebirth in a happy realm.🔽What are the five things that a king desires, finds attractive, enjoys, and delights in?🔽They are these:

original: skye dgu rjes su dga' ba dang / dbang phyug gi bdag po dang / dgra 'dul ba dang / lus la phan pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba ste lnga po de dag ni rgyal po'i 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang yid du 'ong bar bya ba'i chos dag yin no //
analyzed: skye dgu rjes su dga' ba dang / dbang phyug gi bdag po dang / dgra 'dul ba dang / lus la phan pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba ste lnga po de dag ni rgyal po'i 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang yid du 'ong bar bya ba'i chos dag yin no //
translated: the people’s affection,🔽mastery,🔽subjugation of enemies,🔽physical well-being,🔽and rebirth in a happy realm.🔽What are the five things that a king desires, finds attractive, enjoys, and delights in?

original: 'dod pa 'dren par byed pa'i chos dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pa 'dren par byed pa'i chos dag gang zhe na /
translated: They are these:🔽the people’s affection,🔽mastery,🔽subjugation of enemies,🔽physical well-being,🔽and rebirth in a happy realm.🔽What are the five things that a king desires, finds attractive, enjoys, and delights in?🔽They are these:🔽the people’s affection,

original: lnga po 'di dag ni rgyal po'i 'dod pa 'dren par byed pa'i chos rnams yin te /
analyzed: lnga po 'di dag ni rgyal po'i 'dod pa 'dren par byed pa'i chos rnams yin te /
translated: mastery,🔽subjugation of enemies,🔽physical well-being,🔽and rebirth in a happy realm.🔽What are the five things that a king desires, finds attractive, enjoys, and delights in?

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: They are these:🔽the people’s affection,🔽mastery,

original: skye dgu yongs su skyong ba dang / sgrub phod pa dang ; thabs shes pa dang / yul la legs par yongs su longs spyod pa dang / chos spyod pa'o //
analyzed: skye dgu yongs su skyong ba dang / sgrub phod pa dang ; thabs shes pa dang / yul la legs par yongs su longs spyod pa dang / chos spyod pa'o //
translated: He protects the people, he is generous, he is skillful, he enjoys his possessions well, and he practices the Dharma.

original: ji ltar na rgyal po skye dgu yongs su skyong bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rgyal po skye dgu yongs su skyong bar byed ce na /
translated: How does the king protect the people?

original: 'di la rgyal po dang po kho nar chog shes pa dang / log pa'i chags pas ma dkris pa dang / longs spyod 'du ba'i @158b sgo bzang po yod pas ci nas kyang longs spyod pa sag cing spel bar 'dod kyi yongs su mi tshol mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: 'di la rgyal po dang po kho nar chog shes pa dang / log pa'i chags pas ma dkris pa dang / longs spyod 'du ba'i @158b sgo bzang po yod pas ci nas kyang longs spyod pa sag cing spel bar 'dod kyi yongs su mi tshol mi byed pa dang /
translated: The king is content from the beginning and is not entangled in wrong desires. He has a good source of income and wishes to increase his wealth by spending it.

original: gzhan yang rgyal po brkam chags mi byed pa dang / chags pa med pa'i dkar po'i chos dang ldan pa dang / de ci nus ci lcogs kyis rang gi mdzod dang bang ba nas rang gi nor phyung ste nor med pa dang / longs spyod dang bral zhing gnas pa dag la sbyin par byed pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyal po brkam chags mi byed pa dang / chags pa med pa'i dkar po'i chos dang ldan pa dang / de ci nus ci lcogs kyis rang gi mdzod dang bang ba nas rang gi nor phyung ste nor med pa dang / longs spyod dang bral zhing gnas pa dag la sbyin par byed pa dang /
translated: Moreover, the king is not greedy, he is not attached, he possesses the bright qualities, and he gives as much as he can from his own treasury and granary to those who are without wealth and who are destitute.

original: gzhan yang rgyal po des pa dang / bzod pa dang ldan zhing grong gi mi rnams la tshig gi lam 'jam po dag gis kun du rjod par byed pa dang / de dag la dus dus su longs spyod kyi bgo bsha' dang / 'tsho ba'i bgo bsha' rkyen du 'bab pa dag byed pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyal po des pa dang / bzod pa dang ldan zhing grong gi mi rnams la tshig gi lam 'jam po dag gis kun du rjod par byed pa dang / de dag la dus dus su longs spyod kyi bgo bsha' dang / 'tsho ba'i bgo bsha' rkyen du 'bab pa dag byed pa dang /
translated: Moreover, the king is gentle and patient and speaks to the citizens with soft words. He shares his wealth and his livelihood with them from time to time.🔽He does not assign them impossible tasks, nor does he assign them bad tasks, nor does he assign them tasks that are too big.

original: de dag mi nus pa'i las su bsko bar mi byed pa dang / las ngan par bsko bar mi byed pa dang / las ha cang chen por bsko bar mi byed pa dang / de dag gi nyes pa dang / 'gal ba bzod par 'os pa dag bzod par byed pa dang /
analyzed: de dag mi nus pa'i las su bsko bar mi byed pa dang / las ngan par bsko bar mi byed pa dang / las ha cang chen por bsko bar mi byed pa dang / de dag gi nyes pa dang / 'gal ba bzod par 'os pa dag bzod par byed pa dang /
translated: He forgives the faults and transgressions that are forgivable,

original: nyes pa dang 'gal ba bden pa bzod par mi 'os pa de dag kyang dus dus su nyes pa dang mthun pa'i khrims dang sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: nyes pa dang 'gal ba bden pa bzod par mi 'os pa de dag kyang dus dus su nyes pa dang mthun pa'i khrims dang sbyor bar byed de /
translated: and he punishes those faults and transgressions that are not forgivable with a punishment that is appropriate to the offense.

original: de ltar na rgyal po skye dgu legs par yongs su skyong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyal po skye dgu legs par yongs su skyong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the king properly cares for living beings.

original: de ltar skye dgu legs par yongs su skyong ba 'di yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: de ltar skye dgu legs par yongs su skyong ba 'di yang dag par blangs te /
translated: In this way, he properly takes up the protection of living beings.

original: legs par spyad na /
analyzed: legs par spyad na /
translated: If he practices well,

original: skye dgu rjes su dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye dgu rjes su dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: living beings will be happy.

original: sgrub phod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub phod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is being able to accomplish?

original: 'di la rgyal po mkhas pa dang / le lo med pa dang / sgrub phod pa yin zhing /
analyzed: 'di la rgyal po mkhas pa dang / le lo med pa dang / sgrub phod pa yin zhing /
translated: Here the king is skilled, not lazy, and able to accomplish [his goals].

original: de ma phebs pa ni 'bebs par byed /
analyzed: de ma phebs pa ni 'bebs par byed /
translated: He subdues those who are not subdued.

original: phebs pa ni srung bar byed pa dang / las kyi mtha' rgya chen po la sbyor ba nas /
analyzed: phebs pa ni srung bar byed pa dang / las kyi mtha' rgya chen po la sbyor ba nas /
translated: He protects those who are subdued. He engages in vast activities.

original: snga ma bzhin du cho lo dang rgyan dor gyi nyes rtsom gyi bar la shin tu ma zhugs pa dang / skye dgu rnams kyi tshul dang / tshul ma yin pa'i 'jug pa yongs su brtag pa la brtson pa dang / chad pas gcad par 'os pa rnams kyang legs par chad pas gcod par byed pa dang /
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du cho lo dang rgyan dor gyi nyes rtsom gyi bar la shin tu ma zhugs pa dang / skye dgu rnams kyi tshul dang / tshul ma yin pa'i 'jug pa yongs su brtag pa la brtson pa dang / chad pas gcad par 'os pa rnams kyang legs par chad pas gcod par byed pa dang /
translated: He is not at all involved in the faults of gambling, games, and frivolous distractions. He is diligent in investigating the proper and improper activities of living beings. He punishes those who deserve to be punished.

original: phan gdags par 'os pa rnams la yang phan 'dogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: phan gdags par 'os pa rnams la yang phan 'dogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: He also helps those who deserve to be helped.

original: de ltar na rgyal po bsgrub phod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyal po bsgrub phod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, a king is one who is capable of ruling.

original: de ltar bsgrub phod pa 'di yang dag par blangs te legs par spyad na dbang phyug gi bdag por 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bsgrub phod pa 'di yang dag par blangs te legs par spyad na dbang phyug gi bdag por 'gyur ro //
translated: And if he is capable of ruling and he properly undertakes and practices this, he will become a lord of sovereignty.

original: thabs shes pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: thabs shes pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is a king’s skill in means?

original: 'di la rgyal po dga' bar bya ba dga' ba @159a * //
analyzed: 'di la rgyal po dga' bar bya ba dga' ba @159a * //
translated: Here, a king properly applies himself to delighting those who should be delighted,

original: bsgrub pa'i don dag la legs pa kho nar dga' bar sbyor bar byed pa nas /
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i don dag la legs pa kho nar dga' bar sbyor bar byed pa nas /
translated: to accomplishing the aims of those who should be satisfied,

original: rgyas par snga ma bzhin du /
analyzed: rgyas par snga ma bzhin du /
translated: and so on, as described above,

original: mthu dang ldan pa'i phyogs yongs su gzung bar bya ba mthu dang ldan pa'i phyogs yongs su gzung ba bsgrub pa'i don gyi bar dag la yang /🔽legs pa kho nar mthu dang ldan pa'i phyogs yongs su gzung ba'i phyir sbyor bar byed de /
analyzed: mthu dang ldan pa'i phyogs yongs su gzung bar bya ba mthu dang ldan pa'i phyogs yongs su gzung ba bsgrub pa'i don gyi bar dag la yang / legs pa kho nar mthu dang ldan pa'i phyogs yongs su gzung ba'i phyir sbyor bar byed de /
translated: up to properly applying himself to taking care of those who are powerful and to accomplishing the aims of those who are taken care of.

original: de ltar na rgyal po thabs shes pa yin no //🔽de ltar thabs shes pa ni yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyal po thabs shes pa yin no // de ltar thabs shes pa ni yang dag par blangs te /
translated: Thus, a king is one who is skilled in means.

original: legs par spyad na dgra thul bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: legs par spyad na dgra thul bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And if he is skilled in means and he properly undertakes and practices this, he will become a king who has conquered his enemies.

original: yul la legs par yongs su longs spyod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: yul la legs par yongs su longs spyod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the correct enjoyment of objects?

original: 'di la rgyal po longs spyod rnams kyi 'du ba dang 'god pa gzhal nas /
analyzed: 'di la rgyal po longs spyod rnams kyi 'du ba dang 'god pa gzhal nas /
translated: Here a king, having calculated the income and expenses of his enjoyments,

original: ha cang chung ba yang ma yin /
analyzed: ha cang chung ba yang ma yin /
translated: does not live with too few enjoyments🔽and does not live with too many enjoyments.🔽He has great enjoyments, various enjoyments, and enjoyments that are suitable for the time of year.

original: ha cang che ba yang ma yin par ran pas 'tsho bar byed pa dang / longs spyod chen po dang ldan pa dang / longs spyod sna tshogs dang ldan pa dang / dus tshigs kyi tshe ji lta ba bzhin du brten par bya ba'i longs spyod dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: ha cang che ba yang ma yin par ran pas 'tsho bar byed pa dang / longs spyod chen po dang ldan pa dang / longs spyod sna tshogs dang ldan pa dang / dus tshigs kyi tshe ji lta ba bzhin du brten par bya ba'i longs spyod dang ldan pa dang /
translated: He has enjoyments that are shared with his retinue, enjoyments that are shared with his servants, enjoyments that are shared with his friends, and enjoyments that are shared with his relatives.

original: 'khor dang bcas pa dang / g-yog 'khor dang bcas pa'i longs spyod dang ldan pa dang / gnas bzang po'i longs spyod dang ldan pa dang / bro gar dang glu dang sil snyan dang rol mo dang bcas pa'i longs spyod dang ldan pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i longs spyod dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'khor dang bcas pa dang / g-yog 'khor dang bcas pa'i longs spyod dang ldan pa dang / gnas bzang po'i longs spyod dang ldan pa dang / bro gar dang glu dang sil snyan dang rol mo dang bcas pa'i longs spyod dang ldan pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa'i longs spyod dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: He has enjoyments that are shared with his city-dwellers, enjoyments that are shared with his country-dwellers, enjoyments that are shared with his ministers, enjoyments that are shared with his army, and enjoyments that are shared with his harem.

original: de la kha na ma tho ba med pa'i longs spyod ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la kha na ma tho ba med pa'i longs spyod ni 'di yin te /
translated: The king’s enjoyment of the land is irreproachable when🔽he eats what is suitable and avoids what is unsuitable when he is sick and in pain;

original: nad kyis btab cing gnod pa'i tshe 'phrod pa za zhing mi 'phrod pa yang yongs su spong ba dang bde bar gnas pa'i tshe yang zhu nas za'i /🔽ma zhu bar mi za ba dang / lhan cig tu za ba rnams tshogs te 'brim pa na /🔽gzhan dag bskrad cing bstsal nas /
analyzed: nad kyis btab cing gnod pa'i tshe 'phrod pa za zhing mi 'phrod pa yang yongs su spong ba dang bde bar gnas pa'i tshe yang zhu nas za'i / ma zhu bar mi za ba dang / lhan cig tu za ba rnams tshogs te 'brim pa na / gzhan dag bskrad cing bstsal nas /
translated: when he eats only after he is well;🔽when he does not eat alone while others are being sent away;

original: bdag gcig pu bzang po mi za ba ste /
analyzed: bdag gcig pu bzang po mi za ba ste /
translated: and when he does not eat fine food while others do not even have that.

original: de ltar na rgyal po yul la legs par longs spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyal po yul la legs par longs spyod pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the king enjoys the land.

original: de ltar yul la legs par yongs su longs spyod pa 'di yang dag par blangs te /
analyzed: de ltar yul la legs par yongs su longs spyod pa 'di yang dag par blangs te /
translated: If he takes up and practices this enjoyment of the land,

original: legs par spyad na lus la phan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: legs par spyad na lus la phan par 'gyur ro //
translated: it will be beneficial for his body.

original: chos spyod pa gang zhe na ;
analyzed: chos spyod pa gang zhe na ;
translated: What is the practice of the Dharma?

original: 'di la rgyal po dad pa dang ldan pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / thos pa dang ldan pa dang / gtong ba dang ldan pa dang / shes rab dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la rgyal po dad pa dang ldan pa dang / tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / thos pa dang ldan pa dang / gtong ba dang ldan pa dang / shes rab dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Here, the king is endowed with faith, morality, learning, generosity, and wisdom.

original: ji ltar na dad pa dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dad pa dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he endowed with faith?

original: 'di la rgyal po 'jig rten pha rol la mngon par dad pa dang / las dge ba dang @159b mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa phyis tshe phyi ma la 'dod pa dang mi 'dod par gyur pa la mngon par dad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la rgyal po 'jig rten pha rol la mngon par dad pa dang / las dge ba dang @159b mi dge ba rnams kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa phyis tshe phyi ma la 'dod pa dang mi 'dod par gyur pa la mngon par dad pa yin te /
translated: Here, the king has faith in the world beyond, and has faith in the desirable and undesirable results of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions in future lives.

original: de ltar na dad pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dad pa dang ldan pa yin no //

analyzed: rgyal po chen po de'i phyir khyod kyis 'di ltar bslab par bya ste /

original: rgyal po'i skyon gang dag yin pa rnams ni spangs la /
analyzed: rgyal po'i skyon gang dag yin pa rnams ni spangs la /
translated: ‘I will abandon the faults of kings,

analyzed: rgyal po'i yon tan rnams ni yang dag blang bar bya'o //
translated: and I will properly adopt the qualities of kings.

analyzed: rgyal po chen po khyod kyis de ltar bslab par bya'o zhes gsungs zhes kyang grag go //

translated: With regard to the statement, “In brief, the five aggregates of clinging are suffering,” how is birth suffering?

original: smras pa / rnam pa lngas te /
analyzed: smras pa / rnam pa lngas te /
translated: It is said to be suffering in five ways:

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / mi 'dod bzhin du 'bral ba'i chos @160b can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir dang / mi 'dod bzhin du 'bral ba'i chos @160b can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is associated with suffering, because it is associated with corruption, because it is the basis of suffering, because it is the basis of afflictions, and because it is the nature of being separated from what is not desired.

original: de la ji ltar na skye ba sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na skye ba sdug bsngal dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: How is it that birth is associated with suffering?🔽

original: sdug bsngal yin zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yin zhe na /
translated: How is birth suffering because it is associated with suffering?

original: 'di lta ste sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / gcig tu sdug bsngal ba'i yi dags rnams dang de bzhin du mngal nas skye ba dang / sgo nga las skye ba'i skyes gnas su skye ba'i'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste sems can dmyal ba rnams dang / gcig tu sdug bsngal ba'i yi dags rnams dang de bzhin du mngal nas skye ba dang / sgo nga las skye ba'i skyes gnas su skye ba'i'o //
translated: It is like the suffering of the hells, the suffering of the hungry ghosts who are tormented by a single suffering, and the suffering of those born in the womb and those born from eggs.

original: ji ltar na gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin zhe na /
translated: How is it suffering because it is associated with negative conditioning?

original: smras pa / khams gsum pa'i 'du byed thams cad ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i phyir las su mi rung ba dang dbang bsgyur ba ma yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / khams gsum pa'i 'du byed thams cad ni nyon mongs pa'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i phyir las su mi rung ba dang dbang bsgyur ba ma yin la /
translated: It is said that all the formations of the three realms are associated with negative conditioning that is favorable to the side of affliction, and therefore they are unworkable and not under control.

original: khams gsum na spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi 'du byed mngon par 'grub par yang de dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid yin pas /
analyzed: khams gsum na spyod pa'i sems can rnams kyi 'du byed mngon par 'grub par yang de dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid yin pas /
translated: The formation of the sentient beings who experience the three realms is also associated with that.

original: de'i phyir gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnas ngan len dang ldan pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that it is suffering because it is associated with negative conditioning.

original: ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi gnas yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin zhe na /
translated: How is it suffering because it is the basis of suffering?

original: smras pa / rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bye brag rnams kyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / rga ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bye brag rnams kyi gnas su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: because it is the basis of the various kinds of suffering such as old age.

original: ji ltar na nyon mongs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na nyon mongs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin zhe na /
translated: How is it suffering because it is the basis of the afflictions?

original: smras pa / 'di ltar skyes shing byung ba ni yul kun du chags par 'gyur ba rnams la yang kun du chags par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar skyes shing byung ba ni yul kun du chags par 'gyur ba rnams la yang kun du chags par 'gyur zhing /
translated: It is said: because, having been born and arisen, one becomes attached to objects of attachment,

original: kun du zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba rnams la yang kun du zhe sdang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: kun du zhe sdang bar 'gyur ba rnams la yang kun du zhe sdang bar 'gyur /
translated: one becomes averse to objects of aversion,

original: kun du rmongs par 'gyur ba rnams la yang kun du rmongs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: kun du rmongs par 'gyur ba rnams la yang kun du rmongs par 'gyur la /
translated: and one becomes confused about objects of confusion.

original: gzhi de las lus dang sems rab tu ma zhi zhing sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: gzhi de las lus dang sems rab tu ma zhi zhing sdug bsngal te /
translated: On that basis, the body and mind are not tranquil and are suffering.

original: bde ba la reg par mi gnas pas /
analyzed: bde ba la reg par mi gnas pas /
translated: One does not abide in contact with pleasure.

original: de lta bas na nyon mongs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na nyon mongs pa'i gnas yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called suffering because it is the basis of the afflictions.

original: ji ltar na mi 'dod bzhin du 'brel pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mi 'dod bzhin du 'brel pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin zhe na /
translated: How is it suffering because of the nature of unwanted contact?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / 'di ltar sems can skyes pa thams cad kyi 'chi ba dang / skyes pa rnams kyi 'chi ba'i dus byed pa ni gson pa'i mtha' 'chi ba dang / tha mar 'chi ba yin pa'i phyir de yang de dag gi mi 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ltar sems can skyes pa thams cad kyi 'chi ba dang / skyes pa rnams kyi 'chi ba'i dus byed pa ni gson pa'i mtha' 'chi ba dang / tha mar 'chi ba yin pa'i phyir de yang de dag gi mi 'dod pa yin la /
translated: Thus, for all sentient beings who are born, death is certain, and for those who are born, the time of death is the end of life.

original: gzhi des kyang sdug bsngal kho na nyams su myong bar byed pas /
analyzed: gzhi des kyang sdug bsngal kho na nyams su myong bar byed pas /
translated: Since that is also unwanted by them, and since they experience only suffering on that basis,

original: de lta bas na skye ba ni mi 'dod bzhin du 'bral ba'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin no //🔽rga ba yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal ba nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na skye ba ni mi 'dod bzhin du 'bral ba'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin no // rga ba yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal ba nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: birth is suffering because of the nature of unwanted separation.🔽Aging is also suffering in five ways.

original: 'di lta ste gnas lnga yongs su nyams pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di lta ste gnas lnga yongs su nyams pa'i phyir te /
translated: It should be understood as suffering because of the degeneration of five states.

original: @161a * // gzugs bzang ba yongs su nyams pa'i phyir dang / mthu stobs yongs su nyams pa'i phyir dang / dbang po yongs su nyams pa'i phyir dang / yul la longs spyod yongs su nyams pa'i phyir dang / tshe yongs su nyams pa'i phyir ro //🔽na ba yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal ba nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: @161a * // gzugs bzang ba yongs su nyams pa'i phyir dang / mthu stobs yongs su nyams pa'i phyir dang / dbang po yongs su nyams pa'i phyir dang / yul la longs spyod yongs su nyams pa'i phyir dang / tshe yongs su nyams pa'i phyir ro // na ba yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal ba nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: because of the loss of a good figure, the loss of strength, the loss of faculties, the loss of enjoyment of objects, and the loss of life.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Sickness should be understood as suffering in five ways:

original: lus kyi rang bzhin 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba mngon par 'phel zhing de la shas che bar gnas pa'i phyir dang / yul gyi longs spyod yid du 'ong ba mi 'dod pa'i phyir dang / yul gyi longs spyod yid du mi 'ong ba la mi 'dod bzhin du yongs su spyad dgos pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: lus kyi rang bzhin 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba mngon par 'phel zhing de la shas che bar gnas pa'i phyir dang / yul gyi longs spyod yid du 'ong ba mi 'dod pa'i phyir dang / yul gyi longs spyod yid du mi 'ong ba la mi 'dod bzhin du yongs su spyad dgos pa'i phyir dang /
translated: because of the change in the nature of the body, because of the increase and intensification of pain and mental anguish, because of the loss of desire for enjoyable objects, because of the necessity of resorting to disagreeable and enjoyable objects,

original: srog gi dbang po dang 'bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po dang 'bral bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and because of the separation from life.

original: 'chi ba yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal ba nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal ba nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Death is also suffering due to five aspects.

original: longs spyod sdug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang 'bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / rtsa 'jing sdug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang 'bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / 'khor sdug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang 'bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / lus sdug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang 'bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang /
analyzed: longs spyod sdug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang 'bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / rtsa 'jing sdug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang 'bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / 'khor sdug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang 'bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang / lus sdug pa phun sum tshogs pa dang 'bral ba nyid kyi phyir dang /
translated: Because of the separation from what is pleasant, such as the enjoyment of wealth, the enjoyment of friends and relatives, the enjoyment of one’s retinue, and the enjoyment of one’s body.

original: 'chi ba'i tshe sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba rab tu drag po nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i tshe sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba rab tu drag po nyams su myong bar 'gyur ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: And because at the time of death one experiences extremely intense suffering and mental anguish.

original: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The experience of what is unpleasant is also suffering due to five aspects.

original: de dang phrad pas sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba nyid kyi phyir dang / chad pas 'jigs pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir dang / tshigs su bcad pa med pas 'jigs pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir dang / nyam nga bzhin du 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir dang /
analyzed: de dang phrad pas sdug bsngal dang yid mi bde ba nyid kyi phyir dang / chad pas 'jigs pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir dang / tshigs su bcad pa med pas 'jigs pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir dang / nyam nga bzhin du 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir dang /
translated: Because of the suffering and mental dissatisfaction that comes from meeting with them, because of the fear of punishment, because of the fear of not being praised, because of the fear of dying in a state of confusion,

original: chos las 'gal bas ngan 'gros 'jigs pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: chos las 'gal bas ngan 'gros 'jigs pa'i gnas nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: and because of the fear of bad rebirths due to violating the Dharma.

original: sdug pa dang bral ba yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: sdug pa dang bral ba yang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Separation from what is pleasant should be recognized as suffering in five ways:

original: de dang bral bas mya ngan skye ba nyid kyi phyir dang / de bzhin du smre sngags 'don pa nyid kyi phyir dang / de bzhin du lus la gnod pa nyid kyi phyir dang / yon tan rnams las rjes su dran zhing 'dod pas yid yongs su gdung ba nyid kyi phyir dang /
analyzed: de dang bral bas mya ngan skye ba nyid kyi phyir dang / de bzhin du smre sngags 'don pa nyid kyi phyir dang / de bzhin du lus la gnod pa nyid kyi phyir dang / yon tan rnams las rjes su dran zhing 'dod pas yid yongs su gdung ba nyid kyi phyir dang /
translated: because of the grief that comes from being separated from it, because of the lamentation that comes from being separated from it, because of the physical pain that comes from being separated from it, because of the mental anguish that comes from recollecting and desiring the good qualities of what one is separated from,

original: de'i longs spyod ma tshang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i longs spyod ma tshang ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: and because of the incompleteness of one’s enjoyment of it.

original: sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gang 'dod @161b pa btsal te mi rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal ba nyid kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal nyid ji lta ba bzhin du gang 'dod @161b pa btsal te mi rnyed pa de yang sdug bsngal ba nyid kyang de bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: The suffering of being separated from what is pleasant should be understood in the same way as the suffering of not obtaining what one desires.

original: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba nyid kyang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga sdug bsngal ba nyid kyang rnam pa lngas sdug bsngal nyid yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, the five appropriated aggregates are suffering in five ways:

original: mngon par 'grub pa'i sdug bsngal nyid kyi snod yin pa'i phyir dang / mngon par 'grub pa la brten pa'i sdug bsngal gyi snod nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi snod nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi snod nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa'i sdug bsngal nyid kyi snod yin pa'i phyir dang / mngon par 'grub pa la brten pa'i sdug bsngal gyi snod nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / sdug bsngal gyi sdug bsngal gyi snod nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gyi snod nyid yin pa'i phyir dang /
translated: they are the basis of the suffering of the formation of existence, they are the basis of the suffering of the formation of non-existence, they are the basis of the suffering of suffering, they are the basis of the suffering of change,

original: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and they are the nature of the suffering of conditioned states.

original: skyes bu gsum po skyes bu tha ma dang skyes bu 'bring dang / skyes bu mchog 'di dag ni sgrub pa las brtsams pa ste /🔽de la gang bdag la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: skyes bu gsum po skyes bu tha ma dang skyes bu 'bring dang / skyes bu mchog 'di dag ni sgrub pa las brtsams pa ste / de la gang bdag la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa yang ma yin la /
translated: The three types of persons are the inferior person, the middling person, and the superior person.

original: gzhan la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa yang ma yin pa de ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //🔽de la gang bdag la phan pa'i phyir zhugs la /🔽gzhan la phan pa'i phyir ma yin pa dang / gang gzhan la phan pa'i phyir zhugs la /
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa yang ma yin pa de ni skyes bu tha ma yin no // de la gang bdag la phan pa'i phyir zhugs la / gzhan la phan pa'i phyir ma yin pa dang / gang gzhan la phan pa'i phyir zhugs la /
translated: The inferior person is one who does not strive for his or her own benefit and does not strive for the benefit of others.

original: bdag la phan pa'i phyir ma yin pa de ni skyes bu bar ma yin no //🔽de la gang bdag la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa yang yin la /
analyzed: bdag la phan pa'i phyir ma yin pa de ni skyes bu bar ma yin no // de la gang bdag la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa yang yin la /
translated: The middling person is one who strives for his or her own benefit but does not strive for the benefit of others, and one who strives for the benefit of others but does not strive for his or her own benefit.

original: gzhan la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa yang yin pa de ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa'i phyir zhugs pa yang yin pa de ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
translated: The superior person is one who strives for his or her own benefit and also strives for the benefit of others.

original: gzhan yang gang zag bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zag bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of persons:

original: gang zag sdig pa byed la sdig pa la mi sred pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gang zag sdig pa byed la sdig pa la mi sred pa yang yod do //
translated: There is the person who commits evil deeds and does not delight in evil deeds.

original: sdig pa la sred la sdig pa mi byed pa yang yod do //
analyzed: sdig pa la sred la sdig pa mi byed pa yang yod do //
translated: There are those who do not commit evil deeds but crave evil.

original: sdig pa byed la sdig pa la sred pa yang yod do //
analyzed: sdig pa byed la sdig pa la sred pa yang yod do //
translated: There are those who commit evil deeds and crave evil.

original: gang zag sdig pa mi byed la sdig pa la mi sred pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gang zag sdig pa mi byed la sdig pa la mi sred pa yang yod do //
translated: There are those who do not commit evil deeds and do not crave evil.

original: de la gang sdig pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa phyi ma la mi 'dod par 'gyur ba la mngon par dad la /
analyzed: de la gang sdig pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa phyi ma la mi 'dod par 'gyur ba la mngon par dad la /
translated: Among them, those who do not desire the ripening of the results of evil in the future, but

original: brjed ngas pa dang / bag med pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po dang bsten pas sdig pa byed pa de ni sdig pa byed la sdig pa la mi sred pa yin no //
analyzed: brjed ngas pa dang / bag med pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po dang bsten pas sdig pa byed pa de ni sdig pa byed la sdig pa la mi sred pa yin no //
translated: commit evil deeds due to forgetfulness, carelessness, and associating with evil friends, they commit evil deeds but do not crave evil.

original: gang sngon sdig pa la goms pas sdig pa la kun du dga' ba dang / sdig pa la mngon par dga' ba dang / sdig pa la dga' bas yid bsdus pa yin la /
analyzed: gang sngon sdig pa la goms pas sdig pa la kun du dga' ba dang / sdig pa la mngon par dga' ba dang / sdig pa la dga' bas yid bsdus pa yin la /
translated: Those who, due to habituation to evil in the past, delight in evil, take pleasure in evil, and are absorbed in delighting in evil,

original: de yang skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten nas /
analyzed: de yang skyes bu dam pa la brten pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa la brten nas /
translated: but due to relying on holy beings, listening to the true Dharma, and properly attending to the mind,

original: sdig pa'i 'bras bu phyi ma la mi 'dod par 'gyur ba yang dag par rjes su mthong bas /
analyzed: sdig pa'i 'bras bu phyi ma la mi 'dod par 'gyur ba yang dag par rjes su mthong bas /
translated: He sees that the result of evil is undesirable in the next world.

original: @162a * // so sor brtags shing so sor brtags nas sdig pa las phyir log pa de ni /
analyzed: @162a * // so sor brtags shing so sor brtags nas sdig pa las phyir log pa de ni /
translated: Having examined and investigated, he turns away from evil.

original: sdig pa la sred la sdig pa mi byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa la sred la sdig pa mi byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He is called “one who does not do evil and does not delight in evil.”

original: gang zag gang rang bzhin gyis sdig pa la mngon par dga' la /🔽sdig pa las phyir log pa yang ma yin pa de ni sdig pa byed la /
analyzed: gang zag gang rang bzhin gyis sdig pa la mngon par dga' la / sdig pa las phyir log pa yang ma yin pa de ni sdig pa byed la /
translated: The person who naturally delights in evil🔽and does not turn away from evil is called “one who does evil

original: sdig pa la sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa la sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and delights in evil.”

original: gang rang bzhin gyis sdig pa la mngon par mi dga' la /🔽sdig pa las kyang phyir log pa de ni sdig pa mi byed la /
analyzed: gang rang bzhin gyis sdig pa la mngon par mi dga' la / sdig pa las kyang phyir log pa de ni sdig pa mi byed la /
translated: The person who naturally does not delight in evil🔽and turns away from evil is called “one who does not do evil

original: sdig pa la mi sred pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa la mi sred pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and does not delight in evil.”

original: de la gang zag gang sdig pa byed la sdig pa la srid pa de ni skyes bu tha ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang zag gang sdig pa byed la sdig pa la srid pa de ni skyes bu tha ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Among them, the person who does evil and delights in evil should be seen as the worst person.

original: gang zag gang sdig pa byed la /
analyzed: gang zag gang sdig pa byed la /
translated: The person who does evil🔽and does not delight in evil,

original: sdig pa la mi sred pa dang / sdig pa la sred la /
analyzed: sdig pa la mi sred pa dang / sdig pa la sred la /
translated: and the person who does not do evil and delights in evil,

original: sdig pa mi byed pa de ni skyes bu 'bring yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi byed pa de ni skyes bu 'bring yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The person who does not commit evil should be regarded as an intermediate person.

original: gang zag gang sdig pa la mi sred la sdig pa mi byed pa de ni skyes bu mchog yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang zag gang sdig pa la mi sred la sdig pa mi byed pa de ni skyes bu mchog yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The person who does not delight in evil and does not commit evil should be regarded as a superior person.

original: gzhan yang gang zag rgyal po gsum ste /🔽gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zag rgyal po gsum ste / gsum gang zhe na /
translated: “There are three kinds of persons,

original: 'dod pa'i longs spyod lhur len pa dang / bya ba lhur len pa dang / chos lhur len pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i longs spyod lhur len pa dang / bya ba lhur len pa dang / chos lhur len pa'o //
translated: namely, those who delight in sensual pleasures, those who delight in action, and those who delight in the Dharma.

original: de la dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
translated: The first is an inferior person.

original: gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //🔽gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no // gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
translated: The second is an intermediate person.🔽The third is a superior person.

original: gzhan yang gang zag gsum ste /🔽gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zag gsum ste / gsum gang zhe na /
translated: “There are three kinds of persons,

original: bya ba ma yin pa rang gi bya bar byed pa dang / bya ba rang gi bya bar byed pa dang / gzhan gyi bya ba rang gi bya bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa rang gi bya bar byed pa dang / bya ba rang gi bya bar byed pa dang / gzhan gyi bya ba rang gi bya bar byed pa'o //
translated: namely, those who do what should not be done, those who do what should be done, and those who do what should not be done and what should be done.

original: de la gang zag gang sdig pa'i spyod pas 'tsho bar byed pa de ni bya ba ma yin pa rang gi bya ba byed pa'i gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la gang zag gang sdig pa'i spyod pas 'tsho bar byed pa de ni bya ba ma yin pa rang gi bya ba byed pa'i gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: The person who lives by sinful conduct is called the person who does what should not be done.

original: gang sdig pa'i spyod pas 'jigs shing /
analyzed: gang sdig pa'i spyod pas 'jigs shing /
translated: The person who is afraid of sinful conduct

original: dge ba'i spyod pa yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa de ni bya ba rang gi bya bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i spyod pa yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa de ni bya ba rang gi bya bar byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: and who, having taken up virtuous conduct, remains in it, is called the person who does what should be done.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan gyi bya ba rang gi bya bar byed pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni gzhan gyi bya ba rang gi bya bar byed pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should be seen as the person who does what should be done for others.

original: de la gang zag dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
analyzed: de la gang zag dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
translated: Among these, the first person is the lowest person.

original: gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
translated: The second is the middling person.

original: gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The third is the highest person.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni rgyal po'i phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni rgyal po'i phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: There are three kinds of royal success:

original: rnam par smin pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / skyes bu'i rtsal phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa phun sum tshogs pa dang / skyes bu'i rtsal phun sum tshogs pa dang / bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: success in ripening, success in human effort, and success in merit.

original: rgyal po phyug po'i khyim du skyes shing tshe ring ba dang / nad nyung ba dang / dbang che bar @162b grags pa dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni de'i rnam par smin pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal po phyug po'i khyim du skyes shing tshe ring ba dang / nad nyung ba dang / dbang che bar @162b grags pa dang / yid gzhungs pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa gang yin pa de ni de'i rnam par smin pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The perfection of his karmic maturation is that he is born into a family that is wealthy and has a high social status, that he has a long life, that he has few illnesses, that he is famous, that he is intelligent, and that he has the wisdom that comes naturally.

original: rgyal po thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i sgrub phod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang rtag par rgyun du ldan pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rgyal po thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i sgrub phod pa phun sum tshogs pa dang rtag par rgyun du ldan pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The perfection of his power is that he is always and continuously endowed with the power that comes from his skill in means.

original: de'i skyes bu'i rtsal phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i skyes bu'i rtsal phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the perfection of his power.

original: rgyal po chos dang ldan zhing chos la dga' chos la gnas la /
analyzed: rgyal po chos dang ldan zhing chos la dga' chos la gnas la /
translated: The perfection of his sovereignty is that he is righteous, delights in the Dharma, and is established in the Dharma.

original: btsun mo'i 'khor dang / gzhon nu rnams dang / gros grogs rnams dang / khrom gyi ru sna dang / grong rdal gyi mi rnams dang / yul gyi mi rnams dang lhan cig tu sbyin pa dag sbyin pa dang ; bsod nams dag byed pa dang /
analyzed: btsun mo'i 'khor dang / gzhon nu rnams dang / gros grogs rnams dang / khrom gyi ru sna dang / grong rdal gyi mi rnams dang / yul gyi mi rnams dang lhan cig tu sbyin pa dag sbyin pa dang ; bsod nams dag byed pa dang /
translated: He gives gifts, makes merit, and observes the Uposadha precepts together with his harem, princes, ministers, army officers, townspeople, and country people.

original: bsnyen gnas la gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa gang yin pa de ni de'i bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen gnas la gnas pa dang / tshul khrims yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa gang yin pa de ni de'i bsod nams phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called his perfection of merit.

original: de la rnam par smin pa phun sum tshogs pas ni sngon gyi las dge ba'i 'bras bu la yongs su spyod par byed do //
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa phun sum tshogs pas ni sngon gyi las dge ba'i 'bras bu la yongs su spyod par byed do //
translated: By the perfection of his karma, he enjoys the fruits of his previous virtuous actions.

original: skyes bu'i rtsal phun sum tshogs pas ni tshe 'di pa nyid kyi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu la yongs su spyod par byed do //
analyzed: skyes bu'i rtsal phun sum tshogs pas ni tshe 'di pa nyid kyi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu la yongs su spyod par byed do //
translated: By the perfection of his human abilities, he enjoys the fruits of his present desires.

original: bsod nams phun sum tshogs pas ni phyi ma la yang las dge ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa phun sum tshogs pa la yongs su spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams phun sum tshogs pas ni phyi ma la yang las dge ba'i 'bras bu rnam par smin pa phun sum tshogs pa la yongs su spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: By the excellence of his merit, he will enjoy in the future the excellent results of his good actions.

original: gang la phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum char yang med pa de ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //🔽gang la rnam par smin pa phun sum tshogs pa'am /🔽skyes bu'i rtsal phun sum tshogs pa'am /
analyzed: gang la phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum char yang med pa de ni skyes bu tha ma yin no // gang la rnam par smin pa phun sum tshogs pa'am / skyes bu'i rtsal phun sum tshogs pa'am /
translated: He who has none of the three excellences is the lowest person.

original: gnyi ga phun sum tshogs par yod pa de ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga phun sum tshogs par yod pa de ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
translated: He who has the excellence of results or the excellence of human effort or both is the middling person.

original: gang la phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum char yod pa de ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
analyzed: gang la phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum char yod pa de ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
translated: He who has all three excellences is the highest person.

original: rgyal po'i tshal za ni gsum ste gus pa dang ldan la nus pa dang mi ldan shes rab dang mi ldan pa dang / gus pa dang yang ldan nus pa dang yang ldan la shes rab dang mi ldan pa dang gus pa dang yang ldan nus pa dang yang ldan shes rab dang yang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'i tshal za ni gsum ste gus pa dang ldan la nus pa dang mi ldan shes rab dang mi ldan pa dang / gus pa dang yang ldan nus pa dang yang ldan la shes rab dang mi ldan pa dang gus pa dang yang ldan nus pa dang yang ldan shes rab dang yang ldan pa'o //
translated: There are three types of kings: the one who is devoted but not capable and not wise, the one who is devoted and capable but not wise, and the one who is devoted, capable, and wise.

original: de la dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
translated: The first is the lowest type of person.

original: gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
translated: The second is the middling type of person.

original: gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
translated: The third is the highest type of person.

original: gus pa dang yang mi ldan /
analyzed: gus pa dang yang mi ldan /
translated: The one who is not devoted,

original: nus pa dang yang mi ldan /
analyzed: nus pa dang yang mi ldan /
translated: not capable,

original: shes rab dang yang mi ldan pa gang yin pa de ni tha ma bas kyang ches tha ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab dang yang mi ldan pa gang yin pa de ni tha ma bas kyang ches tha ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: and not wise should be known as even lower than the lowest.

original: tshig gi rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: tshig gi rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four types of speech:

original: mi snyan @163a * //
analyzed: mi snyan @163a * //
translated: unpleasant,

original: pa la snyan par grags pa dang / snyan pa la mi snyan par grags pa dang / mi snyan pa la mi snyan par grags pa dang / snyan pa la snyan par grags pa'o //
analyzed: pa la snyan par grags pa dang / snyan pa la mi snyan par grags pa dang / mi snyan pa la mi snyan par grags pa dang / snyan pa la snyan par grags pa'o //
translated: The first is to be famous for what is unpleasant. The second is to be famous for what is unpleasant. The third is to be famous for what is pleasant. The fourth is to be famous for what is pleasant.🔽🔽

original: tshig dang yi ge 'jam zhing snyan la mi 'phrod pa gang yin pa de ni dang po yin no //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge 'jam zhing snyan la mi 'phrod pa gang yin pa de ni dang po yin no //
translated: The first is to speak words and syllables that are smooth, pleasant, and agreeable.

original: tshig dang yi ge rtsub la 'phrod pa gang yin pa de ni gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge rtsub la 'phrod pa gang yin pa de ni gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The second is to speak words and syllables that are rough, but agreeable.

original: tshig dang yi ge yang rtsub la mi 'phrod pa gang yin pa de ni gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge yang rtsub la mi 'phrod pa gang yin pa de ni gsum pa yin no //
translated: The third is to speak words and syllables that are rough and disagreeable.

original: tshig dang yi ge yang 'jam zhing snyan la 'phrod pa gang yin pa de ni bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: tshig dang yi ge yang 'jam zhing snyan la 'phrod pa gang yin pa de ni bzhi pa yin no //
translated: The fourth is to speak words and syllables that are smooth, pleasant, and agreeable.

original: de la mi snyan pa la mi snyan par grags pa'i tshig smra ba gang yin pa dang / mi snyan la snyan par grags pa'i tshig smra ba gang yin pa de ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
analyzed: de la mi snyan pa la mi snyan par grags pa'i tshig smra ba gang yin pa dang / mi snyan la snyan par grags pa'i tshig smra ba gang yin pa de ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
translated: Among these, the one who speaks words and syllables that are rough and disagreeable, and the one who speaks words and syllables that are rough but agreeable, are inferior persons.

original: snyan la mi snyan par grags pa'i tshig smra ba gang yin pa de ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
analyzed: snyan la mi snyan par grags pa'i tshig smra ba gang yin pa de ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
translated: The person of middling capacity is one who speaks words that are pleasant but unpleasant to hear.

original: snyan la snyan par grags pa'i tshig smra ba gang yin pa de ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
analyzed: snyan la snyan par grags pa'i tshig smra ba gang yin pa de ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
translated: The person of superior capacity is one who speaks words that are pleasant and pleasant to hear.

original: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa ni gsum ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of people who enjoy sense pleasures:

original: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa gang chos ma yin pas bab col du longs spyod pa dag yang dag par bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa gang chos ma yin pas bab col du longs spyod pa dag yang dag par bsgrubs nas /
translated: There are those who enjoy sense pleasures who, having accumulated wealth through unrighteous and improper means,

original: bdag nyid kyang legs par bde bar tshim par mi byed la bu yang ma yin chung ma yang ma yin pa nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang legs par bde bar tshim par mi byed la bu yang ma yin chung ma yang ma yin pa nas /
translated: do not satisfy themselves with good things and do not give to their children, spouse,

original: rgyas pa dge sbyong dang bram ze'i bar dag la yang yon 'bul bar mi byed pa yang yod do //
analyzed: rgyas pa dge sbyong dang bram ze'i bar dag la yang yon 'bul bar mi byed pa yang yod do //
translated: or servants, and do not make offerings to ascetics and brahmins.

original: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa gang chos dang chos ma yin pas bab chol dang / bab chol ma yin par longs spyod dag yang dag par bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa gang chos dang chos ma yin pas bab chol dang / bab chol ma yin par longs spyod dag yang dag par bsgrubs nas /
translated: There are those who enjoy sense pleasures who, having accumulated wealth through righteous and unrighteous means, both proper and improper,

original: bdag nyid kyang legs par bde bas tshim par byed /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang legs par bde bas tshim par byed /
translated: satisfy themselves with good things and give to their children, spouse,🔽and servants, but do not make offerings to ascetics and brahmins.

original: bu dang chung ma nas rgyas par mdza' bshes dang / gros grogs dang / nye du dang / rgan rabs kyi bar dag kyang legs par bde bas tshim par byed la /
analyzed: bu dang chung ma nas rgyas par mdza' bshes dang / gros grogs dang / nye du dang / rgan rabs kyi bar dag kyang legs par bde bas tshim par byed la /
translated: He satisfies his sons and wives, and so on up to: his friends, companions, relatives, and elders.

original: dge sbyong dang bram ze dag la ni yon 'bul bar mi byed pa yang yod do //
analyzed: dge sbyong dang bram ze dag la ni yon 'bul bar mi byed pa yang yod do //
translated: But he does not make offerings to ascetics and brahmins.

original: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa gang yin gcig tu chos kyi bab col ma yin pa kho nar longs spyod yang dag par bsgrubs nas /
analyzed: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa gang yin gcig tu chos kyi bab col ma yin pa kho nar longs spyod yang dag par bsgrubs nas /
translated: There is the one who enjoys sense pleasures, but only in a way that is not contrary to the Dharma, and who does so after properly acquiring them.

original: bdag nyid kyang legs par bde bas tshim par byed la ;
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang legs par bde bas tshim par byed la ;
translated: He satisfies himself with good things,

original: rgyas par dge sbyong dang bram ze'i bar dag la yang yon 'bul bar byed pa yang yod de /
analyzed: rgyas par dge sbyong dang bram ze'i bar dag la yang yon 'bul bar byed pa yang yod de /
translated: and he makes offerings to ascetics and brahmins, and so on up to: his friends, companions, relatives, and elders.

original: de la 'dod pa la longs spyod pa dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa la longs spyod pa dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
translated: The first person who enjoys sense pleasures is an inferior man.

original: gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
translated: The second is a middling man.

original: gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
translated: The third is a superior man.

original: gang zag gang chags pa dang / zhen pa dang / @163b 'chums pa nas /
analyzed: gang zag gang chags pa dang / zhen pa dang / @163b 'chums pa nas /
translated: The person who is attached, who is clinging, who is infatuated, and so on up to:

original: lhag par chags par gyur pa'i bar gyis zas za bar byed cing nyes dmigs su mi lta la /
analyzed: lhag par chags par gyur pa'i bar gyis zas za bar byed cing nyes dmigs su mi lta la /
translated: They eat food with excessive attachment and do not see the disadvantages of food.

original: nges par 'byung ba rab tu mi shes pa yang yod do //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba rab tu mi shes pa yang yod do //
translated: They do not know how to escape from food.

original: gang zag gang chags pa med pa dang / zhen pa med pa dang / 'chums pa med pa dang / mdud pa bor ba med pa dang / brgyal ba med pa dang / lhag par chags pa med pa dang / lhag par chags par gyur pa med pas so sor brtags shing zas za bar byed la /
analyzed: gang zag gang chags pa med pa dang / zhen pa med pa dang / 'chums pa med pa dang / mdud pa bor ba med pa dang / brgyal ba med pa dang / lhag par chags pa med pa dang / lhag par chags par gyur pa med pas so sor brtags shing zas za bar byed la /
translated: There are individuals who eat food after careful consideration, without attachment, without clinging, without being tied, without being infatuated, without excessive attachment, and without becoming excessively attached.

original: nyes dmigs su yang lta /
analyzed: nyes dmigs su yang lta /
translated: They see the disadvantages of food.

original: nges par 'byung ba yang rab tu shes shing /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba yang rab tu shes shing /
translated: They know how to escape from food.

original: de'i zas spangs pa dang / yongs su shes pa ma yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: de'i zas spangs pa dang / yongs su shes pa ma yin pa yang yod do //
translated: But they have not abandoned food and do not understand it.

original: gang zag gang chags pa med pa nas lhag par chags par gyur ba med pa'i bar gyis /🔽so sor brtags shing zas za bar byed la /
analyzed: gang zag gang chags pa med pa nas lhag par chags par gyur ba med pa'i bar gyis / so sor brtags shing zas za bar byed la /
translated: There are individuals who eat food after careful consideration, without attachment, without clinging, without being tied, without being infatuated, without excessive attachment, and without becoming excessively attached.🔽They see the disadvantages of food.

original: nyes dmigs su yang lta /
analyzed: nyes dmigs su yang lta /
translated: They know how to escape from food.🔽They have abandoned food and understand it.

original: nges par 'byung ba yang rab tu shes shing de'i zas de spangs pa dang / yongs su shes pa yang yod do //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba yang rab tu shes shing de'i zas de spangs pa dang / yongs su shes pa yang yod do //
translated: There is also a person who knows the food that is to be abandoned and the food that is to be fully understood, and who has abandoned and fully understood that food.

original: de la gang zag dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no ;
analyzed: de la gang zag dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no ;
translated: The first person is the inferior person.

original: / gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
analyzed: / gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
translated: The second person is the middling person.

original: gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin no /🔽// / bam po bco brgyad pa /
analyzed: gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin no / // / bam po bco brgyad pa /
translated: The third person is the superior person.

original: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po las brtsams nas gang zag gsum ste /
analyzed: sbyin par bya ba'i dngos po las brtsams nas gang zag gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of persons in regard to the thing that is given.

original: gang zag gang dri phun sum tshogs pa sbyin la /
analyzed: gang zag gang dri phun sum tshogs pa sbyin la /
translated: There is a person who gives the thing that is complete in smell,

original: ro phun sum tshogs pa mi sbyin /
analyzed: ro phun sum tshogs pa mi sbyin /
translated: but does not give the thing that is complete in taste,

original: reg pa phun sum tshogs pa mi sbyin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: reg pa phun sum tshogs pa mi sbyin pa yang yod do //
translated: and does not give the thing that is complete in contact.

original: gang dri phun sum tshogs pa dang ro phun sum tshogs pa sbyin la reg pa phun sum tshogs pa mi sbyin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gang dri phun sum tshogs pa dang ro phun sum tshogs pa sbyin la reg pa phun sum tshogs pa mi sbyin pa yang yod do //
translated: There is a person who gives the thing that is complete in smell and complete in taste, but does not give the thing that is complete in contact.

original: gang dri dang ro dang reg pa phun sum tshogs pa sbyin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gang dri dang ro dang reg pa phun sum tshogs pa sbyin pa yang yod do //
translated: There is a person who gives the thing that is complete in smell, complete in taste, and complete in contact.

original: de la dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
translated: The first person is the inferior person.

original: gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no ;
analyzed: gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no ;
translated: The second is the middling person.

original: / gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: / gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The third is the superior person.

original: sbyin pa'i zhing las brtsams nas gang zag gsum ste /🔽gang zag gang sdug pa'am /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i zhing las brtsams nas gang zag gsum ste / gang zag gang sdug pa'am /
translated: There are three types of persons who practice generosity with respect to the field of generosity.

original: phan 'dogs pa la sbyin par byed pa yang yod do //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa la sbyin par byed pa yang yod do //
translated: There are those who practice generosity to those who are dear and🔽helpful.

original: gang sdug bsngal ba la sbyin par byed pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal ba la sbyin par byed pa yang yod do //
translated: There are those who practice generosity to those who are suffering.

original: gang yon tan dang ldan pa khyad par du 'phags pa la sbyin par byed pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gang yon tan dang ldan pa khyad par du 'phags pa la sbyin par byed pa yang yod do //
translated: There are those who practice generosity to those who are especially virtuous.

original: de la dang po ni tha ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po ni tha ma yin no //
translated: The first is inferior.

original: gnyis pa ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'bring yin no //
translated: The second is middling.

original: gsum pa ni mchog yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni mchog yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The third is superior.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang gang sdug pa la sbyin par byed pa de ni tha ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang gang sdug pa la sbyin par byed pa de ni tha ma yin no //
translated: Another classification is this. Those who practice generosity to those who are dear are inferior.

original: gang phan 'dogs pa la sbyin par byed pa @164a * //
analyzed: gang phan 'dogs pa la sbyin par byed pa @164a * //
translated: Those who practice generosity to those who are helpful

original: de ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'bring yin no //
translated: are middling.

original: gang sdug bsngal ba dang / yon tan dang ldan pa la sbyin par byed pa de ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: gang sdug bsngal ba dang / yon tan dang ldan pa la sbyin par byed pa de ni mchog yin no //
translated: Those who practice generosity to those who are suffering and those who are especially virtuous are superior.

original: sbyin pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa las brtsams nas gang zag gsum ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i lhag pa'i bsam pa las brtsams nas gang zag gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of persons in terms of the superior intention of generosity.

original: sbyin pa'i snga rol nas yid dga' la /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i snga rol nas yid dga' la /
translated: One is happy before giving,

original: sbyin pa'i tshe sems mi dga' zhing /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i tshe sems mi dga' zhing /
translated: is unhappy while giving,🔽and regrets after giving.

original: byin nas 'gyod par gyur ba dang / sbyin pa'i snga rol nas yid dga' zhing /
analyzed: byin nas 'gyod par gyur ba dang / sbyin pa'i snga rol nas yid dga' zhing /
translated: One is happy before giving,

original: sbyin pa'i tshe yang sems dga' la /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i tshe yang sems dga' la /
translated: is happy while giving,🔽and regrets after giving.

original: byin nas 'gyod par gyur pa dang / sbyin pa'i snga rol nas kyang yid dga' zhing /
analyzed: byin nas 'gyod par gyur pa dang / sbyin pa'i snga rol nas kyang yid dga' zhing /
translated: One is happy before giving,

original: sbyin pa'i tshe yang sems dga' la /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i tshe yang sems dga' la /
translated: is happy while giving,

original: byin nas kyang 'gyod par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: byin nas kyang 'gyod par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: and does not regret after giving.

original: de la dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
translated: The first is an inferior person.

original: gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
translated: The second is a middling person.

original: gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
translated: The third is a superior person.

original: tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yang dag par blangs pa las gang zag gsum rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po yang dag par blangs pa las gang zag gsum rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: Three types of persons are also posited in terms of taking up the meritorious action of morality:

original: gang phyogs gcig spangs la /
analyzed: gang phyogs gcig spangs la /
translated: One abandons one part,

original: dus thams cad du spangs pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: dus thams cad du spangs pa yang ma yin /
translated: He does not abandon it at all times.

original: bdag nyid kyis spangs la /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis spangs la /
translated: He abandons it himself,

original: gzhan dag yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: gzhan dag yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa yang ma yin /
translated: but does not induce others to take it up.

original: bsngags pa yang mi brjod /
analyzed: bsngags pa yang mi brjod /
translated: He does not praise it.

original: chos mthun pa ba ma thong na yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur ba de ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
analyzed: chos mthun pa ba ma thong na yid bde bar yang mi 'gyur ba de ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
translated: He is not pleased when he sees someone who is similar to him.

original: gang thams cad spangs shing dus thams cad du spangs pa yang yin la ;🔽de yang bdag nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: gang thams cad spangs shing dus thams cad du spangs pa yang yin la ; de yang bdag nyid yin gyi /
translated: He abandons it completely and at all times.

original: gzhan dag yang dag par 'dzin du mi 'jug la /
analyzed: gzhan dag yang dag par 'dzin du mi 'jug la /
translated: He does not induce others to take it up.

original: bsngags brjod par yang mi byed /
analyzed: bsngags brjod par yang mi byed /
translated: He does not praise it.

original: chos mthun pa pa mthong na yang yid mi dga' bar mi 'gyur ba de ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
analyzed: chos mthun pa pa mthong na yang yid mi dga' bar mi 'gyur ba de ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
translated: He is not pleased when he sees someone who is similar to him.

original: gang thams cad la snang ba de ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
analyzed: gang thams cad la snang ba de ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
translated: He is the best of persons.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par len pa'i gzhi las kyang gang zag gsum rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par len pa'i gzhi las kyang gang zag gsum rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The basis of taking up morality should be understood as the arrangement of three types of persons.

original: nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la tshul khrims yang dag par len pa dang / legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la tshul khrims yang dag par len cing nyams par byed /
analyzed: nyes par bshad pa'i chos 'dul ba la tshul khrims yang dag par len pa dang / legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la tshul khrims yang dag par len cing nyams par byed /
translated: They are those who take up the moral precepts in a badly taught doctrine and discipline, and those who take up the moral precepts in a well taught doctrine and discipline, but then violate them and make them defective.

original: skyon can du byed pa dang / gsum pa ni de nyid la nyams par mi byed /🔽skyon can du mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: skyon can du byed pa dang / gsum pa ni de nyid la nyams par mi byed / skyon can du mi byed pa'o //
translated: The third is those who do not violate them and do not make them defective.

original: de la dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
translated: The first of these is the inferior person.

original: gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
translated: The second is the middling person.

original: gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
translated: The third is the superior person.

original: tshul khrims yang dag par len pa'i bsam pa las kyang gang zag gsum rnam par @164b gzhag ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims yang dag par len pa'i bsam pa las kyang gang zag gsum rnam par @164b gzhag ste /
translated: Three kinds of persons are also distinguished on the basis of their intention to take up the moral precepts.

original: 'tsho ba'i bsam pas yang dag par len par byed pa dang / mtho ris kyi bsam pas yang dag par len par byed pa dang / gsum pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pas yang dag par len par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bsam pas yang dag par len par byed pa dang / mtho ris kyi bsam pas yang dag par len par byed pa dang / gsum pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pas yang dag par len par byed pa'o //
translated: They are those who take up the moral precepts with the intention of making a living, those who take up the moral precepts with the intention of attaining a good rebirth, and those who take up the moral precepts with the intention of attaining nirvana.

original: de la dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
translated: The first of these is the inferior person.

original: gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
translated: The second is the middling person.

original: gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
translated: The third is the superior person.

original: gzhan yang so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa'i gang zag gsum ste /🔽bsnyen gnas pa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang so sor thar pa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa'i gang zag gsum ste / bsnyen gnas pa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa yang yod do //
translated: Moreover, there are three types of persons who have taken up the pratimoksha vows.🔽There are those who have taken up the vows of the one-day vow.

original: dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa yang yod do //
analyzed: dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa yang yod do //
translated: There are those who have taken up the vows of the lay practitioner.

original: dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa yang yod de /
analyzed: dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par blangs nas 'dug pa yang yod de /
translated: There are those who have taken up the vows of the fully ordained monk.

original: de la dang po ni tha ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po ni tha ma yin no //
translated: Among these, the first is the inferior.

original: gnyis pa ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'bring yin no //
translated: The second is the middling.

original: gsum pa ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni mchog yin no //
translated: The third is the superior.

original: dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa nyid las kyang gang zag gzhan gsum ste /
analyzed: dge slong gi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa nyid las kyang gang zag gzhan gsum ste /
translated: Also, from among those who have taken up the vows of the fully ordained monk, there are three other types of persons.

original: gang bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i yan lag dang ldan la de dang mthun pa'i chos bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par blangs pa'i yan lag dang yang mi ldan /
analyzed: gang bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i yan lag dang ldan la de dang mthun pa'i chos bslab pa'i gzhi yang dag par blangs pa'i yan lag dang yang mi ldan /
translated: There are those who have the limbs of full ordination but do not have the limbs of the training precepts that are in harmony with that.

original: gzhan gyi sems rjes su bsrung ba'i yan lag dang yang mi ldan /
analyzed: gzhan gyi sems rjes su bsrung ba'i yan lag dang yang mi ldan /
translated: There are those who do not possess the branch of protecting the minds of others.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi ji ltar yang dag par blangs pa bzhin rjes su bsrung ba'i yan lag dang mi ldan pa yang yod do //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi ji ltar yang dag par blangs pa bzhin rjes su bsrung ba'i yan lag dang mi ldan pa yang yod do //
translated: There are those who do not possess the branch of protecting the bases of training as they have been taken.

original: gang yan lag dang po gsum dang ldan la /
analyzed: gang yan lag dang po gsum dang ldan la /
translated: There are those who possess the first three branches

original: tha ma dang mi ldan pa yang yod do //
analyzed: tha ma dang mi ldan pa yang yod do //
translated: but do not possess the last one.

original: gang yan lag bzhi po thams cad dang ldan pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gang yan lag bzhi po thams cad dang ldan pa yang yod do //
translated: There are those who possess all four branches.

original: de la yang dang po ni tha ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang dang po ni tha ma yin no //
translated: Among them, the first is the least.

original: gnyis pa ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'bring yin no //
translated: The second is middling.

original: gsum pa ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni mchog yin no //
translated: The third is supreme.

original: gzhan yang gang zag gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zag gsum ste /
translated: There are three other types of persons:

original: so so thar pa'i sdom pa dang ldan pa yang yod do //🔽so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang ldan pa yang yod do //
analyzed: so so thar pa'i sdom pa dang ldan pa yang yod do // so sor thar pa'i sdom pa dang / bsam gtan gyi sdom pa dang ldan pa yang yod do //
translated: There are those who possess the pratimokṣa vows.🔽There are those who possess the pratimokṣa vows and the vows of meditative stabilization.

original: so sor thar pa dang bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dag dang ldan pa yang yod do //
analyzed: so sor thar pa dang bsam gtan dang zag pa med pa'i sdom pa dag dang ldan pa yang yod do //
translated: There are those who possess the pratimokṣa vows, the vows of meditative stabilization, and uncontaminated vows.

original: de la dang po ni tha ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dang po ni tha ma yin no //
translated: Among them, the first is the least.

original: gnyis pa ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'bring yin no //
translated: The second is middling.

original: gsum pa ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni mchog yin no //
translated: The third is superior.

original: gzhan yang gang zag gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zag gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, there are three types of persons:

original: sdom pa yang ma yin sdom pa ma yin pas bsdus pa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa dang ldan pa yang yod do //
analyzed: sdom pa yang ma yin sdom pa ma yin pas bsdus pa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa dang ldan pa yang yod do //
translated: There is the one who has taken up the restraint of morality that is neither a vow nor a non-vow.

original: nyan thos dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa dang ldan pa yang yod do //
analyzed: nyan thos dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa dang ldan pa yang yod do //
translated: There is the one who has taken up the restraint of morality of the śrāvaka.

original: @165a * // byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa dang ldan pa yang yod do //
analyzed: @165a * // byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa dang ldan pa yang yod do //
translated: There is the one who has taken up the restraint of morality of the bodhisattva.

original: de la yang dang po ni tha ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang dang po ni tha ma yin no //
translated: Among these, the first is inferior.

original: gnyis pa ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'bring yin no //
translated: The second is middling.

original: gsum pa ni mchog yin no //🔽bsgom pa'i dbang du byas nas 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni mchog yin no // bsgom pa'i dbang du byas nas 'di lta ste /
translated: The third is superior.

original: yid la byed pa'i sbyor ba las gang zag gsum rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa'i sbyor ba las gang zag gsum rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: From the perspective of cultivation, there are three types of persons established in terms of the application of mental attention.

original: gang zag gang nan gyis 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa thob pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gang zag gang nan gyis 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa thob pa yang yod do //
translated: There is the person who has attained mental attention that engages with effort.

original: gang bar chad pa dang bcas par 'jug pa'am gang bar mi chad par 'jug pa yang rung ste /🔽rtsol ba dang bcas pas 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa thob pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gang bar chad pa dang bcas par 'jug pa'am gang bar mi chad par 'jug pa yang rung ste / rtsol ba dang bcas pas 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa thob pa yang yod do //
translated: There is a mental attention that is attained with effort, whether it is an attention that enters with obstacles or an attention that enters without obstacles.

original: rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa thob pa yang yod do //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i yid la byed pa thob pa yang yod do //
translated: There is a mental attention that is attained without effort.

original: de la yang dang po ni tha ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang dang po ni tha ma yin no //
translated: Among these, the first is inferior.

original: gnyis pa ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'bring yin no //
translated: The second is middling.

original: gsum pa ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni mchog yin no //
translated: The third is superior.

original: gzhan yang bsgom pa thob pa las gang zag gsum ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang bsgom pa thob pa las gang zag gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, there are three types of persons who have attained the cultivation.

original: gang zag gang nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas thob la /
analyzed: gang zag gang nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas thob la /
translated: There is a person who has attained inner mental tranquility,

original: chos la rnam par lta ba'i lhag pa'i shes rab ma thob pa yang yod do //
