analyzed: chos la rnam par lta ba'i lhag pa'i shes rab ma thob pa yang yod do //
translated: but has not attained the insight that views the dharmas.

original: gang chos la rnam par lta ba'i lhag pa'i shes rab thob la nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas ma thob pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gang chos la rnam par lta ba'i lhag pa'i shes rab thob la nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas ma thob pa yang yod do //
translated: There is a person who has attained the insight that views the dharmas, but has not attained inner mental tranquility.

original: gang gnyi ga thob pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gang gnyi ga thob pa yang yod do //
translated: There is a person who has attained both.

original: de la yang dang po ni tha ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang dang po ni tha ma yin no //
translated: Among these, the first is inferior.

original: gnyis pa ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'bring yin no //
translated: The second is middling.

original: gsum pa ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni mchog yin no //
translated: the third is the best.🔽There are three other persons:

original: gzhan yang gang zag gsum ste rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gzhan yang gang zag gsum ste rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa yang yod do //
translated: one who has attained concentration with applied thought and sustained thought;

original: rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin thob pa yang yod do //
analyzed: rtog pa med la dpyod pa tsam gyi ting nge 'dzin thob pa yang yod do //
translated: one who has attained concentration without applied thought, but with sustained thought;

original: rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa yang yod do //
analyzed: rtog pa yang med dpyod pa yang med pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa yang yod do //
translated: one who has attained concentration without applied thought and without sustained thought.

original: de la yang dang po ni tha ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang dang po ni tha ma yin no //
translated: Among these, the first is the worst;

original: gnyis pa ni 'bring yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni 'bring yin no //
translated: the second is middling;

original: gsum pa ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni mchog yin no //
translated: the third is the best.

original: bsgom pa kho na'i dbang du byas nas gnas pa las gang zag rnam par gzhag pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa kho na'i dbang du byas nas gnas pa las gang zag rnam par gzhag pa gsum ste /
translated: Three persons are distinguished according to meditation alone:

original: gang zag gang nyon mongs pa can gyi bsam gtan gyis gnas pa yang yod do //
analyzed: gang zag gang nyon mongs pa can gyi bsam gtan gyis gnas pa yang yod do //
translated: one who dwells in defiled concentration;

original: dag pa'i 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan gyis gnas pa yang yod do //
analyzed: dag pa'i 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan gyis gnas pa yang yod do //
translated: one who dwells in pure mundane concentration;

original: zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan gyis gnas pa yang yod do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i bsam gtan gyis gnas pa yang yod do //
translated: one who dwells in undefiled concentration.

original: de la yang dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang dang po ni skyes bu tha ma yin no //
translated: Among these, the first is the worst;

original: gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni skyes bu 'bring yin no //
translated: The second is for the person of medium scope.

original: gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
analyzed: gsum pa ni skyes bu mchog yin no //
translated: The third is for the person of great scope.

original: sems can gyi ris bcu ni dud 'gro dang / bud med dang / @165b 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams dang / bya ba don du gnyer ba rnams dang / rab tu byung ba rnams dang / thos pas 'tsho ba rnams dang / rtogs par byed pa rnams dang /
analyzed: sems can gyi ris bcu ni dud 'gro dang / bud med dang / @165b 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams dang / bya ba don du gnyer ba rnams dang / rab tu byung ba rnams dang / thos pas 'tsho ba rnams dang / rtogs par byed pa rnams dang /
translated: The ten types of sentient beings are: animals, women, those who enjoy sense objects, those who strive for action, those who have gone forth, those who live by learning, those who are engaged in understanding,

original: rtog ge ba rnams dang / dka' thub drag po ba rnams dang / lus gtong bar byed pa rnams te /
analyzed: rtog ge ba rnams dang / dka' thub drag po ba rnams dang / lus gtong bar byed pa rnams te /
translated: those who are logicians, those who are engaged in severe austerities, and those who give up their bodies.

original: de dag gi 'dod pa dang sdug pa dang yid du 'ong ba'i chos ni tshe dang kha dog dang longs spyod dang / mdza' bshes dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa dang / shes rab dang / chos dang /
analyzed: de dag gi 'dod pa dang sdug pa dang yid du 'ong ba'i chos ni tshe dang kha dog dang longs spyod dang / mdza' bshes dang / tshul khrims dang / thos pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa dang / shes rab dang / chos dang /
translated: Their desires, loves, and pleasing things are: life, complexion, wealth, friends, morality, learning, pure conduct, wisdom, the Dharma,🔽and heaven. These are the ten.

original: mtho ris te bcu po de dag go / dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i skyon ni drug po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: mtho ris te bcu po de dag go / dam pa'i chos nyan pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i skyon ni drug po 'di dag yin te /
translated: There are six faults of the secondary mental afflictions for listening to the sublime teachings.

original: nga rgyal gyi skyon dang / 'dun pa med pa'i skyon dang / ma dad pa'i skyon dang / lus dang sems la gnod pa'i skyon dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon dang / rnam par 'phrul pa'i skyon no //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyi skyon dang / 'dun pa med pa'i skyon dang / ma dad pa'i skyon dang / lus dang sems la gnod pa'i skyon dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon dang / rnam par 'phrul pa'i skyon no //
translated: the fault of pride, the fault of lack of aspiration, the fault of lack of faith, the fault of harm to body and mind, the fault of distraction, and the fault of magical creation.

original: de dag gis ni gus par byas shing chos nyan par mi byed /
analyzed: de dag gis ni gus par byas shing chos nyan par mi byed /
translated: By these, one does not listen to the Dharma with respect.

original: bla mar byas shing chos nyan par mi byed de /
analyzed: bla mar byas shing chos nyan par mi byed de /
translated: One does not listen to the Dharma with reverence.

original: rgyas par mdo las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyas par mdo las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: This is explained in detail in the sutra.

original: de la nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam par g-yeng ba'i skyon rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Among these, the fault of distraction is twofold:

original: smra ba'i tshe na rnam par g-yeng ba dang / smras nas rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: smra ba'i tshe na rnam par g-yeng ba dang / smras nas rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: distraction while speaking and distraction after speaking.

original: rnam par 'phrul ba'i skyon ni phyin ci log gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'phrul ba'i skyon ni phyin ci log gang yin pa'o //
translated: The fault of magical creation is any perversion.

original: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: las kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa kun nas slong ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The afflictions of action are the three motivations.

original: mtshungs par ldan pas kun nas slong ba dang / skyed pas kun nas slong ba dang / bdag pos kun nas slong ba ste /
analyzed: mtshungs par ldan pas kun nas slong ba dang / skyed pas kun nas slong ba dang / bdag pos kun nas slong ba ste /
translated: 1. instigation by association, 2. instigation by generation, 3. instigation by sovereignty.

original: nyon mongs pa gzhan drangs nas kun nas slong bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gzhan drangs nas kun nas slong bar byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because it instigates by drawing along other defilements.

original: mi 'dod pa ni drung po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa ni drung po 'di dag yin te /
translated: The unpleasant is the opposite of that.

original: dgra dang / nad dang / yul mi dga' ba dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / sman tsha ba dang / goms par ma byas pa'i dge ba'o //
analyzed: dgra dang / nad dang / yul mi dga' ba dang / skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang / sman tsha ba dang / goms par ma byas pa'i dge ba'o //
translated: The unpleasant is the suffering of the enemies, the suffering of the diseases, the suffering of the unpleasant countries, the suffering of birth, etc., the suffering of the bitter medicines, and the suffering of the virtues not practiced.

original: de dag las gzhi ni yongs su spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag las gzhi ni yongs su spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Of these, the basis is to be avoided.

original: gnyis ni bsten par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ni bsten par bya ba yin no //
translated: The other two are to be cultivated.

original: 'dod pa'i longs spyod ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i longs spyod ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The enjoyments of the desire realm are of five kinds:

original: so sor myong bar bya ba'i longs spyod dang ; yongs su srel na dga' ba'i longs spyod dang / rnam par rtog pa'i longs spyod dang / gzhan las thob pa'i longs spyod dang / legs par ma zin pa'i longs spyod do //
analyzed: so sor myong bar bya ba'i longs spyod dang ; yongs su srel na dga' ba'i longs spyod dang / rnam par rtog pa'i longs spyod dang / gzhan las thob pa'i longs spyod dang / legs par ma zin pa'i longs spyod do //
translated: enjoyments to be experienced individually, enjoyments to be enjoyed by giving, enjoyments to be imagined, enjoyments to be obtained from others, and enjoyments to be well grasped.

original: 'dod pa'i skyon ni rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i skyon ni rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: The faults of desire are of eight kinds:

original: ro myong ba chung ba dang / sdug bsngal mang ba dang / nyes dmigs @166a * //
analyzed: ro myong ba chung ba dang / sdug bsngal mang ba dang / nyes dmigs @166a * //
translated: weak enjoyment, much suffering, many dangers,

original: mang ba dang / gzhan gyi gnod pa byas pa las gyur pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyis longs spyod pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang kun du 'khrug pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa dang /
analyzed: mang ba dang / gzhan gyi gnod pa byas pa las gyur pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyis longs spyod pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / ngan song ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa dang / rnam par rtog pa dang kun du 'khrug pa'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa dang /
translated: the cause of the suffering that comes from the harm of others, the cause of enjoyment that is defiled, the cause of the suffering of the unfortunate realms, the cause of the suffering of discursive thought and disturbance,

original: longs spyod yongs su zad pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / gnas su gzhag pa yongs su zad pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / dge ba'i bar du gcod pa'i rgyu yin pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod yongs su zad pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / gnas su gzhag pa yongs su zad pa'i rgyu yin pa dang / dge ba'i bar du gcod pa'i rgyu yin pa'o //
translated: the cause of the exhaustion of wealth, the cause of the exhaustion of the good qualities that are the bases of enjoyment, and the cause of the exhaustion of the good qualities that are not the bases of enjoyment.

original: 'dod pa'i gzhi las 'gyur ba rnam pa drug ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gzhi las 'gyur ba rnam pa drug ste /
translated: The six changes that come from the basis of desire are:

original: gzhan gyi gnod pas 'gyur ba dang / khams ma snyoms bar 'gyur ba dang ; sems can sdug pa 'gyur ba dang / lus 'gyur pa dang / sems 'gyur ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gnod pas 'gyur ba dang / khams ma snyoms bar 'gyur ba dang ; sems can sdug pa 'gyur ba dang / lus 'gyur pa dang / sems 'gyur ba dang / mi rtag pa nyid kyis 'gyur ba'o //
translated: 1. change due to the harm of others, 2. change due to the imbalance of the elements, 3. change due to the suffering of beings, 4. change due to the body, 5. change due to the mind, and 6. change due to impermanence.

original: 'dod pa rnams la chos mthun pa rnam pa lngas nags tshal gyi ming du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams la chos mthun pa rnam pa lngas nags tshal gyi ming du rig par bya ste /
translated: The five kinds of similarity to a forest should be understood as the similarity of sense-objects to a forest.

original: mang ba nyid du chos mthun pa dang / sna tshogs nyid du chos mthun pa dang / sems can nye bar 'tsho ba nyid du chos mthun pa dang / gnas nyid du chos mthun pa dang / 'phel 'grib can nyid du chos mthun pas so //
analyzed: mang ba nyid du chos mthun pa dang / sna tshogs nyid du chos mthun pa dang / sems can nye bar 'tsho ba nyid du chos mthun pa dang / gnas nyid du chos mthun pa dang / 'phel 'grib can nyid du chos mthun pas so //
translated: The similarity of being numerous, the similarity of being various, the similarity of being the support of beings, the similarity of being a dwelling place, and the similarity of being subject to increase and decrease.

original: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i sa gsum gyi rnam par gtan la dbab pa rdzogs te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas shing dpyod pa dang bcas pa la sogs pa'i sa gsum gyi rnam par gtan la dbab pa rdzogs te /
translated: The three stages of the realm of desire, etc., have been fully determined.

original: de la yang la lar rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung ni mi snang ngo /
analyzed: de la yang la lar rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung ni mi snang ngo /
translated: In some places, the text of the determination is not seen.

original: // / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni /
analyzed: // / mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni /
translated: The ascertainment of the stage of meditative concentration is as follows.

original: gang zag gang dag gi sems kyi rgyud nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa du mas nye bar nyon mongs par gyur pa de dag ni legs pa kho nar sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg par 'gyur ba'i skal pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zag gang dag gi sems kyi rgyud nye ba'i nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa du mas nye bar nyon mongs par gyur pa de dag ni legs pa kho nar sems rtse gcig pa nyid la reg par 'gyur ba'i skal pa med pa yin no //
translated: Those whose mental continuum is afflicted by many types of secondary mental afflictions are not at all fortunate to attain the one-pointed mind.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa du ma dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa du ma dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the many types of secondary mental afflictions?

original: g-yo dang ldan pa dang / sgu  dang ldan pa dang / gya gyu dang ldan pa dang / gcom sgyu dang ldan pa dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / ma dad pa dang / le lo can dang / brjed ngas pa dang /
analyzed: g-yo dang ldan pa dang / sgu  dang ldan pa dang / gya gyu dang ldan pa dang / gcom sgyu dang ldan pa dang / ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa dang / ma dad pa dang / le lo can dang / brjed ngas pa dang /
translated: They are: deceit, guile, dishonesty, hypocrisy, shamelessness, lack of embarrassment, lack of faith, laziness, forgetfulness,

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / shes rab 'chal pa dang / lhod pa dang / mang po pa dang / blang bar bya la thog mar 'gro ba dang / rab tu dben pa la brtson pa btang ba dang / bslab pa dag la shas cher gus pa med pa dang /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa dang / shes rab 'chal pa dang / lhod pa dang / mang po pa dang / blang bar bya la thog mar 'gro ba dang / rab tu dben pa la brtson pa btang ba dang / bslab pa dag la shas cher gus pa med pa dang /
translated: They are: those who are not in meditative equipoise, those who have faulty wisdom, those who are lax, those who are distracted, those who are preoccupied with what should be adopted, those who have abandoned striving for solitude, those who have little respect for the trainings,

original: dge sbyong gi tshul la mi lta ba dang / 'tsho ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung la mya ngan las 'da' ba'i @166b bsam pas ma yin pa dag go //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul la mi lta ba dang / 'tsho ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung la mya ngan las 'da' ba'i @166b bsam pas ma yin pa dag go //
translated: those who do not look to the way of spiritual practitioners, and those who have gone forth with the intention of making a living, not with the intention of attaining nirvana.

original: de la ji ltar na g-yo dang ldan pa yin zhe na /🔽bdag nyid skyon dang ldan yang ston pa'i spyan snga'am /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na g-yo dang ldan pa yin zhe na / bdag nyid skyon dang ldan yang ston pa'i spyan snga'am /
translated: How are they deceitful?🔽Even though they have faults, they do not reveal themselves as they are to the Teacher,

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyi drung du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjod par mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyi drung du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rjod par mi byed pa yin no //
translated: or to those who are wise and who practice pure conduct.

original: ji ltar na sgyu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sgyu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How are they fraudulent?

original: de ci nas kyang bdag nyid yon tan dang mi ldan yang yon tan dang ldan par tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams yid ches pa dang / nges par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ci nas kyang bdag nyid yon tan dang mi ldan yang yon tan dang ldan par tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams yid ches pa dang / nges par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order that the wise spiritual friends may come to trust and understand that you are endowed with good qualities even though you are not,🔽

original: bdag nyid kyi yon tan yang dag pa ma yin pa dag nye bar ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi yon tan yang dag pa ma yin pa dag nye bar ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: In order to make the wise spiritual friends believe and understand that he is endowed with good qualities, even though he is not, he displays his good qualities.

original: ji ltar na gya gyu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gya gyu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he crooked?

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims las tshul khrims nyams pa'am /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims las tshul khrims nyams pa'am /
translated: When he is accused of a fault in morality or a fault in conduct,

original: spyod pa las spyod pa nyams pa la mthong ba dang thos pa dang / dogs pas glengs pa na /
analyzed: spyod pa las spyod pa nyams pa la mthong ba dang thos pa dang / dogs pas glengs pa na /
translated: whether he has seen, heard, or suspects that he has been accused,

original: gtam rlung skur bar byed cing gtan gzhan du sgyur bar byed pa ste /🔽rgyas par 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gtam rlung skur bar byed cing gtan gzhan du sgyur bar byed pa ste / rgyas par 'di lta ste /
translated: he denies it and changes the subject.

original: mdo las sgyu dang g-yo nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mdo las sgyu dang g-yo nyid kyi dbang du mdzad nas ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is explained in detail in the sutra, in the passage dealing with deceit and crookedness.

original: ji ltar na gcom sgyu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gcom sgyu dang ldan pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he deceitful?🔽When he is afraid of being found out,

original: 'jigs pa'am / ngo bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'jigs pa'am / ngo bya ba'am /
translated: or when he is ashamed,

original: zang zing cung zad tsam gyi phyir gzhan dag gi nyes pa chen po rjod par mi byed gleng bar mi byed cing /
analyzed: zang zing cung zad tsam gyi phyir gzhan dag gi nyes pa chen po rjod par mi byed gleng bar mi byed cing /
translated: He does not speak of or proclaim the great faults of others for the sake of a slight material gain.

original: bsam pa thag pa nas ni ma yin pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams la bcos ma'i rjes dang gus pa dang / lus dang ngag gi las 'jam pos kun du spyod pa yin no //🔽ji ltar na ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: bsam pa thag pa nas ni ma yin pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams la bcos ma'i rjes dang gus pa dang / lus dang ngag gi las 'jam pos kun du spyod pa yin no // ji ltar na ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa yin zhe na /
translated: He does not do so with a hostile intention, nor does he do so with a sincere mind. He is respectful and deferential to the wise who are his companions in the celibate life, and he associates with them with gentle physical and verbal actions.🔽What is SHAMELESSNESS?

original: bdag nyid dam gzhan dag la brten te /
analyzed: bdag nyid dam gzhan dag la brten te /
translated: It is the lack of shame in regard to oneself or others in committing a transgression.

original: ngo tsha med pas bsams bzhin du nyes pa byed pa dang / nyes pa byung na yang chos bzhin du phyir mi byed pa dang / 'thab krol byed pa dang / mtshang 'dru bar byed pa dang / rtsod par byed pa dang / 'gyed par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pas bsams bzhin du nyes pa byed pa dang / nyes pa byung na yang chos bzhin du phyir mi byed pa dang / 'thab krol byed pa dang / mtshang 'dru bar byed pa dang / rtsod par byed pa dang / 'gyed par byed pa yin no //
translated: It is the lack of shame in committing a transgression, even when one has made the vow not to do so, and the lack of shame in not correcting that transgression in accordance with the Teaching. It is also the lack of shame in quarreling, in accusing others of faults, in arguing, and in disputing.

original: ji ltar na ma dad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na ma dad pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is lack of COMPOSURE?

original: sangs rgyas dang chos dang / dge 'dun dag la dad pa'i sems med pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang / lam dag la yang yid mi ches par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang chos dang / dge 'dun dag la dad pa'i sems med pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang / lam dag la yang yid mi ches par gyur pa yin no //
translated: He does not have faith in the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha, and he does not have confidence in the truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and the path.

original: ji ltar na le lo can yin zhen /
analyzed: ji ltar na le lo can yin zhen /
translated: How is he lazy?

original: dge ba'i phyogs spangs te /
analyzed: dge ba'i phyogs spangs te /
translated: He abandons the wholesome and

original: gnyid kyi bde ba dang / glos 'bebs pa'i bde ba dang / nyal ba'i bde ba nyams su len @167a * //
analyzed: gnyid kyi bde ba dang / glos 'bebs pa'i bde ba dang / nyal ba'i bde ba nyams su len @167a * //
translated: indulges in the pleasure of sleep, the pleasure of lying down, and the pleasure of sleeping.

original: pas nyin mtshan shas cher yol par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: pas nyin mtshan shas cher yol par byed pa yin no //
translated: He spends most of the day and night in this way.

original: ji ltar na brjed ngas pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na brjed ngas pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he forgetful?

original: byas nas yun ring du lon pa dang / smras nas yun ring du lon pa yang rjes su mi dan la /
analyzed: byas nas yun ring du lon pa dang / smras nas yun ring du lon pa yang rjes su mi dan la /
translated: He does not remember what was done a long time ago or what was said a long time ago.

original: rjes su dran par byed kyang mi nus pa dang / dbang po rnams kyi sgom bsdoms pa dang / shes bzhin du mi gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dran par byed kyang mi nus pa dang / dbang po rnams kyi sgom bsdoms pa dang / shes bzhin du mi gnas pa yin no //
translated: He is unable to recollect even when he tries, and he does not guard the doors of the senses and is not mindful.

original: ji ltar na mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mnyam par ma bzhag pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he without concentration?

original: than mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pa tsam yang ma thob pa yin no /
analyzed: than mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i yid la byed pa tsam yang ma thob pa yin no /
translated: He has not even attained the mere attention of the stage of the beginner.

original: ji ltar na shes rab 'chal pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na shes rab 'chal pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he of bad understanding?

original: rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin cing gnas pa dang / mi mthun par 'dzin pa dang ; smra ba 'dor dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: rang gi lta ba mchog tu 'dzin cing gnas pa dang / mi mthun par 'dzin pa dang ; smra ba 'dor dka' ba yin no //
translated: He holds his own view as supreme and remains in it; he holds others' views as inferior; and he finds it difficult to give up his own speech.

original: ji ltar na lhod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na lhod pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he lax?

original: mi mkhas pa dang / mi grims pa dang / sgrub mi mod pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams la lus kyi zhal ta mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mkhas pa dang / mi grims pa dang / sgrub mi mod pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams la lus kyi zhal ta mi byed pa yin no //
translated: He is unskilled, not diligent, not practicing, and does not serve the wise who are his companions in the celibate life.

original: ji ltar na mang po yod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na mang po yod pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he of many words?

original: ji ltar gnas pa dang ; rab tu byung ba rnams dang 'dres par gnas pa dang / 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa dag nas /
analyzed: ji ltar gnas pa dang ; rab tu byung ba rnams dang 'dres par gnas pa dang / 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa dang / sdig pa mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa dag nas /
translated: He lives in the company of householders and monks, with thoughts of desire and so on, and with thoughts of wrongdoing and unwholesome things.

original: khyim gyi 'byor pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bar dag la lan mang du rjes su rtog cing rjes su dpyad par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: khyim gyi 'byor pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i bar dag la lan mang du rjes su rtog cing rjes su dpyad par byed pa yin no //
translated: He often reflects and considers the thoughts of the householder, up to the thoughts of the householder’s wealth.

original: ji ltar na blang bar bya ba la thog mar 'gro ba yin zhe na /🔽dge 'dun gyi'am gang zag gi rnyed pa blang ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na blang bar bya ba la thog mar 'gro ba yin zhe na / dge 'dun gyi'am gang zag gi rnyed pa blang ba 'di lta ste /
translated: How is he one who goes to the front in accepting?🔽He accepts the acquisition of the Saṅgha or of an individual, such as a Dharma robe, etc.

original: chos gos la sogs pa dang / dge 'dun nam gang zag mgron du 'bod pa ni blang bar bya zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos gos la sogs pa dang / dge 'dun nam gang zag mgron du 'bod pa ni blang bar bya zhes bya ste /
translated: He accepts the invitation of the Saṅgha or of an individual.

original: der dge slong rnams kyi thog mar 'gro ba yin no //
analyzed: der dge slong rnams kyi thog mar 'gro ba yin no //
translated: He goes to the front of the monks there.

original: ji ltar na rab tu dben pa la brtson pa btang ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rab tu dben pa la brtson pa btang ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is he one who gives up striving for solitude?

original: bas mtha'i gnas mal dben pa /
analyzed: bas mtha'i gnas mal dben pa /
translated: He abandons and does not even arouse the desire to go to the solitary places of the forest that are secluded and quiet,

original: skye bo sdig pa can med pa /🔽mi rnams kyis gsang ste bsten pa nang du yang dag 'jog dang rjes su mthun pa gang dag yin pa de dag thag ring du spong bar byed cing de la 'dun pa tsam yang skyed par mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: skye bo sdig pa can med pa /🔽mi rnams kyis gsang ste bsten pa nang du yang dag 'jog dang rjes su mthun pa gang dag yin pa de dag thag ring du spong bar byed cing de la 'dun pa tsam yang skyed par mi byed pa yin no //
translated: where there are no sinful people,🔽where there are no people, and which are suitable for solitary meditation.

original: ji ltar na bslab pa dag la gus pa shas chen po med pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na bslab pa dag la gus pa shas chen po med pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that they have no great respect for the precepts?

original: phongs par gyur pa'i tshe bslab pa rnams yongs su gtong bar byed la /
analyzed: phongs par gyur pa'i tshe bslab pa rnams yongs su gtong bar byed la /
translated: When they are in trouble, they give up the precepts.

original: lus dang srog yongs su gtong bar ni mi byed cing /
analyzed: lus dang srog yongs su gtong bar ni mi byed cing /
translated: But they do not give up their bodies or lives.

original: lus kyi bde ba dang srog ched che ba don du gnyer la /
analyzed: lus kyi bde ba dang srog ched che ba don du gnyer la /
translated: They seek the well-being of their bodies and lives,

original: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams rjes su @167b bsrung ba ni don du gnyer bar mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi rnams rjes su @167b bsrung ba ni don du gnyer bar mi byed pa yin no //
translated: but they do not seek to keep the precepts.

original: ji ltar na dge sbyong gi tshul la mi lta ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge sbyong gi tshul la mi lta ba yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that they do not look to the way of the virtuous?

original: bslab pa rnams phul nas nyams par bya ba'i phyir 'dug par 'dod cing /
analyzed: bslab pa rnams phul nas nyams par bya ba'i phyir 'dug par 'dod cing /
translated: They want to stay in order to break the precepts after they have given them up.

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa dang / sdig pa'i chos can dang / nang rul pa nas rgyas par tshangs par spyod pa ma yin par tshangs par spyod par khas 'che ba'i bar yin te /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa dang / sdig pa'i chos can dang / nang rul pa nas rgyas par tshangs par spyod pa ma yin par tshangs par spyod par khas 'che ba'i bar yin te /
translated: They are immoral, have evil natures, are rotten inside, and so on, up to: they are not celibate, but claim to be celibate.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu rnams sam /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu rnams sam /
translated: They do not seek the fruits of the religious life

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa don du gnyer bar lta ga la 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa don du gnyer bar lta ga la 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: how could they be interested in the eightfold noble path?

original: ji ltar na 'tsho ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung la /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'tsho ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung la /
translated: How do they go forth with the thought of livelihood,

original: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bsam pas ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bsam pas ma yin zhe na /
translated: not with the thought of nirvāṇa?

original: rgyal pos gtses pas rab tu byung ba'am /
analyzed: rgyal pos gtses pas rab tu byung ba'am /
translated: They go forth because they are oppressed by a king,

original: chom rkun pas gtses pa'am /
analyzed: chom rkun pas gtses pa'am /
translated: or oppressed by a robber,

original: bu lon gyis nyam thag pa'am /
analyzed: bu lon gyis nyam thag pa'am /
translated: or oppressed by debt,🔽or oppressed by fear, or because they have lost their livelihood.

original: 'jigs pas nyam thag pa'i longs spyod rnams nyams pa na 'tsho ba med pas 'jigs shing skrag pas rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'jigs pas nyam thag pa'i longs spyod rnams nyams pa na 'tsho ba med pas 'jigs shing skrag pas rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
translated: They go forth out of fear and terror of having no livelihood,

original: bdag nyid dul bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: bdag nyid dul bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not in order to tame themselves,

original: bdag nyid zhi bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
analyzed: bdag nyid zhi bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin /
translated: not in order to calm themselves,

original: bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir ma yin pa'o //
translated: not in order to attain nirvāṇa for themselves.

original: de la nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang po bzhi ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dang lhan cig 'grogs pa rgud pa las brtsams nas rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang po bzhi ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams dang lhan cig 'grogs pa rgud pa las brtsams nas rnam par gzhag par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The first four secondary afflictions should be understood as being established in terms of the degeneration of living together with fellow brahmacarins.

original: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims rgud pa las brtsams nas blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims rgud pa las brtsams nas blta bar bya'o //
translated: Shamelessness and lack of abashment should be understood in terms of the degeneration of superior morality.

original: ma dad pa la sogs pa shes rab 'chal pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab rgud pa las brtsams nas blta bar bya ste ;
analyzed: ma dad pa la sogs pa shes rab 'chal pa'i mthar thug pa'i bar gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams ni lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab rgud pa las brtsams nas blta bar bya ste ;
translated: The secondary afflictions from lack of faith up to wrong reflection should be understood in terms of the degeneration of superior mind and superior discernment.

original: de la ma dad pa dang le lo dang ldan pa ni gnyi ga rgud pa las brtsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ma dad pa dang le lo dang ldan pa ni gnyi ga rgud pa las brtsams pa yin no //
translated: Among them, lack of faith and laziness are in terms of the degeneration of both.

original: brjed ngas pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba ni lhag pa'i sems rgud pa 'ba' zhig las brtsams pa yin no //
analyzed: brjed ngas pa dang / rnam par g-yeng ba ni lhag pa'i sems rgud pa 'ba' zhig las brtsams pa yin no //
translated: Forgetfulness and distraction are in terms of the degeneration of superior mind alone.

original: shes rab 'chal pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab rgud pa 'ba' zhig las brtsams pa yin no //🔽de la ma dad pa dang le lo dang ldan pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: shes rab 'chal pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab rgud pa 'ba' zhig las brtsams pa yin no // de la ma dad pa dang le lo dang ldan pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: The lack of wisdom is the degeneration of superior wisdom.

original: lhod pa dang mang po pa dang / blang bar bya ba la thog mar 'gro ba dang / rab tu dben pa la brtson pa btang ba rnams blta bar bya'o //🔽brjed ngas pa dang / sems rnam par g-yengs pa dang / shes rab @168a * //
analyzed: lhod pa dang mang po pa dang / blang bar bya ba la thog mar 'gro ba dang / rab tu dben pa la brtson pa btang ba rnams blta bar bya'o // brjed ngas pa dang / sems rnam par g-yengs pa dang / shes rab @168a * //
translated: In this regard, the laxity and the abundance should be understood in terms of the lack of faith and laziness.🔽The lack of respect for the precepts should be understood in terms of forgetfulness, distraction, and the lack of wisdom.

original: 'chal pa'i dbang du byas nas bslab pa dag la shas cher gus pa med pa dang / dge sbyong gi tshul la mi lta ba dang 'tsho ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung la mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bsam pas ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'chal pa'i dbang du byas nas bslab pa dag la shas cher gus pa med pa dang / dge sbyong gi tshul la mi lta ba dang 'tsho ba'i bsam pas rab tu byung la mya ngan las 'da' ba'i bsam pas ma yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The lack of regard for the religious life should be understood in terms of the lack of respect for the precepts, and the lack of regard for the religious life.

original: gang zag gsum gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni gnas gsum las byung ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag gsum gyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni gnas gsum las byung ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The three types of persons should be understood in terms of the three bases.

original: gang zag gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three types of persons?

original: chos 'di pa rab tu byung ba dang / 'dod pa la longs spyod pa khyim na gnas pa dang / 'di las phyi rol pa rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: chos 'di pa rab tu byung ba dang / 'dod pa la longs spyod pa khyim na gnas pa dang / 'di las phyi rol pa rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: The first is the renunciate who is a Buddhist; the second is the householder who enjoys sense pleasures; and the third is the renunciate who is a non-Buddhist.

original: de dag gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gnas gsum las byung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gnas gsum las byung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What are the secondary mental afflictions that arise from the three states?

original: gang zag dang po'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni bag med pa las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gang zag dang po'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni bag med pa las byung ba yin te /
translated: The secondary mental affliction of the first person arises from lack of mindfulness.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: It is of two types:🔽One speaks falsely about oneself in order to obtain robes, etc., and in order to obtain honor.🔽One speaks of oneself with exaggerated claims.🔽One speaks falsely about oneself in order to obtain robes, etc., and in order to obtain honor.🔽One speaks of oneself with exaggerated claims.

original: chos gos la sogs pa rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa'i phyir bdag nyid las brtsams nas /
analyzed: chos gos la sogs pa rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa'i phyir bdag nyid las brtsams nas /
translated: One speaks falsely about oneself in order to obtain robes, etc., and in order to obtain honor.

original: bdag nyid kyi yang dag pa ma yin pa rjod par byed de /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi yang dag pa ma yin pa rjod par byed de /
translated: One speaks of oneself with exaggerated claims.🔽One speaks falsely about oneself in order to obtain robes, etc., and in order to obtain honor.🔽One speaks of oneself with exaggerated claims.🔽One speaks falsely about oneself in order to obtain robes, etc., and in order to obtain honor.🔽One speaks of oneself with exaggerated claims.
