original: rnam par 'tshe bar byed /
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe bar byed /
translated: One speaks of oneself with exaggerated claims.🔽One speaks falsely about oneself in order to obtain robes, etc., and in order to obtain honor.

original: tho 'tshams par byed /
analyzed: tho 'tshams par byed /
translated: One speaks of oneself with exaggerated claims.🔽One speaks falsely about oneself in order to obtain robes, etc., and in order to obtain honor.

original: bsting bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsting bar byed pa'o //
translated: One speaks of oneself with exaggerated claims.🔽One speaks falsely about oneself in order to obtain robes, etc., and in order to obtain honor.🔽One speaks of oneself with exaggerated claims.🔽One speaks falsely about oneself in order to obtain robes, etc., and in order to obtain

original: gang zag gnyis pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa las byung pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zag gnyis pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa las byung pa yin te /
translated: The secondary defilement of the second person arises from attachment to pleasure.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: 'dod pa las lhag par zhen pa'i rgyus 'dod pa la longs spyod pa ni lus kyis kyang nyes par spyod pa kun du spyod la /
analyzed: 'dod pa las lhag par zhen pa'i rgyus 'dod pa la longs spyod pa ni lus kyis kyang nyes par spyod pa kun du spyod la /
translated: Because of attachment to pleasure, one indulges in pleasure and one indulges in misconduct with the body,

original: ngag dang yid kyis kyang nyes par spyod pa kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: ngag dang yid kyis kyang nyes par spyod pa kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: and one indulges in misconduct with speech and mind.

original: gang zag gsum pa'i nyo pa'i nyon mongs pa ni log par sgrub pa las byung ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag gsum pa'i nyo pa'i nyon mongs pa ni log par sgrub pa las byung ba yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The secondary defilement of the third person should be seen as arising from wrong practice.

original: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Moreover, it is in brief of three kinds:

original: rab tu dben pa dang ldan pa dang / 'du 'dzi dang ldan pa dang / bslab dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa dang ldan pa dang / 'du 'dzi dang ldan pa dang / bslab dang ldan pa'o //
translated: associated with solitude, associated with society, and associated with training.

original: de la rab tu dben pa dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la rab tu dben pa dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is associated with solitude?

original: 'di las phyi rol pa ni bas mtha'i gnas mal dben par song ba na /
analyzed: 'di las phyi rol pa ni bas mtha'i gnas mal dben par song ba na /
translated: Here, one who is outside this teaching goes to a solitary place in the forest.

original: sgrib pa lnga po dag gis sems bsgribs pa dang / lus dang sems kyi sdug bsngal so sor myong bas sdug bsngal bar gnas pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga dang bral bas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po spangs pa yin te /
analyzed: sgrib pa lnga po dag gis sems bsgribs pa dang / lus dang sems kyi sdug bsngal so sor myong bas sdug bsngal bar gnas pa dang / dad pa la sogs pa dbang po lnga dang bral bas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po spangs pa yin te /
translated: One is deprived of the five faculties of faith, etc., and so one is deprived of the antidote to the afflictions.

original: de ltar nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa dang / sdug bsngal bar gnas pa dang / de bsal ba'i gnyen po med @168b pa gang yin pa de ni de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rab tu dben pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyon mongs pa can du gnas pa dang / sdug bsngal bar gnas pa dang / de bsal ba'i gnyen po med @168b pa gang yin pa de ni de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rab tu dben pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who dwells in this way, in the afflictions, in suffering, and without the antidote to eliminate them, is said to be endowed with the seclusion of the near afflictions.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'du 'dzi dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'du 'dzi dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the near affliction of being in a crowd?

original: phan tshun lta ba la 'dod pa mi mthun pa rtsod pas rang gi phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs la rnam par gnas pa rnams kyi khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa nas ;
analyzed: phan tshun lta ba la 'dod pa mi mthun pa rtsod pas rang gi phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs la rnam par gnas pa rnams kyi khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa nas ;
translated: It is anger and resentment toward those who are attached to other views and who argue, each maintaining his own position and rejecting that of others.

original: rgyas par sgyu dang g-yo'i bar gang yin pa de ni de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'du 'dzi dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par sgyu dang g-yo'i bar gang yin pa de ni de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa 'du 'dzi dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The extensive explanation of deceit and fraud is called the subsidiary defilement of distraction.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bslab pa dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa bslab pa dang ldan pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the subsidiary defilement of the training?

original: bdag dang gzhan las brten te kha na ma tho ba kun du spyod pas ngo tsha med pas tshul khrims nyams pa dang tshul khrims 'dral bar byed pa'i bar gang yin pa de ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhe bya'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan las brten te kha na ma tho ba kun du spyod pas ngo tsha med pas tshul khrims nyams pa dang tshul khrims 'dral bar byed pa'i bar gang yin pa de ni nye ba'i nyon mongs pa lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang ldan pa zhe bya'o //
translated: It is the lack of shame in committing offenses, whether against oneself or others, and the destruction of morality, up to the destruction of the training in the higher morality.

original: 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas dman pa bas bdag mtho'o snyam pa dang / 'dra ba bas bdag che'o snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa de ni de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pas dman pa bas bdag mtho'o snyam pa dang / 'dra ba bas bdag che'o snyam du sems khengs pa gang yin pa de ni de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the inflation of the mind which thinks: “I am superior” in comparison with those who are inferior, and “I am equal” in comparison with those who are equal, in worldly meditative concentration. This is called the subsidiary defilement of the training in the higher mind.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams la thos pa nyung ba dang yongs su mi spyod pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams la thos pa nyung ba dang yongs su mi spyod pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: It is to have little learning and not to practice the teachings.🔽

original: de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The subsidiary defilement of the training in higher wisdom is the lack of learning and the lack of practice with regard to the wholesome factors.

original: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus na /
analyzed: de dag thams cad gcig tu bsdus na /
translated: All of these are included in the two:

original: chos ma yin pa spyod pa dang ; ya nga bar spyod pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa spyod pa dang ; ya nga bar spyod pa zhes bya ste /
translated: the practice of what is unwholesome and the practice of what is fearful.

original: mi dge ba'i don gyis ni chos ma yin pa spyod pa yin la /🔽'bras bu mi 'dod pa'i don gyis ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i don gyis ni chos ma yin pa spyod pa yin la / 'bras bu mi 'dod pa'i don gyis ni /
translated: The practice of what is unwholesome is on account of the meaning of unwholesomeness.

original: ya nga bar spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: ya nga bar spyod pa yin no //
translated: The practice of what is fearful is on account of the meaning of the undesirable result.

original: rnal 'byor pa zad par gyi skye mched bcu bsgom pa ni bya ba lnga byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa zad par gyi skye mched bcu bsgom pa ni bya ba lnga byed pa yin te /
translated: The yogi/nī who meditates on the ten totalities performs five actions.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: zad par sa la sogs pa nas zad par dkar po'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag gis ni sprul pa dang dngos po bsgyur ba 'phags pa'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par sgrub par byed /
analyzed: zad par sa la sogs pa nas zad par dkar po'i mthar thug pa'i bar dag gis ni sprul pa dang dngos po bsgyur ba 'phags pa'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par sgrub par byed /
translated: By means of the totalities of earth and so forth up to the totality of white, one accomplishes the supernormal powers of the noble ones, which are the emanation and transformation of things.

original: zad par nam mkha' yas skye mched kyis ni 'ong ba dang 'gro ba 'phags pa'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: zad par nam mkha' yas skye mched kyis ni 'ong ba dang 'gro ba 'phags pa'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par sgrub par byed do //
translated: The base of infinite space establishes the noble supernatural powers of coming and going.

original: zad par rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyis ni nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: zad par rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched kyis ni nyon mongs pa med pa dang / smon nas shes pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mngon par sgrub par byed do //
translated: The base of infinite consciousness establishes the qualities of the absence of affliction, knowledge through prayer, correct knowledge and so on.

original: zad par rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched grub na /🔽ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes @169a * //
analyzed: zad par rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched grub na / ci yang med pa'i skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa dang / 'du shes med 'du shes @169a * //
translated: When the base of infinite space is established,

original: med min skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: med min skye mched kyi rnam par thar pa 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: the liberation of the base of nothingness and the liberation of the base of neither discernment nor nondiscernment are established.

original: de grub pa'i rgyus gnas pa mchog gis bsdus pa 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de grub pa'i rgyus gnas pa mchog gis bsdus pa 'du shes dang / tshor ba 'gog pa'i rnam par thar pa la snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the cause of establishing that, one enters meditative attainment in the liberation that is the cessation of discernment and feeling subsumed by the supreme abode.

original: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las ni khyab pa'i rnam pa mtha' yas pa dang / tshad med pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur bas de'i phyir gong du zad par rnam par gzhag pa med do //
analyzed: rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched las ni khyab pa'i rnam pa mtha' yas pa dang / tshad med pa mngon par 'grub par 'gyur bas de'i phyir gong du zad par rnam par gzhag pa med do //
translated: In the sphere of infinite consciousness, the aspect of infinite pervasiveness and the immeasurability are accomplished, and therefore, the higher stages of the bases of totality are not established.

original: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams dang / zad par gyi skye mched rnams ni /
analyzed: zil gyis gnon pa'i skye mched rnams dang / zad par gyi skye mched rnams ni /
translated: The bases of subjugation and the bases of totality are

original: rnam par thar pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i lam yin no //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i lam yin no //
translated: the path of purification of the liberations.

original: rnam par thar pa rnams ni shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rnams ni shes bya'i sgrib pa las rnam par thar pas rab tu phye ba yin te /
translated: The liberations are distinguished by liberation from the obscurations of the knowable,

original: shes bya'i sgrib pa ci tsam las nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: shes bya'i sgrib pa ci tsam las nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sems rnam par grol bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: to the extent that the minds of śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas are liberated from the obscurations of the knowable.

original: snyoms par 'jug par byed pa ni mdor bsdu na rgyu gsum gyis snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myong bar byed de /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug par byed pa ni mdor bsdu na rgyu gsum gyis snyoms par 'jug pa'i ro myong bar byed de /
translated: Those who enter meditative attainment experience the taste of meditative attainment for three reasons in brief:

original: snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa las langs pa ni gtsang ba dang / 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang yid du 'ong ba las yang dag par rjes su dran pas ro myong bar byed do //🔽ma thob pa'am /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa thob pa las langs pa ni gtsang ba dang / 'dod pa dang / sdug pa dang / dga' ba dang yid du 'ong ba las yang dag par rjes su dran pas ro myong bar byed do // ma thob pa'am /
translated: One who has arisen from the attainment of meditative concentration experiences the purity, the desire, the beauty, the joy, and the pleasure of that meditative concentration through recollection.

original: thob pa ma 'ongs pa la ni ro myong ba nyid kyi dbang du byas nas don du gnyer ba ni mngon par dga' bas ro myong bar byed do //
analyzed: thob pa ma 'ongs pa la ni ro myong ba nyid kyi dbang du byas nas don du gnyer ba ni mngon par dga' bas ro myong bar byed do //
translated: One who has not yet attained the meditative concentration or who has attained it but not in the present experiences it through desire, that is, through longing for it with a sense of delight.

original: thob pa ni gtsang ba dang 'dod pa dang sdug pa dang dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba rgya cher kun du spyod pa las ro myong bar byed do //
analyzed: thob pa ni gtsang ba dang 'dod pa dang sdug pa dang dga' ba dang / yid du 'ong ba rgya cher kun du spyod pa las ro myong bar byed do //
translated: One who has attained it experiences it through the extensive practice of purity, desire, beauty, joy, and pleasure.

original: de ltar na gang las langs pa de'i ro myong bar byed pa dang / gang la snyoms par zhags pa de la ro myong bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na gang las langs pa de'i ro myong bar byed pa dang / gang la snyoms par zhags pa de la ro myong bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Thus, one experiences the meditative concentration from which one has arisen and in which one is presently absorbed.

original: ro myang ba zhes bya ba ni de la kun du chags shing lhag par zhen pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ro myang ba zhes bya ba ni de la kun du chags shing lhag par zhen pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The experience of meditative concentration is the attachment and clinging to it.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i chos rnams ni gong mar skyes pa la kun du mi 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i chos rnams ni gong mar skyes pa la kun du mi 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the phenomena of lower levels do not occur for one born in a higher level.

original: sa gong ma pa'i chos rnams ni 'og mar skyes pa 'dod chags dang bral bal kun du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa gong ma pa'i chos rnams ni 'og mar skyes pa 'dod chags dang bral bal kun du 'byung ngo //
translated: The phenomena of a higher level occur for one born in a lower level who is free from attachment.

original: 'og mar skyes pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni gong ma la sred pa skyed par byed de /
analyzed: 'og mar skyes pa 'dod chags dang ma bral ba sems mnyam par ma bzhag pa ni gong ma la sred pa skyed par byed de /
translated: One born in a lower level who is not free from attachment and is not in equipoise generates craving for the higher level.

original: sred pa de yang 'dod pa na spyod pa yin par brjod par bya'o //🔽de yang nyon mongs pa can yang yod /
analyzed: sred pa de yang 'dod pa na spyod pa yin par brjod par bya'o // de yang nyon mongs pa can yang yod /
translated: That craving should be called craving for the desire realm.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: It is also said to be afflicted and unafflicted.

original: nyon mongs pa can gang @169b zhe na ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gang @169b zhe na ;
translated: What is afflicted?

original: gal te 'di snyam du kye ma bdag ni bde ba rgya chen po de lta bu dang ldan pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug par bya zhing /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du kye ma bdag ni bde ba rgya chen po de lta bu dang ldan pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la snyoms par 'jug par bya zhing /
translated: If one thinks, “Oh, I will enter meditative attainment that possesses such vast bliss,”

original: bdag gis de la 'di ltar ro myang bar yang bya'o snyam pa dang / gong mar skyes na ni rtag pa dang brtan pa dang ther zug tu yang 'gyur ro snyam pa de lta bu'i sems skyed par byed pa'i sred pa ni nyon mongs pa can yin par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis de la 'di ltar ro myang bar yang bya'o snyam pa dang / gong mar skyes na ni rtag pa dang brtan pa dang ther zug tu yang 'gyur ro snyam pa de lta bu'i sems skyed par byed pa'i sred pa ni nyon mongs pa can yin par brjod par bya'o //
translated: Such craving that generates such a thought is said to be afflicted.

original: gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bsam pa kho nas sems skyed par byed cing /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bsam pa kho nas sems skyed par byed cing /
translated: If one generates a thought only with a mind free from attachment,

original: zhi ba dang khyad par du 'phags pa'i sa gong ma sgrub par byed pa'i sred pa de ni /
analyzed: zhi ba dang khyad par du 'phags pa'i sa gong ma sgrub par byed pa'i sred pa de ni /
translated: and craving that establishes a higher stage of peace and distinction,

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin par brjod par bya'o ;
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin par brjod par bya'o ;
translated: that is said to be unafflicted.

original: / chos rnams kyi spong ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: / chos rnams kyi spong ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The abandonment of phenomena is threefold:

original: gnyen pos spong pa dang / kun du spyod pas spong ba dang / 'dor bas spong ba'o //
analyzed: gnyen pos spong pa dang / kun du spyod pas spong ba dang / 'dor bas spong ba'o //
translated: abandonment by means of an antidote, abandonment by means of practice, and abandonment by means of rejection.

original: de la spong ba dang po ni nyon mongs pa'i gzhis rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: de la spong ba dang po ni nyon mongs pa'i gzhis rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: The first abandonment is distinguished by the basis of affliction.

original: spong ba gnyis pa ni 'du byed skyed nas 'gag pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: spong ba gnyis pa ni 'du byed skyed nas 'gag pas rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: The second abandonment is distinguished by generating formative factors and then ceasing.

original: spong ba gsum pa ni gong mar skyes pa dang phung po'i lhag ma med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa'i 'du byed sa 'og ma pa 'du byed thams cad yongs su gtong bas rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: spong ba gsum pa ni gong mar skyes pa dang phung po'i lhag ma med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa'i 'du byed sa 'og ma pa 'du byed thams cad yongs su gtong bas rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: The third abandonment is distinguished by completely relinquishing all formative factors of lower level that cause one to be born in a higher level and to attain nirvana without remainder.

original: yongs su nyams pa ni gsum po 'di dag yin te ma thob pa'i chos las yongs su nyams pa dang / thob pa'i chos las yongs su nyams pa dang / kun du bsten pas yongs su nyams pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa ni gsum po 'di dag yin te ma thob pa'i chos las yongs su nyams pa dang / thob pa'i chos las yongs su nyams pa dang / kun du bsten pas yongs su nyams pa'o //
translated: There are three types of complete degeneration: degeneration from not obtaining a phenomenon, degeneration from obtaining a phenomenon and degeneration through reliance.

original: 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi nyer bsdogs dag la sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam gang dag yin pa de dag ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa rnams kyi nyer bsdogs dag la sbyor ba dang / bar chad med pa dang / rnam par grol ba'i lam gang dag yin pa de dag ni /
translated: The preparatory, uninterrupted and liberated paths of the access concentrations to mundane meditative attainment

original: gang spang ba dang / gang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rab tu sbyor zhing de dag la skyon dang zhi bar dmigs te /
analyzed: gang spang ba dang / gang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir rab tu sbyor zhing de dag la skyon dang zhi bar dmigs te /
translated: They are called the path of application because they are applied to the abandonment of the obstacles to the arising of the path of seeing and to the realization of the truths.

original: 'og ma la ni skyon du'o //
analyzed: 'og ma la ni skyon du'o //
translated: The lower is seen as a fault,

original: gong ma la ni zhi bar ro //🔽khyad par gyi lam gang dag yin pa de dag ni khyab pa la dmigs pa yang yin la /
analyzed: gong ma la ni zhi bar ro // khyad par gyi lam gang dag yin pa de dag ni khyab pa la dmigs pa yang yin la /
translated: and the higher as peace.

original: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yang yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: zag pa med pa la dmigs pa yang yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The distinctive paths are also called the path of application because they are applied to the abandonment of the obstacles to the arising of the path of seeing and to the realization of the truths.🔽They are called the path of application because they are applied to the abandonment of the obstacles to the arising of the path of seeing and to the realization of the truths.

original: nyer bsdogs kyis bsdus pa'i yid la byed pa drug po mtshan nyid so sor rig pa la sogs pa nas /
analyzed: nyer bsdogs kyis bsdus pa'i yid la byed pa drug po mtshan nyid so sor rig pa la sogs pa nas /
translated: The six mental attentions included in access concentration, beginning with the attention of discernment of characteristics and ending with the attention of final training,

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i bar gang dag yin pa de dag las mtshan nyid so sor rig pa dang / mos pa yid la byed pa ni sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i bar gang dag yin pa de dag las mtshan nyid so sor rig pa dang / mos pa yid la byed pa ni sbyor ba'i lam gyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: among them, the attention of discernment of characteristics and the attention of devoted interest are included in the path of preparation.

original: rab tu dben pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa gnyis ni @170a * //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa dang / sbyor ba mthar thug pa gnyis ni @170a * //
translated: The attention of isolation and the attention of final training

original: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: bar chad med pa'i lam gyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: are included in the uninterrupted path.

original: dga' ba sdud pa ni lam rnam pa bzhi char gyis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: dga' ba sdud pa ni lam rnam pa bzhi char gyis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The mental attention of delight and gathering is included in all four paths.

original: dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa ni khyad par gyi lam gyis bsdus pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i yid la byed pa ni khyad par gyi lam gyis bsdus pa kho na yin no //
translated: The mental attention of investigation is included in the path of distinction alone.

original: ci'i phyir bsam gtan rnams kyi bsam gtan pa'i yul bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsam gtan rnams kyi bsam gtan pa'i yul bsam gyis mi khyab ces bya zhe na /
translated: Why are the objects of the contemplations of the absorptions said to be inconceivable?

original: bsam gtan pa rnams kyis gang dang gang ji ltar mngon par 'du byed pa de dang de bzhin du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa rnams kyis gang dang gang ji ltar mngon par 'du byed pa de dang de bzhin du 'gyur gyi /
translated: Whatever and however the contemplations of the absorptions are formed, they become just that.🔽They do not become anything else.

original: gzhan du ma yin pa de ltar sems de yongs su sbyang bar byas pas /
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin pa de ltar sems de yongs su sbyang bar byas pas /
translated: Since the mind is thoroughly trained in that way,

original: de'i mthu de 'dra ste /
analyzed: de'i mthu de 'dra ste /
translated: it has such power.

original: de ni chos nyid yin pas de'i phyir de ni rtog ge'i lam gyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni chos nyid yin pas de'i phyir de ni rtog ge'i lam gyis bsam gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since that is the nature of things, it is said that the path of sophistry cannot conceive of it.

original: gnyis ka yang dbang thob pa'i bsam gtan pa gnyis kyis dngos po bsgyur ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyis dngos po gcig la mos pa byas ma thag tu gnyi ga'i rdzu 'phrul thogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gnyis ka yang dbang thob pa'i bsam gtan pa gnyis kyis dngos po bsgyur ba'i rdzu 'phrul gyis dngos po gcig la mos pa byas ma thag tu gnyi ga'i rdzu 'phrul thogs par 'gyur la /
translated: Both of those are the inconceivable objects of the absorptions of the two contemplations who have obtained mastery.

original: rdzu 'phrul ches che ba gzhan zhig gis zil gyis mnan pa yang ma yin pa las de'i 'og tu dngos po de nyid la gcig gi rdzu 'phrul ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du bsgyur ba la thogs pa med par 'jug la /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ches che ba gzhan zhig gis zil gyis mnan pa yang ma yin pa las de'i 'og tu dngos po de nyid la gcig gi rdzu 'phrul ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du bsgyur ba la thogs pa med par 'jug la /
translated: It is not that the other's supernormal knowledge is greater.

original: cig shos kyi ni thogs par 'gyur ba de la rgyu ci yod par rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: cig shos kyi ni thogs par 'gyur ba de la rgyu ci yod par rig par bya zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of the fact that one of them can transform that thing as he wishes, while the other cannot?

original: gnyi ga yang myur bar 'dra ba dang / stobs 'dra ba dang / mthu 'dra ba dang rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba dus gcig tu bskyed par 'dra mod kyi /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang myur bar 'dra ba dang / stobs 'dra ba dang / mthu 'dra ba dang rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba dus gcig tu bskyed par 'dra mod kyi /
translated: Both are similar in being quick, similar in strength, similar in power, and similar in generating the supernormal knowledge at the same time.

original: mi 'dra ba mngon par 'du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba mngon par 'du byed pa yin te /
translated: However, they are dissimilar in the way they generate the supernormal knowledge.

original: rdzu 'phrul mi 'dra ba mngon par 'du byed ba des ni de gnyis kyi rdzu 'phrul gcig la gcig thogs par gyur to //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul mi 'dra ba mngon par 'du byed ba des ni de gnyis kyi rdzu 'phrul gcig la gcig thogs par gyur to //
translated: Because of generating dissimilar supernormal knowledge, the supernormal knowledge of the two is obstructed by each other.

original: de nas gcig 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas gcig 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then one thinks,

original: ci'i phyir bdag gi rdzu 'phrul thogs par gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag gi rdzu 'phrul thogs par gyur /
translated: Why is my supernormal knowledge obstructed?

original: mal bdag nyid ting nge 'dzin las yongs su nyams pa'am /
analyzed: mal bdag nyid ting nge 'dzin las yongs su nyams pa'am /
translated: The first ascetic is in a state of concentration, but the second is not.

original: gcig tu ma gyur grang snyam du sems shing /
analyzed: gcig tu ma gyur grang snyam du sems shing /
translated: The second ascetic thinks, “I am in a state of concentration, but the first ascetic is not.”🔽The first ascetic is occupied with the thought of the second ascetic, but the second ascetic is not occupied with such thoughts.

original: de ltar bsam gtan pa gcig gzhan yid la byed cing 'dug gi / cig shos kyis ni yid brel ba med par yang dang yang du rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba de nyid byas pas na /
analyzed: de ltar bsam gtan pa gcig gzhan yid la byed cing 'dug gi / cig shos kyis ni yid brel ba med par yang dang yang du rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba de nyid byas pas na /
translated: The second ascetic repeatedly performs the supernormal act of creation without any mental distraction.

original: de'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba de ni thogs ba med par 'jug go //
analyzed: de'i rdzu 'phrul mngon par 'du bya ba de ni thogs ba med par 'jug go //
translated: Therefore, the supernormal act of creation of the second ascetic is accomplished without any obstacle.

original: mthu mi mnyam pa gnyis kyis ni gang khyad par du 'phags pa de'i 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthu mi mnyam pa gnyis kyis ni gang khyad par du 'phags pa de'i 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the two ascetics are not equal in power, then the one who is superior will be successful.

original: mthu mnyam pa gnyis kyi yang gang gis sngar mos par byas pa de'i 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: mthu mnyam pa gnyis kyi yang gang gis sngar mos par byas pa de'i 'grub par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the two ascetics are equal in power, then the one who has previously generated the aspiration will be successful,

original: @170b cig shos kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @170b cig shos kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: but not the other.

original: bsam gtan pa ni bzhi po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan pa ni bzhi po 'di dag yin te /
translated: There are four types of ascetics:

original: nyer bsdogs kyi bsam gtan pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi ting nge 'dzin gyi bsam gtan pa dang / dag pa 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan gyi bsam gtan pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsam gtan gyi bsam gtan pa'o //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs kyi bsam gtan pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi ting nge 'dzin gyi bsam gtan pa dang / dag pa 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan gyi bsam gtan pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i bsam gtan gyi bsam gtan pa'o //
translated: the meditative concentration of the preparatory stage, the meditative concentration of defiled meditative development, the meditative concentration of pure mundane meditative development, and the meditative concentration of supramundane meditative development.

original: de la dang po ni yid la byed pa drug po mtshan nyid so sor rig pa la sogs pa nas /🔽sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i bar dag la zhugs pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la dang po ni yid la byed pa drug po mtshan nyid so sor rig pa la sogs pa nas / sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i bar dag la zhugs pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The first is to be seen as the one who has entered the six kinds of mental attention, beginning with the discernment of the individual characteristics and concluding with the culminating application.

original: gnyis pa ni sred pa'i shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nas /🔽the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'i bar dag yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni sred pa'i shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa nas / the tshom shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'i bar dag yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The second is to be seen as the one who is devoted to meditative development, whether he be of the faith-follower type or of the one who has attained to view.🔽The third is to be seen as the one who is devoted to meditative development, whether he be of the faith-follower type or of the one who has attained to view.

original: gsum pa ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan la de las gzhan pa'i dge ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gsum pa ni 'jig rten pa'i bsam gtan la de las gzhan pa'i dge ba 'di lta ste /
translated: The fourth is to be seen as the one who is devoted to meditative development, whether he be of the faith-follower type or of the one who has attained to view.🔽The fourth is to be seen as the one who is devoted to meditative development, whether he be of the faith-follower type or of the one who has attained to view.🔽The fourth is to be seen as the one who is devoted to meditative development, whether he be of the faith-follower type or of the one who has attained to view.🔽The fourth is to be seen as the one who is devoted to meditative development, whether he be of the faith-follower type or of the one who has attained to view.🔽The fourth is to be seen as the one who is devoted to meditative development, whether he be of the faith-follower type or of the one who has attained to view.🔽The fourth is to be seen as the one who is devoted to meditative development, whether he be of the faith-follower type or of the one who has attained to view.🔽The fourth is to be seen as the one who is devoted to meditative development, whether he be of the faith-follower type or of the one who has attained to view.🔽The fourth is to be seen as the one who is devoted to meditative development, whether he be of the faith-follower type or of the one who has attained to view.🔽The fourth is to be seen as the one who is devoted to meditative development, whether he be of the faith-follower type or of the one who has attained to view.🔽The fourth is to be seen as the one who is devoted to meditative development, whether he be of the faith-follower type or of the one who has attained to view.🔽The fourth is to be seen

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa dang / tshad med pa yid la byed pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa dang / mngon par bsgrub pa dag gis rnam par rtse ba dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pas yongs su zin pa'i tshe na yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa dang / tshad med pa yid la byed pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i yon tan mngon par bsgrub pa dang / mngon par bsgrub pa dag gis rnam par rtse ba dang nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pas yongs su zin pa'i tshe na yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the four formless states are distinguished by the four immeasurables, the four spheres of mastery, the four spheres of totalization, and the four spheres of the overcom-ing of conflict.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang mtshan ma med pa yin bas rab tu phye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa ni rnam par thar pa'i sgo stong pa nyid dang / smon pa med pa dang mtshan ma med pa yin bas rab tu phye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The fourth meditation should be understood as distinguished by the three doors of liberation, i.e., emptiness, the imageless, and the wishless.

original: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni gcig tu zad pa dang bcas par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni gcig tu zad pa dang bcas par brjod par bya'o //
translated: The attainment of non-perception should be understood as having only a limited cessation.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni zag pa med par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa ni zag pa med par brjod par bya ste /
translated: The attainment of cessation should be understood as having an unlimited cessation.

original: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa med pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang / mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa med pa'i phyir dang / nyon mongs pa rnams kyis ma bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from the afflictions, because it is not associated with the afflictions, because it does not have an objective support, and because it is not generated by the afflictions.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni sa mthon por chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma gtogs par so so'i skye bo thams cad kyis spyad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa ni sa mthon por chud pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams ma gtogs par so so'i skye bo thams cad kyis spyad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is supramundane because it is not practiced by all ordinary persons, except for those bodhisattvas who have entered the higher stages.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams mngon du byed kyang thabs la mkhas pas byed kyi /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams mngon du byed kyang thabs la mkhas pas byed kyi /
translated: Although bodhisattvas manifest supramundane dharmas, they do so through skill in means.

original: nyon mongs pa spong bar ni mi byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spong bar ni mi byed do //
translated: They do not eliminate the afflictions.

original: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin par brjod par bya ba na rgyu ba med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro /🔽// / bam po bcu dgu pa /
analyzed: slob pa yang ma yin mi slob pa yang ma yin par brjod par bya ba na rgyu ba med pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro / // / bam po bcu dgu pa /
translated: It should be said that it is neither training nor beyond training because it is like nirvana, which is without movement.

original: lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa'i mdo rnam par bshad pa las /
analyzed: lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa'i mdo rnam par bshad pa las /
translated: The Explanation of the Sūtra on the Mindfulness of Embracing the Body

original: dge slong sems rnam par dag par @171a * //
analyzed: dge slong sems rnam par dag par @171a * //
translated: The monk has a pure mind.🔽

original: bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni bzhi ste /
analyzed: bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ni bzhi ste /
translated: There are four secondary reactive emotions for a monk who has entered the spiritual life in order to purify his mind:

original: ltung ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / lus la mngon par zhen pa dang / yul la mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: ltung ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / lus la mngon par zhen pa dang / yul la mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: downfalls, conceptual thought, attachment to the body, and attachment to objects.

original: ltung ba ni 'gyod pa'i sgo nas ting nge 'dzin gyi bar chad byed do //
analyzed: ltung ba ni 'gyod pa'i sgo nas ting nge 'dzin gyi bar chad byed do //
translated: Downfalls are obstacles to meditative absorption, because of the remorse they cause.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni sgo gsum nas te ;
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni sgo gsum nas te ;
translated: Conceptual thought is of three kinds:

original: dgod pa dang rtse ba las brtsams nas yul 'das pa rjes su dran pas rnam par g-yeng ba'i sgo dang / nyes par mthong ba dang / nyes par thos pa dang / nyes par smras pa dang / nyes par spyad pa'i thos pa dang / sems tsam la mngon par dga' bas rnam par g-yeng ba'i sgo dang /
analyzed: dgod pa dang rtse ba las brtsams nas yul 'das pa rjes su dran pas rnam par g-yeng ba'i sgo dang / nyes par mthong ba dang / nyes par thos pa dang / nyes par smras pa dang / nyes par spyad pa'i thos pa dang / sems tsam la mngon par dga' bas rnam par g-yeng ba'i sgo dang /
translated: distraction through remembering past objects that one has seen, heard, thought, or known, and through delighting in mere consciousness;

original: sngon goms pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: sngon goms pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: distraction through the force of previous habituation;🔽and distraction through the force of present circumstances.

original: lus la mngon par zhen pa ni 'khor bas mi skyo ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: lus la mngon par zhen pa ni 'khor bas mi skyo ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: Attachment to the body is due to not being disgusted with cyclic existence.

original: yul la mngon par zhen pa ni yul ma 'ongs pa la mngon par dga' ba'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: yul la mngon par zhen pa ni yul ma 'ongs pa la mngon par dga' ba'i sgo nas so //
translated: Attachment to objects is due to delighting in future objects.

original: de la nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang po'i gnyen por ni yid la byed pa gcig bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de la nye ba'i nyon mongs pa dang po'i gnyen por ni yid la byed pa gcig bsgom par bya ste /
translated: The antidote to the first secondary affliction is the cultivation of one mental attention.

original: shes bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
translated: It is the mental attention of vigilance.

original: gnyis pa'i gnyen por ni yid la byed pa gsum bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i gnyen por ni yid la byed pa gsum bsgom par bya ste /
translated: The antidote to the second is the cultivation of three mental attentions:

original: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i dmigs pa yid la byed pa dang / de'i mtshan ma rtogs pas de'i gnyen po'i rnam par rtog pa yid la byed pa dang / de'i gnas dang sems gdung ba yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: de dang rjes su mthun pa'i dmigs pa yid la byed pa dang / de'i mtshan ma rtogs pas de'i gnyen po'i rnam par rtog pa yid la byed pa dang / de'i gnas dang sems gdung ba yid la byed pa'o //
translated: mental attention to the object that is its antidote, mental attention to the conception of its sign, and mental attention to its basis and the torment of the mind.

original: gsum pa'i gnyen por ni ril po rab tu dbye ba yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa'i gnyen por ni ril po rab tu dbye ba yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the third is mental attention to the differentiation of the whole.

original: bzhi pa'i gnyen por ni mi sdug pa yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa'i gnyen por ni mi sdug pa yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The antidote to the fourth is mental attention to foulness.

original: yid la byed pa dang po kun du bsten cing goms par byas pa lan mang du byas na brjed ngas pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yid la byed pa dang po kun du bsten cing goms par byas pa lan mang du byas na brjed ngas pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one cultivates the first attention, which is the attention of faith, and makes it one's habit, one will eliminate forgetfulness.

original: gnyis pas ni lus dang yul la mngon par zhen pa sad par byed pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni lus dang yul la mngon par zhen pa sad par byed pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one cultivates the second attention, which is the attention of aspiration, one will eliminate the distraction of attachment to the body and objects.

original: gsum pas ni nyes par mthong ba la sogs pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum pas ni nyes par mthong ba la sogs pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one cultivates the third attention, which is the attention of exertion, one will eliminate the distraction of seeing faults and so on.

original: bzhi pas ni sngon goms pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i rnam par g-yeng bas spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni sngon goms pa'i stobs bskyed pa'i rnam par g-yeng bas spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one cultivates the fourth attention, which is the attention of sameness, one will eliminate the distraction of the power of previous habituation.

original: lnga pas ni lus la sdug pa dang sems can du 'du shes pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lnga pas ni lus la sdug pa dang sems can du 'du shes pa spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one cultivates the fifth attention, which is the attention of thorough analysis, one will eliminate the distraction of attachment to the body and the notion of sentient beings.

original: drug pas ni 'dod chags rnam pa bzhi po kha dog dang / reg pa dang / dbyibs dang / nye bar spyod pa'i 'dod chags rnams spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: drug pas ni 'dod chags rnam pa bzhi po kha dog dang / reg pa dang / dbyibs dang / nye bar spyod pa'i 'dod chags rnams spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one cultivates the sixth attention, which is the attention of final application, one will eliminate the four types of attachment: attachment to color, attachment to touch, attachment to shape, and attachment to behavior.

original: de ltar yid la byed pa bsgom pa de dag la brten na /
analyzed: de ltar yid la byed pa bsgom pa de dag la brten na /
translated: Thus, by cultivating these six types of attention,

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag @171b spong bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag @171b spong bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: one will eliminate those secondary mental afflictions.

original: nyer bsdogs dang / dngos gzhi dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa dang / dga' ba dang bcas pa dang / dga' ba med cing bde ba la mngon par dga' ba yongs su dag pa thob pa las sems ting nge 'dzin du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyer bsdogs dang / dngos gzhi dang bcas pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa dang / dga' ba dang bcas pa dang / dga' ba med cing bde ba la mngon par dga' ba yongs su dag pa thob pa las sems ting nge 'dzin du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He obtains the concentration of the threshold and the actual meditative absorption, as well as the joy that accompanies it. He obtains the complete purity of the delight in the absence of joy and in bliss. His mind becomes concentrated.

original: de ltar sems mnyam par gyur na ;
analyzed: de ltar sems mnyam par gyur na ;
translated: When his mind has become thus concentrated,

original: de'i 'og tu sems can mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu sems can mi rtag pa nyid dang / 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: he then understands as it really is the impermanence of beings and the impermanence of compounded things.

original: ji ltar na sems can mi rtag pa nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sems can mi rtag pa nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does he understand as it really is the impermanence of beings?

original: lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las shin tu 'das pas sems can rnams mthong ngo zhes rgya cher ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: lha'i mig rnam par dag pa mi'i las shin tu 'das pas sems can rnams mthong ngo zhes rgya cher ji skad gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: With his divine eye, which is purified and surpasses the human, he sees beings passing away and being reborn.

original: ji ltar na 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'du byed mi rtag pa nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes she na /
translated: How does he understand as it really is the impermanence of compounded things?

original: ma 'ongs pa dang 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba yid la byed pa'i rjes su zhugs pa rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa las so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa dang 'das pa dang da ltar byung ba yid la byed pa'i rjes su zhugs pa rnams rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa las so //
translated: It is the basis of the mindfulness of body, etc. because it is the basis of the mindfulness of body, etc.

original: lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa de ni gnas gsum po //🔽lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa'i yongs su sbyang ba'i sa dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bslab pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa dag la yod de /

analyzed: kun du sbyor ba lhag ma rnams spangs pa'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag pa la sogs pa byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa'i chos thams cad kyi gnas su gyur pa yin no //

analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis na 'di las phyi rol pa'i dge sbyong dang bram ze rnams dang thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is the basis of the mindfulness belonging to the

original: yongs su sbyangs pa'i sa las tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa dang ; zhi gnas kyi snying po la ro myong bar mi byed pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa la dga' zhing chags pa dang ldan pa'i sems la nyon mongs pa'i me 'byung ba'i gnas med pas so //
analyzed: yongs su sbyangs pa'i sa las tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa dang ; zhi gnas kyi snying po la ro myong bar mi byed pa dang mya ngan las 'das pa la dga' zhing chags pa dang ldan pa'i sems la nyon mongs pa'i me 'byung ba'i gnas med pas so //
translated: On the ground of thorough training, the accumulations are completed, and since there is no basis for the fire of afflictions to arise in the mind that is attached to and delights in nirvana, without savoring the essence of serenity.

original: dran pa yongs su bsgoms pa 'di'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa la brten nas 'bras bu yongs su dag pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: dran pa yongs su bsgoms pa 'di'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa la brten nas 'bras bu yongs su dag pa bzhi ste /
translated: Based on the completion of the accumulations of this thorough cultivation of mindfulness, there are four completely pure results:🔽the absence of the secondary afflictions generated by worldly phenomena when staying in a town, the absence of the secondary afflictions generated by the wilderness when staying in the wilderness, the absence of the secondary afflictions generated by the town when staying in the wilderness,

original: grong na 'dug pa la 'jig rten gyi chos kyis bskyed pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa dang / dgon pa na 'dug pa la dgon pas bskyed pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa dang / dgon pa na 'dug pa nyid la grong gis bskyed pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa dang /🔽de @172a * //
analyzed: grong na 'dug pa la 'jig rten gyi chos kyis bskyed pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa dang / dgon pa na 'dug pa la dgon pas bskyed pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa dang / dgon pa na 'dug pa nyid la grong gis bskyed pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa dang /🔽de @172a * //
translated: and the absence of the secondary afflictions generated by the wilderness when staying in the town.

original: gnyi ga na 'dug pa la 'dzag nod byed pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang du blang dgos pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga na 'dug pa la 'dzag nod byed pa la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal dang du blang dgos pa'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: There is no secondary defilement of having to accept the suffering of the emission of semen, etc.

original: zhi gnas kyi ro myong bar mi byed pa la brten nas 'bras bu yongs su dag pa lnga ste /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi ro myong bar mi byed pa la brten nas 'bras bu yongs su dag pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five fruits of purification based on not relishing the taste of serenity:

original: bsam gtan bzhi po rnam par dag pa dang / zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa rnams so //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi po rnam par dag pa dang / zhi ba'i rnam par thar pa rnams so //
translated: the purification of the four meditative concentrations, and the liberation of serenity.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la dga' zhing chags pa dang ldan pa'i sems la nyon mongs pa'i me 'byung ba'i gnas med pa la brten nas 'bras bu yongs su dag pa dgu ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la dga' zhing chags pa dang ldan pa'i sems la nyon mongs pa'i me 'byung ba'i gnas med pa la brten nas 'bras bu yongs su dag pa dgu ste /
translated: There are nine fruits of purification based on the absence of a basis for the arising of the fire of defilement in the mind that is associated with delight and attachment to nirvana:

original: dang po'i 'bras bu gsum dang / mngon par shes pa drug go //
analyzed: dang po'i 'bras bu gsum dang / mngon par shes pa drug go //
translated: the first three fruits, and the six superknowledges.

original: lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa de yang yongs su dag pa lngas bsdus pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa de yang yongs su dag pa lngas bsdus pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: That mindfulness belonging to the body is also to be understood as being included in five purities.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa yongs su dag pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa yongs su dag pa dang / bsdus pa'i sa yongs su dag pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa yongs su dag pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i 'bras bu yongs su dag pas so //🔽lus gyur pa dang ldan pa dang / der gtogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa yongs su dag pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa yongs su dag pa dang / bsdus pa'i sa yongs su dag pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa yongs su dag pa dang / thun mong ma yin pa'i 'bras bu yongs su dag pas so // lus gyur pa dang ldan pa dang / der gtogs pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The purity of the stage of non-concentration, the purity of the stage of concentration, the purity of the stage of the included, the purity of the uncommon, and the purity of the uncommon result.

original: lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa zhes bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: It is called mindfulness of the body because it is associated with the transformation of the body and because it belongs to that.

original: gsus po che chen po'i mdo rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gsus po che chen po'i mdo rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This concludes the explanation of the Sutra of the Great Final Nirvana.

original: rnam par grol ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ni gnyis te /
translated: Liberation is twofold:

original: shes rab rnam par grol ba dang / sems rnam par grol ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab rnam par grol ba dang / sems rnam par grol ba'o //
translated: liberation by wisdom and liberation by mind.

original: de la shes rab rnam par grol ba las brtsams nas 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyi spyod yul ni /
analyzed: de la shes rab rnam par grol ba las brtsams nas 'jig rten pa'i shes rab kyi spyod yul ni /
translated: Regarding this, starting from liberation by wisdom, the domain of mundane wisdom

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: is as follows:

original: nyes par spyod pa dang / legs par spyod pa gzhi dang bcas pa rnam par gzhag pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa dang / legs par spyod pa gzhi dang bcas pa rnam par gzhag pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known from the presentation of misconduct and good conduct with basis.

original: ngo bo nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The nature of reality is as follows:

original: nyes par spyod pa dang / legs par spyod pa gzhi dang bcas pa de nyid kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa dang / legs par spyod pa gzhi dang bcas pa de nyid kyi dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid la sogs pa'i rab tu dbye bas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood from the correct knowledge of the classification of virtue and vice, etc., in terms of the very same bad conduct and good conduct together with their bases.

original: sems rnam par grol ba las brtsams nas sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gnas nyid ni /
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba las brtsams nas sems kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i gnas nyid ni /
translated: The nature of the mind as the basis of defilement and purification, beginning with the liberation of the mind,

original: 'di lta ste gzugs la sogs pa yul 'dzin pa dang rnam par rig pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste gzugs la sogs pa yul 'dzin pa dang rnam par rig pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: is to be understood from the apprehension of objects such as form and from consciousness.

original: 'jig rten pa'i shes rab dang / sems rnam par grol ba de nyid kyi 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i shes rab dang / sems rnam par grol ba de nyid kyi 'bras bu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The result of that mundane wisdom and liberation of the mind is as follows:

original: de dang mtshungs par ldan zhing 'dres pas kun @172b nas nyon mongs pa'i rigs dman pa las rnam par slong ba las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dang mtshungs par ldan zhing 'dres pas kun @172b nas nyon mongs pa'i rigs dman pa las rnam par slong ba las rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood from the arousal of the inferior class of defilement that is associated with and mixed up in that.

original: shes rab rnam par grol ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: shes rab rnam par grol ba de nyid kyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to that very liberation by wisdom,

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi spyod yul ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyi spyod yul ni /
translated: The domain of supramundane wisdom

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: is as follows:

original: 'jig rten pa'i shes rab dang / sems rnam par grol ba de nyid la sogs pa shes bya thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i shes rab dang / sems rnam par grol ba de nyid la sogs pa shes bya thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known as the correct understanding of all objects of knowledge, such as the mundane wisdom and the liberation of the mind itself.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab dang sems rnam par grol ba de nyid kyi 'bras bu ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab dang sems rnam par grol ba de nyid kyi 'bras bu ni /
translated: The fruit of that supramundane wisdom and liberation of the mind

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: is as follows:

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rigs thams cad las rnam par slod pa las rig par ba'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rigs thams cad las rnam par slod pa las rig par ba'o //
translated: It should be known as the complete liberation from all types of afflictions.

original: de la 'jig rten pa'i shes rab gang yin pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de gcig tu bsdus pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'jig rten pa'i shes rab gang yin pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab gang yin pa de gcig tu bsdus pa ni yang dag pa'i lta ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therein, the mundane wisdom and the supramundane wisdom, when combined into one, are called right view.

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba de'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba de'i rgyu ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The cause of that right view is as follows:

original: sangs rgyas 'byung ba yod pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / de phyin ci ma log par yid la byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'byung ba yod pa dang / dam pa'i chos nyan pa dang / de phyin ci ma log par yid la byed pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the appearance of the Buddha, the hearing of the true Dharma, and the practice of the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma are the results of the supramundane correct view.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba de'i 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yang dag pa'i lta ba de'i 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The characteristics of the results of the supramundane correct view are as follows:

original: snga phyir rtag pa dang / mi mthun pa med pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: snga phyir rtag pa dang / mi mthun pa med pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they are permanent and without conflict.

original: chos gang dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod cing byung na mi 'byung zhing 'gag par 'gyur ba dang ; mi mthun pa'i phyogs med cing 'gags nas 'byung ba de dag ni mi mthun pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos gang dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod cing byung na mi 'byung zhing 'gag par 'gyur ba dang ; mi mthun pa'i phyogs med cing 'gags nas 'byung ba de dag ni mi mthun pa dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Those dharmas that do not occur and cease when their opposing forces occur and arise, and that do occur and cease when their opposing forces do not occur and cease, are said to be “with conflict.”

original: chos gang dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod kyang rung med kyang rung skyes kyang rung ma skyes kyang rung ste /
analyzed: chos gang dag mi mthun pa'i phyogs yod kyang rung med kyang rung skyes kyang rung ma skyes kyang rung ste /
translated: Those dharmas that are either with or without opposing forces, and that either occur or do not occur,

original: dus rtag tu yod pa de dag ni mi mthun pa med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dus rtag tu yod pa de dag ni mi mthun pa med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: should be understood as “without conflict” because they always exist.

original: de'i 'bras bu sems rnam par grol ba de'i dbang du byas nas spyod yul dang bcas pa dang / de'i gnas rnam par dag pa ni 'di lta ste sems rnam par dag pa'i dbang gis dbang po gzugs can rnams kyi spyod yul la kun nas nyon mongs pa mi 'byung ba dang /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu sems rnam par grol ba de'i dbang du byas nas spyod yul dang bcas pa dang / de'i gnas rnam par dag pa ni 'di lta ste sems rnam par dag pa'i dbang gis dbang po gzugs can rnams kyi spyod yul la kun nas nyon mongs pa mi 'byung ba dang /
translated: The basis of that is the purity of the sense faculties, which should be understood as the non-arising of afflictions in the domain of the physical sense faculties through the power of the purity of the mind.

original: dbang po rnams kyang rnam par dag pa de'i rjes su 'jug pa las rig par bya'o //🔽sems rnam par grol ba de'i gnas pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dbang po rnams kyang rnam par dag pa de'i rjes su 'jug pa las rig par bya'o // sems rnam par grol ba de'i gnas pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: And the sense faculties themselves are also understood to follow that purity.

original: tshe dang drod gcig la gcig brten cing gnas pa'i rgyun 'brel pa las rig par bya'o //🔽'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par grol ba rnam pa gnyi ga'i @173a * //
analyzed: tshe dang drod gcig la gcig brten cing gnas pa'i rgyun 'brel pa las rig par bya'o // 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par grol ba rnam pa gnyi ga'i @173a * //
translated: The basis of that completely liberated mind is the connection of the continuity of life and heat, which should be understood as mutually dependent.

original: 'bras bu'i khyad par ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i khyad par ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The difference in the result of the two types of complete liberation, mundane and supramundane, is as follows.

original: tshor ba gzhi dang bcas pa dag la kun du rmongs shing sred pa dang bcas pa'i phyi ma la yang 'byung ba mngon par 'grub pa dang / kun du ma rmongs shing sred pa med pa'i phyi ma la yang 'byung ba mngon par mi 'grub pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshor ba gzhi dang bcas pa dag la kun du rmongs shing sred pa dang bcas pa'i phyi ma la yang 'byung ba mngon par 'grub pa dang / kun du ma rmongs shing sred pa med pa'i phyi ma la yang 'byung ba mngon par mi 'grub pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the future arising of the aggregates is due to the delusion and craving for feeling and its basis, and that the future non-arising of the aggregates is due to the non-delusion and non-craving for feeling and its basis.

original: de dang 'dres shing mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir /🔽de la brten pa sems las 'byung ba'i chos rnam par dag par rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de dang 'dres shing mtshungs par ldan pa'i phyir / de la brten pa sems las 'byung ba'i chos rnam par dag par rig pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Because it is mixed with and associated with that.

original: da ltar gyi rkyen gyis ma gos pa ste so sor myong ba las rig par bya'o //🔽rnam par grol ba de gnyis kyi gnas pa'i khyad par ni 'di lta ste /🔽rab tu zhi ba rnam pa drug po rnam par dag pa'i rnam par shes pa'i 'chi 'pho ba mnyam pas yin gyi /
analyzed: da ltar gyi rkyen gyis ma gos pa ste so sor myong ba las rig par bya'o // rnam par grol ba de gnyis kyi gnas pa'i khyad par ni 'di lta ste / rab tu zhi ba rnam pa drug po rnam par dag pa'i rnam par shes pa'i 'chi 'pho ba mnyam pas yin gyi /
translated: The purity of the mental factors that are based on that should be understood from the experience of not being tainted by present conditions.🔽The difference in the abodes of those two liberations should be understood from the fact that the liberation of mind is the same in terms of the consciousness of purity, but not the same in terms of its abode.

original: de'i gnas mnyam pas ni ma yin pa las rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i gnas mnyam pas ni ma yin pa las rig par bya ste /
translated: The liberation of wisdom is the same in terms of both.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na mngon par 'du bya ba med par snyoms par 'jug pas rab tu zhi ba dang / ldang ba'i dus na mngon par 'du bya ba med par ldang bas rab tu zhi ba dang / rim gyis ldang ba dang / snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'du byed pa rnam pa gsum 'byung ba rab tu zhi ba dang /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa'i dus na mngon par 'du bya ba med par snyoms par 'jug pas rab tu zhi ba dang / ldang ba'i dus na mngon par 'du bya ba med par ldang bas rab tu zhi ba dang / rim gyis ldang ba dang / snyoms par zhugs pa'i 'du byed pa rnam pa gsum 'byung ba rab tu zhi ba dang /
translated: It is pacified in terms of the time of meditative equipoise since it enters meditative equipoise without manifest effort, it is pacified in terms of the time of rising from meditative equipoise since it rises from meditative equipoise without manifest effort and it is pacified in terms of the three types of formative factors that arise in sequence, such as rising from meditative equipoise and entering meditative equipoise.

original: 'di lta ste dus gsum po dgon par tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i 'du 'dzi can gyi dang / grong du khyim pa'i 'du 'dzi can gyi dang / de gnyis kar 'du byed kyi mtshan ma la spyod pa'i yun ring pos ldang ba'i sems rab tu zhi ba dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dus gsum po dgon par tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i 'du 'dzi can gyi dang / grong du khyim pa'i 'du 'dzi can gyi dang / de gnyis kar 'du byed kyi mtshan ma la spyod pa'i yun ring pos ldang ba'i sems rab tu zhi ba dang /
translated: It is pacified in terms of the mind of rising from meditative equipoise through the long duration of engaging in the signs of formative factors in the three times, such as the distraction of those who are celibate in the wilderness, the distraction of householders in the village and the distraction of both of those.

original: 'di lta ste dus gsum po kho na gzugs can 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mchog las ldang ba dang / gzugs can ma yin pa 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mchog las ldang ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa sems dang bcas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dus gsum po kho na gzugs can 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mchog las ldang ba dang / gzugs can ma yin pa 'jig rten pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa mchog las ldang ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa sems dang bcas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las ldang ba'i phyir dang /
translated: For example, one arises from the supreme mundane state of the form realm, one arises from the supreme mundane state of the formless realm, and one arises from the transcendent meditative attainment that possesses mind.

original: dus nye bas ldang ba'i sems rab tu zhi bas so //
analyzed: dus nye bas ldang ba'i sems rab tu zhi bas so //
translated: One arises due to the proximity of time and the mind of arising is very peaceful.

original: snyoms par 'jug pa de dag kyang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las langs pa kho na las 'thob pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pa de dag kyang 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa las langs pa kho na las 'thob pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: One does not obtain those meditative attainments from arising from the meditative attainment of cessation alone.

original: 'on kyang sngon thob pa rnams mngon du byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon thob pa rnams mngon du byed do //
translated: However, one manifests those previously obtained.

original: gnyis ni mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug pa dang / de'i gong nas gong du snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par dag pa las thob pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis ni mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug pa dang / de'i gong nas gong du snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par dag pa las thob pa yin no //
translated: Two are obtained from the pure meditative attainment of entering meditative attainment in order and from entering meditative attainment in order above that.

original: gcig ni mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug pa las ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gcig ni mthar gyis snyoms par 'jug pa las ma yin mod kyi /
translated: One is not obtained from entering meditative attainment in order.

original: 'on kyang @173b mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings rab tu rtogs pa dang / de'i gong nas gong du snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par dag pa las so //
analyzed: 'on kyang @173b mtshan ma med pa'i dbyings rab tu rtogs pa dang / de'i gong nas gong du snyoms par 'jug pa rnam par dag pa las so //
translated: However, the realization of the sphere of signlessness and the purification of meditative attainment from the higher to the higher.

original: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang ldang ba ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i yid la byed pas so //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gnas pa dang ldang ba ni mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i yid la byed pas so //
translated: The meditative attainment of meditative attainment with signs and the abiding and emerging are with attention with signs.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gnas pa ni mtshan ma med pas so //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang / gnas pa ni mtshan ma med pas so //
translated: The meditative attainment of meditative attainment without signs and the abiding are without signs.

original: ldang ba ni mtshan ma dang bcas pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ldang ba ni mtshan ma dang bcas pas rig par bya'o //
translated: The emerging is to be known as with signs.

original: chos kyi gzhi'i mdo rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: chos kyi gzhi'i mdo rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the Sūtra on the Foundation of Mindfulness.

original: chos mngon pa dang 'dul ba mngon pa la mkhas pa'i dge slong ngam /
analyzed: chos mngon pa dang 'dul ba mngon pa la mkhas pa'i dge slong ngam /
translated: A monk or lay practitioner who is learned in Abhidharma and the Abhidharma of the Vinaya,

original: dge bsnyen kun shes pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: dge bsnyen kun shes pa las brtsams te /
translated: beginning with complete understanding,

original: dri ba 'dri bar 'dod pas ni rnam pa brgyad kyis dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: dri ba 'dri bar 'dod pas ni rnam pa brgyad kyis dri bar bya ste /
translated: if he wishes to ask questions, should ask in eight ways.

original: rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight ways?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: kun shes pa'i gzhi dang / kun shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / kun shes pa'i 'bras bu dang kun shes pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / kun shes pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par dang / kun shes pa'i gnas dang / kun shes pa'i phan yon dang /
analyzed: kun shes pa'i gzhi dang / kun shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / kun shes pa'i 'bras bu dang kun shes pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / kun shes pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par dang / kun shes pa'i gnas dang / kun shes pa'i phan yon dang /
translated: the basis of complete understanding, the counteragent to complete understanding, the result of complete understanding, the nature of complete understanding, the special result of complete understanding, the state of complete understanding, the benefit of complete understanding,

original: kun shes pa yang dag par 'grub pas so //
analyzed: kun shes pa yang dag par 'grub pas so //
translated: and the establishment of complete understanding.

original: de la kun shes pa'i gzhi ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag ste /
analyzed: de la kun shes pa'i gzhi ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po dag ste /
translated: The basis of complete understanding is the five appropriative aggregates.

original: nye bar brtag par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de la kun shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni sred pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar brtag par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // de la kun shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ni sred pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: Because they are the objects to be thoroughly investigated.🔽The counteragent to complete understanding is the defilement of craving and the defilement of views.

original: de la sred pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni /
analyzed: de la sred pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni /
translated: The defilement of craving is the cause of the arising of the appropriative aggregates.

original: yang 'byung ba 'gog pa la mngon par dga' bar mi byed do //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba 'gog pa la mngon par dga' bar mi byed do //
translated: Because of it, one does not delight in the cessation of arising.🔽The defilement of views is the cause of the non-realization of the cessation of arising.

original: lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas ni mngon par dga' yang rtogs par mi byed do //
analyzed: lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pas ni mngon par dga' yang rtogs par mi byed do //
translated: Because of it, even though one delights in cessation, one does not realize it.

original: de la kun shes pa'i 'bras bu ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis po gang yin pa de nyid spangs pa'o //
analyzed: de la kun shes pa'i 'bras bu ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gnyis po gang yin pa de nyid spangs pa'o //
translated: The result of complete understanding is the abandonment of the two kinds of afflictions.

original: de la kun shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: de la kun shes pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa ste /
translated: The nature of complete understanding is the eightfold noble path.

original: de yang 'di las phyi rol pa'i lta ba ngan pa sna tshogs kyi gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'di las phyi rol pa'i lta ba ngan pa sna tshogs kyi gnyen po yin no //
translated: It is the antidote to the various bad views of non-Buddhists.

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen pos phung po gsum du rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa de yang kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen pos phung po gsum du rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: That eightfold noble path is established as three heaps by way of the antidote to the three kinds of afflictions:

original: nyes par spyod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang / 'dod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang / lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs @174a * //🔽pa'i gnyen pos so //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang / 'dod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po dang / lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs @174a * // pa'i gnyen pos so //
translated: the antidote to the affliction of bad conduct, the antidote to the affliction of desire, and the antidote to the affliction of views.

original: de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa yin du zin kyang 'dus byas yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten las 'das pa yin du zin kyang 'dus byas yin no //
translated: Even though it is supramundane, it is still conditioned.

original: de la kun shes pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par ni spangs pa ste /
analyzed: de la kun shes pa'i 'bras bu'i khyad par ni spangs pa ste /
translated: The result of complete understanding is the abandonment of the two kinds of afflictions.

original: de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa dang 'dus ma byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten las 'das pa dang 'dus ma byas pa yin no //
translated: It is supramundane and unconditioned.

original: de la kun shes pa'i gnas ni ting nge 'dzin te de yang rnam pa bzhis rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la kun shes pa'i gnas ni ting nge 'dzin te de yang rnam pa bzhis rig par bya ste /
translated: The basis of the knowledge of all things is concentration. It should be understood as being of four types:

original: rigs las ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rigs las ni 'di lta ste /
translated: From the point of view of its nature,

original: ting nge 'dzin gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: whatever concentration there is,

original: de thams cad ni bsam gtan gyi rigs yin no //
analyzed: de thams cad ni bsam gtan gyi rigs yin no //
translated: all of it is of the nature of meditation.

original: de las gzhan pa'i bsam gtan gyi yan lag bstan pa las ni /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i bsam gtan gyi yan lag bstan pa las ni /
translated: From the point of view of its branches,

original: de las gzhan pa'i bsam gtan gyi yan lag bstan pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i bsam gtan gyi yan lag bstan pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood as being taught in the other branches of meditation.🔽From the point of view of its characteristics,

original: mtshan nyid dang / skye ba'i dmigs pa'i mtshan ma dang / 'grub pa'i rgyu'i mtshan ma las kyang khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang / skye ba'i dmigs pa'i mtshan ma dang / 'grub pa'i rgyu'i mtshan ma las kyang khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: it should be understood as having the characteristics of the object of the arising of the sign and the cause of the accomplishment of the sign.

original: de la kun shes pa'i phan yon ni 'gog pa'i snyoms bar 'jug pa gnas pa mchog ste /
analyzed: de la kun shes pa'i phan yon ni 'gog pa'i snyoms bar 'jug pa gnas pa mchog ste /
translated: The benefit of the knowledge of all things is the supreme abiding in the meditative attainment of cessation.

original: kun shes pa'i phan yon zhes bya'o //
analyzed: kun shes pa'i phan yon zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the benefit of the knowledge of all things.

original: de yang rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as being of five types:

original: 'gog pa'i gzhi dang / zhi ba dang / tshul dang mthun pa dang tshul dang mi mthun pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i rgyu dang / ldang ba'i rgyu dang / ldang ba'i phan yon las kyang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i gzhi dang / zhi ba dang / tshul dang mthun pa dang tshul dang mi mthun pa'i gzugs brnyan dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i rgyu dang / ldang ba'i rgyu dang / ldang ba'i phan yon las kyang rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood from the basis of cessation, from peace, from the concordant and discordant images, from the cause of meditative attainment, from the cause of emergence, and from the benefit of emergence.

original: de la kun shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag nyid la tshor ba rnam pa brgyad brtag pa gang yin pa ste /
