analyzed: de la kun shes pa yang dag par 'grub pa ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po de dag nyid la tshor ba rnam pa brgyad brtag pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The establishment of complete knowledge is the investigation of the eight kinds of feeling in the five appropriating aggregates.

original: ngo bo nyid brtag pa dang / tshe 'di la 'jug pa'i rgyu brtag pa dang / tshe 'di la 'jug pa 'gag pa'i rgyu brtag pa dang / tshe phyi ma la 'jug pa'i rgyu brtag pa dang / tshe phyi ma la 'jug pa 'gag pa'i rgyu brtag pa dang /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid brtag pa dang / tshe 'di la 'jug pa'i rgyu brtag pa dang / tshe 'di la 'jug pa 'gag pa'i rgyu brtag pa dang / tshe phyi ma la 'jug pa'i rgyu brtag pa dang / tshe phyi ma la 'jug pa 'gag pa'i rgyu brtag pa dang /
translated: The investigation of their nature, the investigation of the cause of engagement in this life, the investigation of the cause of the cessation of engagement in this life, the investigation of the cause of engagement in the next life, the investigation of the cause of the cessation of engagement in the next life, the investigation of the cause of the cessation of the cessation of engagement in the next life, the investigation of the cause of the emergence from meditative attainment, and the investigation of the benefit of emergence.

original: de gnyi ga la 'jug pa dang / 'gag pa'i rgyu brtag pa dang / 'jug pa'i rgyu'i rgyu brtag pa dang / ldog pa'i rgyu'i rgyu brtag pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyi ga la 'jug pa dang / 'gag pa'i rgyu brtag pa dang / 'jug pa'i rgyu'i rgyu brtag pa dang / ldog pa'i rgyu'i rgyu brtag pa'o //
translated: The investigation of the cause of both their occurrence and cessation, the investigation of the cause of the cause of their occurrence, and the investigation of the cause of the cause of their cessation.

original: de la bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi gtso bo la ni bde ba dang ldan pa yang gnyen po yin no //🔽nyer bsdogs thob pa'i mngon par 'byung ba la 'dun pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi gtso bo la ni bde ba dang ldan pa yang gnyen po yin no // nyer bsdogs thob pa'i mngon par 'byung ba la 'dun pa dang ldan pa /
translated: In the principal actual bases of meditative concentration, the antidote is associated with pleasure.

original: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa yang gnyen po yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang ldan pa yang gnyen po yin no //
translated: In the preliminary stages of meditative concentration, the antidote is associated with pain, for one who is intent on renunciation.

original: bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi nyid la ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa yang gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dngos gzhi nyid la ni sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa yang gnyen po yin te /
translated: In the actual bases of meditative concentration, the antidote is associated with neither pleasure nor pain.

original: 'jug pa'i rgyu 'gag pa'i phyir tshor ba'i gzhi kho na las @174b yongs su bstan to //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rgyu 'gag pa'i phyir tshor ba'i gzhi kho na las @174b yongs su bstan to //
translated: The cause of their occurrence is explained in the context of the basis of feeling alone, because the cause of the cause of their occurrence has ceased.

original: de la tshor ba gang ci yang rung ste /
analyzed: de la tshor ba gang ci yang rung ste /
translated: Whatever feeling there is,

original: de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de ni 'dir sdug bsngal ba yin no zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: in this context, that is suffering.

original: tshor ba gsum char yang don dam par na sdug bsngal ba yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba gsum char yang don dam par na sdug bsngal ba yin no //
translated: All three feelings are ultimately suffering.

original: de la mthun pa zhes bya ba ni gang yod na gang gdags pa de ni de dad mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de la mthun pa zhes bya ba ni gang yod na gang gdags pa de ni de dad mthun pa yin no //
translated: Here, “consistent” means that when something is designated, it is consistent with that.

original: de la tshor ba thams cad kyang phan tshun mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: de la tshor ba thams cad kyang phan tshun mthun pa yin te /
translated: In this regard, all feelings are consistent with each other,

original: thams cad kyang sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang sdug bsngal gyis bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all are included in suffering.

original: don dam pa pa'i sdug bsngal de yod na de mi shes pa yang yod do //
analyzed: don dam pa pa'i sdug bsngal de yod na de mi shes pa yang yod do //
translated: When there is ultimate suffering, there is also the ignorance of that.

original: de yod na de'i gnyen por 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyang yod de /
analyzed: de yod na de'i gnyen por 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab kyang yod de /
translated: When there is that, there is also supramundane wisdom as the antidote to that.

original: de yod na de'i 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa yang yod de /
analyzed: de yod na de'i 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa yang yod de /
translated: When there is that, there is also the result of that, which is nirvāṇa.

original: de'i phyir chos de dang de dag ni chos de dang de dag mthun pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos de dang de dag ni chos de dang de dag mthun pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, those dharmas are said to be consistent with those dharmas.

original: gnyid kyi mdo rnam par bshad pa ni nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas la rjes su brtson pa'i dge slong gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de spang pa'i gnyen po ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnyid kyi mdo rnam par bshad pa ni nang gi sems kyi zhi gnas la rjes su brtson pa'i dge slong gi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de spang pa'i gnyen po ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: The explanation of the sleep sutra is as follows: The antidote to abandon the secondary affliction of a monk who is diligent in inner mental tranquility should be known as fivefold:

original: mun pa'i mtshan ma yongs su spang ba dang / yang dag par rab tu gzung bar bya ba mchog tu dga' ba'i gnas dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la yang dag par rab tu 'dzin par sbyor ba dang / rigs pas lta ba 'joms pa dang /
analyzed: mun pa'i mtshan ma yongs su spang ba dang / yang dag par rab tu gzung bar bya ba mchog tu dga' ba'i gnas dang mthun pa'i chos rnams la yang dag par rab tu 'dzin par sbyor ba dang / rigs pas lta ba 'joms pa dang /
translated: abandoning the sign of darkness, applying correct apprehension to the factors conducive to the supreme joy of correct apprehension, destroying views through reasoning,

original: lta ba spyod pa dang / lta ba'i gnas spyod pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba spyod pa dang / lta ba'i gnas spyod pa'o //
translated: practicing the view, and practicing the basis of the view.

original: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de spangs pa na /
analyzed: nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de spangs pa na /
translated: When that secondary affliction is abandoned,

original: ting nge 'dzin nye bar rtog pa ni lnga kho nar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin nye bar rtog pa ni lnga kho nar rig par bya ste /
translated: the investigation of samadhi should be known as just five:

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: rab tu dben zhing rab tu dben par gnas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin 'grub pa'i gtam dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyi rjes su mthun pa'i 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnams dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la mkhas pa rnams las rjes su mthun pa'i gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa 'thob par bka' blo bde pa nyid dang /
analyzed: rab tu dben zhing rab tu dben par gnas pa dang / ting nge 'dzin 'grub pa'i gtam dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i sems kyi rjes su mthun pa'i 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnams dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la mkhas pa rnams las rjes su mthun pa'i gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa 'thob par bka' blo bde pa nyid dang /
translated: It is to dwell in complete solitude. It is to speak about the accomplishment of meditative concentration. It is to have the requisites for life that are suitable for a mind that is free of afflictions. It is to receive the appropriate instructions and teachings from those who are skilled in pure conduct. It is to have a mind that is open to advice.

original: 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag la ro myang ba yongs su spangs nas zag pa med pa'i rnam pas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa dag la ro myang ba yongs su spangs nas zag pa med pa'i rnam pas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o //
translated: It is to properly pay attention by means of the uncontaminated aspects, having abandoned the enjoyment of mundane meditative absorption and meditative attainments.

original: lhag pa'i sems la brtson pa'i dge slong gis ni /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la brtson pa'i dge slong gis ni /
translated: “A monk who is striving in the practice of higher concentration

original: rgyu gsum gyis nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa kun du 'byung ba so sor btsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis nyon mongs pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa kun du 'byung ba so sor btsal bar bya ste /
translated: should investigate the occurrence of afflicted thoughts in three ways.

original: dmigs pa yongs su spang ba dang / ngo bo nyid yang dag par sun dbyung ba dang / ngo bo nyid yongs su spang ba las so //
analyzed: dmigs pa yongs su spang ba dang / ngo bo nyid yang dag par sun dbyung ba dang / ngo bo nyid yongs su spang ba las so //
translated: by abandoning the object, by rejecting the intrinsic nature, and by abandoning the intrinsic nature.

original: @175a * // de la rgyu gsum gyis na ngo bo nyid yongs su spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: @175a * // de la rgyu gsum gyis na ngo bo nyid yongs su spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: There are three causes for abandoning the intrinsic nature:

original: gnyen po'i stobs dang ldan pa dbang po rnon po'i ni lan cig gis so //
analyzed: gnyen po'i stobs dang ldan pa dbang po rnon po'i ni lan cig gis so //
translated: The sharp faculty who possesses the power of the antidote abandons it in one moment.

original: gnyen po'i stobs dang mi ldan pa dbang po 'bring gi ni tshe rim las rim gyis so //
analyzed: gnyen po'i stobs dang mi ldan pa dbang po 'bring gi ni tshe rim las rim gyis so //
translated: The middling faculty who does not possess the power of the antidote abandons it gradually, in stages, over a period of time.

original: gnyen po'i stobs dang mi ldan pa dbang po rtul po'i ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu zang zing las shas cher skyon du yang dag par lta ba las so //
analyzed: gnyen po'i stobs dang mi ldan pa dbang po rtul po'i ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu zang zing las shas cher skyon du yang dag par lta ba las so //
translated: The dull faculty who does not possess the power of the antidote abandons it by seeing the faults of the cause of discursive thought, which is the substantial basis, to a great extent.

original: gang zag gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin ni gsum du rig  par bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag gsum gyi ting nge 'dzin ni gsum du rig  par bya ste /
translated: The concentrations of three persons should be understood as three types:

original: lhag pa'i sems la brtson pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni sems can rnam pa bzhi po gnod pa byed pa rnams dang / sdig pa byed pa rnams dang ; dge ba byed pa rnams dang / phan pa byed pa'i sems can rnams la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la brtson pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni sems can rnam pa bzhi po gnod pa byed pa rnams dang / sdig pa byed pa rnams dang ; dge ba byed pa rnams dang / phan pa byed pa'i sems can rnams la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The samadhi of striving for higher mind has four kinds of sentient beings as its object: those who do harm, those who do evil, those who do good, and those who help.

original: mthar thug par 'gro ba la brtson pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni chos la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: mthar thug par 'gro ba la brtson pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni chos la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: The samadhi of striving for final deliverance has the Dharma as its object.

original: mngon par rtogs pa la brtson pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni chos la dmigs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa la brtson pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni chos la dmigs pa kho na yin no //
translated: The samadhi of striving for realization has only the Dharma as its object.

original: chen po rnam pa gsum gyis ni ting nge 'dzin chen pos myur ba myur ba kho nar de bzhin nyid rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: chen po rnam pa gsum gyis ni ting nge 'dzin chen pos myur ba myur ba kho nar de bzhin nyid rtogs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: By means of the three greatnesses, one quickly, quickly realizes thusness through the great samadhi.

original: rtogs nas kyang zag pa zad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtogs nas kyang zag pa zad par 'gyur te /
translated: And having realized it, one exhausts the defilements.

original: dmigs pa chen po dang mngon par brtson pa chen po dang / thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i yid la byed pa chen pos so //
analyzed: dmigs pa chen po dang mngon par brtson pa chen po dang / thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i yid la byed pa chen pos so //
translated: By means of the great object, the great striving, and the great mental attention which is embraced by the means.

original: dben pa gnyis ni myur ba myur ba kho nar de bzhin nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: dben pa gnyis ni myur ba myur ba kho nar de bzhin nyid rtogs par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: The two kinds of solitude are the solitude of body and the solitude of mind.

original: rgyu bar gyur pa ni 'du 'dzi las dben pa dang / gnas par gyur pa na rnam par rtog pa ngan pa las dben pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu bar gyur pa ni 'du 'dzi las dben pa dang / gnas par gyur pa na rnam par rtog pa ngan pa las dben pa'o //
translated: The solitude of body is the solitude of the person who has gone into the forest, etc.🔽The solitude of mind is the solitude of the person who, even though living in a village, etc.,

original: ting nge 'dzin dang mi mthun pa'i chos ni lnga ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang mi mthun pa'i chos ni lnga ste /
translated: The five unfavorable conditions for samādhi are:

original: ltung ba dang rtag tu sbyor bar mi byed pa dang / gus par sbyor bar mi byed pa dang / zhum pa dang / gzhan las kun du gnod pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba dang rtag tu sbyor bar mi byed pa dang / gus par sbyor bar mi byed pa dang / zhum pa dang / gzhan las kun du gnod pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: 1) not being devoted to the practice of morality, 2) not being devoted to the practice of samādhi, 3) being devoted to the practice of bad views, 4) being devoted to the practice of bad friends, and 5) being devoted to the practice of laziness.

original: dben pa na rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dben pa na rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of solitude:

original: gnas pa dben pa dang / lta ba dben pa dang / nyan pa dben pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa dben pa dang / lta ba dben pa dang / nyan pa dben pa'o //
translated: 1) the solitude of place, 2) the solitude of mind, and 3) the solitude of abandonment.

original: sems rnam par sbyong ba la zhugs pa'i dge slong gi ting nge 'dzin dang mi mthun pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du gcod pa'i snying thag pa'i skyon ni lnga po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: sems rnam par sbyong ba la zhugs pa'i dge slong gi ting nge 'dzin dang mi mthun pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi bar du gcod pa'i snying thag pa'i skyon ni lnga po 'di dag yin te /
translated: The five faults of the heart that are unfavorable to the samādhi and that are obstacles to the samādhi of the monk who has entered the purification of the mind are:

original: 'di lta ste khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / mi bzod pa'o //
translated: They are: anger, pride, attachment to sense objects, the afflicted view of the perishing aggregates, and intolerance.

original: snying thag pa nas ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma ni lnga po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: snying thag pa nas ting nge 'dzin gyi mtshan ma ni lnga po 'di dag yin te /
translated: There are five signs of meditative concentration that are deeply rooted.

original: de dag ni de dag gi @175b gnyen por gnas pa yin pas na /
analyzed: de dag ni de dag gi @175b gnyen por gnas pa yin pas na /
translated: They are the antidotes to those five faults.

original: de'i phyir snying thag pa'i skyon rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir snying thag pa'i skyon rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are called the “deeply rooted virtues.”

original: mtshan ma lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: mtshan ma lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five signs?

original: yo byad ngan don tsam gyis chog shes pa dang / dge ba gang yin zhes tshol ba dang / lus dang longs spyod la mi lta ba dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la skyon dang yon tan du lta ba dang / sbyor ba'i gnod pa bzod pa'o //
analyzed: yo byad ngan don tsam gyis chog shes pa dang / dge ba gang yin zhes tshol ba dang / lus dang longs spyod la mi lta ba dang / 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la skyon dang yon tan du lta ba dang / sbyor ba'i gnod pa bzod pa'o //
translated: They are: being satisfied with only a little, seeking what is wholesome, not being concerned with bodily well-being or wealth, viewing the faults of samsara and the virtues of nirvana, and tolerating the pain of exertion.

original: de la khros shing khro ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa ni gal te /
analyzed: de la khros shing khro ba'i bsam pa dang ldan pa ni gal te /
translated: If someone is angry and has an angry disposition, he or she will not obtain

original: khyim rnams su rnyed pa dang / rnyed par bya ba ma rnyed dam /
analyzed: khyim rnams su rnyed pa dang / rnyed par bya ba ma rnyed dam /
translated: wealth and honor in the homes of others.

original: chung ngu'am ngan pa'am /
analyzed: chung ngu'am ngan pa'am /
translated: If he or she does obtain them, they will be small and of poor quality.

original: bskyongs  te'am /
analyzed: bskyongs  te'am /
translated: and to maintain it.🔽🔽

original: gus par ma byas par rnyed par gyur na /
analyzed: gus par ma byas par rnyed par gyur na /
translated: If he does not obtain them through respect,

original: de des khro ba dang 'khrug par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de des khro ba dang 'khrug par 'gyur zhing /
translated: he becomes angry and upset.

original: gzhi de las gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa la lan mang du rjes su rtog par byed /
analyzed: gzhi de las gnod sems kyi rnam par rtog pa dang / 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa la lan mang du rjes su rtog par byed /
translated: From that basis, he frequently thinks thoughts of malice and thoughts of violence.

original: rjes su dpyod par byed de /
analyzed: rjes su dpyod par byed de /
translated: He frequently analyzes them.

original: des na de'i ting nge 'dzin dang po nyid nas ma skyes pa ni skye bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na de'i ting nge 'dzin dang po nyid nas ma skyes pa ni skye bar 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, his samādhi does not arise in the first place,

original: skyes pa ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes pa ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: and if it has arisen, it degenerates.

original: de la nga rgyal gyis mngon par zin cing nga rgyal gyi bsam pa dang ldan pa ni rang bzhin nyid kyis chos rnams la gus pa ma skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: de la nga rgyal gyis mngon par zin cing nga rgyal gyi bsam pa dang ldan pa ni rang bzhin nyid kyis chos rnams la gus pa ma skyes pa yin te /
translated: “He is seized by pride and has a mind full of pride. He does not naturally respect the Dharma.🔽He does not bow his body or mind

original: de ni slob dpon dang bla ma dang sbyin gnas rnams la /
analyzed: de ni slob dpon dang bla ma dang sbyin gnas rnams la /
translated: to spiritual masters, gurus, and those worthy of honor

original: dus dus su lus 'dud par mi byed /🔽sems 'dud par mi byed cing /
analyzed: dus dus su lus 'dud par mi byed /🔽sems 'dud par mi byed cing /
translated: from time to time.

original: 'di lta ste dge ba gang yin zhes yongs su btsal ba'i phyir yongs su zhu bar mi byed /
analyzed: 'di lta ste dge ba gang yin zhes yongs su btsal ba'i phyir yongs su zhu bar mi byed /
translated: They do not ask questions, thinking, “What is virtuous?”

original: yongs su 'dri bar mi byed de /
analyzed: yongs su 'dri bar mi byed de /
translated: They do not ask questions or make inquiries about what is virtuous.

original: des na ting nge 'dzin bsgrub pa las brtsams pa'i don rtogs par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: des na ting nge 'dzin bsgrub pa las brtsams pa'i don rtogs par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: Therefore, they do not understand the meaning that is the basis for accomplishing meditative absorption.

original: gzhi de las rlom pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la lan mang du rjes su rtog par byed /🔽rjes su dpyod par byed de /🔽des na de'i ting nge 'dzin dang po nyid nas ma skyes pa ni skye bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhi de las rlom pa dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa la lan mang du rjes su rtog par byed / rjes su dpyod par byed de / des na de'i ting nge 'dzin dang po nyid nas ma skyes pa ni skye bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: They frequently think and reflect with thoughts of conceit about that basis.

original: skyes pa ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes pa ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, meditative absorption that has not yet arisen does not arise and that which has arisen is lost.

original: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis chags shing 'dod chags kyi bsam pa dang ldan pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyis chags shing 'dod chags kyi bsam pa dang ldan pa ni /
translated: Those who are attached to and desirous of the desire realm and who possess thoughts of desire

original: lus dang longs spyod dag la shin tu lta ba can yin pas des na de phyi rol gyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la rnam par g-yeng ba mang ba yin te /
analyzed: lus dang longs spyod dag la shin tu lta ba can yin pas des na de phyi rol gyi 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag la rnam par g-yeng ba mang ba yin te /
translated: are those who are strongly attached to bodies and enjoyments. Therefore, they are frequently distracted by the five external sense pleasures.

original: gzhi des 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / nye du'i rnam par rtog pa dang / yul gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / khyim gyi 'byor ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag la lan mang du rjes su rtog par byed /🔽rjes @176a * //
analyzed: gzhi des 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa dang / nye du'i rnam par rtog pa dang / yul gyi rnam par rtog pa dang / khyim gyi 'byor ba dang ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag la lan mang du rjes su rtog par byed / rjes @176a * //
translated: He frequently reflects on and investigates the conceptual thoughts of desire, the conceptual thoughts of relatives, the conceptual thoughts of places, and the conceptual thoughts of the wealth of his home.

original: su dpyod par byed de /
analyzed: su dpyod par byed de /
translated: He reflects and investigates in this way:

original: des na de'i ting nge 'dzin dang po nyid nas ma skyes pa ni skye bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na de'i ting nge 'dzin dang po nyid nas ma skyes pa ni skye bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: “Because of this, the first meditative absorption that has not yet arisen will not arise,

original: skyes pa ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes pa ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: and that which has arisen will be lost.”

original: de'i gnyen po mi sdug pa de yang mi sdug pa'i mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po mi sdug pa de yang mi sdug pa'i mtshan nyid gsum dang ldan par rig par bya ste /
translated: “The remedy for that is the meditation on foulness, which should be understood to have three characteristics:

original: mi gtsang ba'i mtshan nyid dang ; de dang rgyu mthun pa 'dzag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rten dang brten pa rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i mtshan nyid dang ; de dang rgyu mthun pa 'dzag pa'i mtshan nyid dang / rten dang brten pa rab tu dbye ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of impurity, the characteristic of the outflow that is similar to its cause, and the characteristic of the distinction between the support and the supported.

original: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas zin pa'i rgyus 'jig rten gyi chos dang phrad pa na /
analyzed: de la 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta bas zin pa'i rgyus 'jig rten gyi chos dang phrad pa na /
translated: “Among them, the view of the transitory collection is the cause for being seized by the view of the transitory collection. When one encounters worldly dharmas,

original: 'dud pa dang khengs pa dag gis gos par 'gyur bas de la btang snyoms su bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dud pa dang khengs pa dag gis gos par 'gyur bas de la btang snyoms su bya ba la /
translated: Since he is affected by both humility and pride, he should be indifferent to them.

original: de'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba mi mthun par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba mi mthun par gnas pa yin no //
translated: His view of the transitory collection is not in accord with reality.

original: gzhan yang de nyid 'jig rten gyi chos kyi rgyu mtshan sred pa dang / chags pa'i rgyun gyis bdas pa na /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid 'jig rten gyi chos kyi rgyu mtshan sred pa dang / chags pa'i rgyun gyis bdas pa na /
translated: Moreover, when he is carried away by the current of craving and attachment to the signs of worldly dharmas,

original: de la btang snyoms su bya ba la /
analyzed: de la btang snyoms su bya ba la /
translated: he should be indifferent to them.

original: de'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba mi mthun par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba mi mthun par gnas pa yin no //
translated: His view of the transitory collection is not in accord with reality.

original: gzhan yang de nyid 'jig rten gyi chos kyi rgyu mtshan las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa bzang po ma yin pa la /🔽rnam par rtog pas kun du gdung ba dang rnam par gdung bar 'gyur bas de la btang snyoms su bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid 'jig rten gyi chos kyi rgyu mtshan las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa bzang po ma yin pa la / rnam par rtog pas kun du gdung ba dang rnam par gdung bar 'gyur bas de la btang snyoms su bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, when he is afflicted by the bad thoughts that arise from the signs of worldly dharmas,🔽he should be indifferent to them.

original: de'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba mi mthun par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba mi mthun par gnas pa yin no //
translated: His view of the transitory collection is not in accord with reality.

original: gzhan yang de nyid 'jig rten gyi chos kyi rgyu mtshan yongs su tshol bar byed pa na rnam par g-yen spyo ba dang / yongs su g-yo ba sna tshogs kyis gnod par 'gyur bas de la btang snyoms su bya ba la /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid 'jig rten gyi chos kyi rgyu mtshan yongs su tshol bar byed pa na rnam par g-yen spyo ba dang / yongs su g-yo ba sna tshogs kyis gnod par 'gyur bas de la btang snyoms su bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, when he seeks the reasons for worldly dharmas, he is harmed by various kinds of agitation and vacillation, so he should be indifferent to that.

original: de'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba mi mthun par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba mi mthun par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus his view of the perishing aggregates is not in accord with reality.

original: gzhan yang de nyid 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu 'jig rten gyi chos kyi gnas mi rtag pa'i rgyu nye bar len par byed cing /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu 'jig rten gyi chos kyi gnas mi rtag pa'i rgyu nye bar len par byed cing /
translated: Moreover, he takes up the causes of the view of the perishing aggregates, the worldly dharmas, and is attached to them.

original: lhag par chags par byed de gzhi des mya ngan la sogs pas gnod par 'gyur bas de la btang snyoms su bya ba la /
analyzed: lhag par chags par byed de gzhi des mya ngan la sogs pas gnod par 'gyur bas de la btang snyoms su bya ba la /
translated: Since he is harmed by grief and so on on that basis, he should be indifferent to that.

original: de'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mi mthun par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i mi mthun par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus his view of the perishing aggregates is not in accord with reality.

original: gzhan yang de nyid sa 'og ma pa'i dri ma bsal ba'i phyir dge ba la brtson pa na sbyor ba de la mi dga' bas /
analyzed: gzhan yang de nyid sa 'og ma pa'i dri ma bsal ba'i phyir dge ba la brtson pa na sbyor ba de la mi dga' bas /
translated: Moreover, when he strives for virtue in order to eliminate the defilements of the lower stage, he is unhappy with that practice.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la btang snyoms su bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs la btang snyoms su bya ba la /
translated: The antidote to that is equanimity.

original: de'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba mi mthun par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'jig tshogs la lta ba mi mthun par gnas pa yin no //
translated: The view of the transitory collection is incompatible with that.

original: sa 'og ma pa'i dri ma bsal ba ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: sa 'og ma pa'i dri ma bsal ba ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as the stains of the lower stages are removed,

original: sa gong ma pa'i dri ma bsal ba yang @176b de bzhin te /🔽rgyu des na de 'khor ba la ni skyon du blta'o //
analyzed: sa gong ma pa'i dri ma bsal ba yang @176b de bzhin te / rgyu des na de 'khor ba la ni skyon du blta'o //
translated: so too are the stains of the higher stages.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa la ni yon tan du blta'o snyam du sems kyang de las bzlog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa la ni yon tan du blta'o snyam du sems kyang de las bzlog par 'gyur te /
translated: For that reason, although he thinks, “I will see faults in cyclic existence and qualities in nirvana,” the opposite occurs.

original: des na de'i ting nge 'dzin dang po thob kyang bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma skyes pa ni skye bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: des na de'i ting nge 'dzin dang po thob kyang bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma skyes pa ni skye bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, although he attains the first meditative concentration, the meditative concentration that realizes the truths does not arise if it has not already arisen.

original: skyes pa ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes pa ni yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: And if it has arisen, it degenerates.

original: de la mi bzod pa'i rang bzhin can mi bzod pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob kyang /
analyzed: de la mi bzod pa'i rang bzhin can mi bzod pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'thob kyang /
translated: In this regard, one who is impatient, who has an impatient attitude, attains the meditative concentration that realizes the truths.

original: sha sbrang dang sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa mi bzod pa'i phyir sbyor ba spong bar byed cing /
analyzed: sha sbrang dang sbrang bu mchu rings la sogs pa mi bzod pa'i phyir sbyor ba spong bar byed cing /
translated: One abandons the practice of meditation because of impatience with flies, mosquitoes, etc.

original: le lo yang byed de /🔽des na de'i dngos gzhir zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma skyes pa yang skye bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: le lo yang byed de / des na de'i dngos gzhir zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ma skyes pa yang skye bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: One also becomes lazy.

original: skyes pa yang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes pa yang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the concentration of the actual basis does not arise if it has not already arisen, and if it has arisen, it degenerates.

original: de la skyon gsum ni ting nge 'dzin dang po'i bar chad byed pa yin no //🔽gcig ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar chad byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la skyon gsum ni ting nge 'dzin dang po'i bar chad byed pa yin no // gcig ni bden pa mngon par rtogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar chad byed pa yin no //
translated: The three faults are obstacles to the first concentration.🔽One is an obstacle to the concentration of clear realization of the truths.

original: gcig ni dngos gzhir zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar chad byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig ni dngos gzhir zhugs pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi bar chad byed pa yin no //
translated: One is an obstacle to the concentration of the actual basis.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang brgyad po 'di dang ni slob ma spong ba'i rgyu mtshan yin te /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang brgyad po 'di dang ni slob ma spong ba'i rgyu mtshan yin te /
translated: Another enumeration: these eight are the reasons for abandoning disciples.

original: de dag la nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de dag la nyon mongs pa dang bcas pa kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Because of them, one becomes defiled by defilements and defiled in all ways.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur na slob ma spong bar byed do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can du gyur na slob ma spong bar byed do //
translated: If he becomes defiled, he abandons his disciples.

original: dgra bcom pa nyon mongs pa med pa rtag tu dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni mi byed do //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyon mongs pa med pa rtag tu dran pa nye bar gzhag pa ni mi byed do //
translated: The arhat who is free from defilements does not always practice the close placements of mindfulness.

original: brgyad gang zhe na rang bzhin gyis zhe 'gras pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / slob ma las bdag kho na'i rim gro 'ba' zhig 'dod pa dang / rim gro 'dod pa ji lta ba bzhin du slob ma las rnyed pa 'dod pa dang / slob ma ltung ba dang /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na rang bzhin gyis zhe 'gras pa'i sems dang ldan pa dang / slob ma las bdag kho na'i rim gro 'ba' zhig 'dod pa dang / rim gro 'dod pa ji lta ba bzhin du slob ma las rnyed pa 'dod pa dang / slob ma ltung ba dang /
translated: What are the eight? He has a mind that is naturally hostile, he desires only to be served by his disciples, he desires gain from his disciples just as he desires to be served, he desires clothing, etc.

original: tshul khrims ngan pa kun du spyod pa dang / slob ma rnams las phan pa byed pa dang gnod pa byed pa dgos pa dang / mi dgos pa dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi gdams ngag la gnod pa mi bzod pa dang / lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi gnas pa'i gdams ngag la gnod pa mi bzod pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims ngan pa kun du spyod pa dang / slob ma rnams las phan pa byed pa dang gnod pa byed pa dgos pa dang / mi dgos pa dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi gdams ngag la gnod pa mi bzod pa dang / lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi gnas pa'i gdams ngag la gnod pa mi bzod pa dang /
translated: from his disciples, he is not patient with the faults and transgressions of his disciples, he is not patient with the good and bad behavior of his disciples, he is not patient with the instructions in superior morality, he is not patient with the instructions in superior mind and wisdom.

original: tshogs yongs su bsdu ba la gnod pa mi bzod pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs yongs su bsdu ba la gnod pa mi bzod pa'o //
translated: He is unable to tolerate the loss of any of the factors that contribute to enlightenment.🔽The summary:🔽The factors are enumerated, with their opposites,🔽their extensive arrangement,

original: sdom ni / grangs dang mi mthun phyogs yan lag / de dag rgya cher rnam gzhag dang // dben dang sdug bsngal g-yo ba dang // gong ma'i @177a * //
analyzed: sdom ni / grangs dang mi mthun phyogs yan lag / de dag rgya cher rnam gzhag dang // dben dang sdug bsngal g-yo ba dang // gong ma'i @177a * //
translated: their isolation, their suffering, their movement,

original: yan lag khyad par yin //
analyzed: yan lag khyad par yin //
translated: and their superiority.

original: bsam gtan bzhi zhes gang gsungs pa la /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi zhes gang gsungs pa la /
translated: The four meditative states are mentioned.

original: ci'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi kho nar zad de /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi kho nar zad de /
translated: Why are there just four meditative states?

original: ches mang ba yang ma yin la ches nyung ba yang ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ches mang ba yang ma yin la ches nyung ba yang ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are there not more or fewer?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / bde ba dang sdug bsngal las shin tu 'das shing yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / bde ba dang sdug bsngal las shin tu 'das shing yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are the complete transcendence of pleasure and pain.

original: 'di ltar mthar gyis bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du bde ba dang / sdug bsngal las shin tu 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar mthar gyis bsam gtan bzhi pa'i bar du bde ba dang / sdug bsngal las shin tu 'das pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this way, up to the fourth meditative state, there is the complete transcendence of pleasure and pain.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the counteragent to the first meditative state?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / de ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / de ni rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as fivefold.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / 'dod pa'i gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / 'dod pa'i gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'chal pa'i tshul khrims dang / rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: the desire realm's desire, malice, violence, discursive thought, suffering, mental dissatisfaction, immorality, and distraction.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the counteragent to the second meditation?

original: smras pa / de yang rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / de yang rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be known as fivefold:

original: bsam gtan dang po'i 'dod chags dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / rgod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i 'dod chags dang / rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / rgod pa dang / ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: the desire for the first meditation, discursive thought, sustained thought, suffering, and agitation, and the incompleteness of concentration.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the counteragent to the third meditation?

original: smras pa / de ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / de ni rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be known as fourfold:

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i 'dod chags dang / yid bde ba dang / dga' ba dang / ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i 'dod chags dang / yid bde ba dang / dga' ba dang / ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: the desire for the second meditation, mental satisfaction, joy, and the incompleteness of concentration.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the counteragent to the fourth meditation?

original: smras pa / de yang rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: smras pa / de yang rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: He said, “It should be understood as fivefold:

original: dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs dbyung ba dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang / bde ba dang / bde ba la rtsol ba dang / ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs rngub pa dang / dbugs dbyung ba dang / bsam gtan gsum pa'i 'dod chags dang / bde ba dang / bde ba la rtsol ba dang / ting nge 'dzin ma rdzogs pa'o //
translated: inhalation, exhalation, attachment to the third concentration, pleasure, striving for pleasure, and incomplete concentration.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i yan lag du zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i yan lag du zhe na /
translated: How many members does the first concentration have?

original: smras pa / yan lag lnga ste /
analyzed: smras pa / yan lag lnga ste /
translated: He said, “It has five members.

original: yan lag lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five members?

original: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: rtog pa dang / dpyod pa dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Investigation, analysis, joy, pleasure, and a one-pointed mind.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i yan lag du zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i yan lag du zhe na /
translated: How many members does the second concentration have?

original: smras pa / yan lag bzhi ste yan lag bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / yan lag bzhi ste yan lag bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: He said, “It has four members. What are the four members?

original: nang yongs su dang ba dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: nang yongs su dang ba dang / dga' ba dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Inner clarity, joy, pleasure, and a one-pointed mind.

original: de la nang yongs su dang ba'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la nang yongs su dang ba'i chos kyi ngo bo nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of inner clarity?

original: smras pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / btang @177b snyoms kyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
analyzed: smras pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / btang @177b snyoms kyi ngo bo nyid yin no //
translated: It is the essence of mindfulness, introspection, equanimity, and pleasure.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa'i yan lag du zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa'i yan lag du zhe na /
translated: How many members does the third meditation have?

original: smras pa / yan lag lnga ste /
analyzed: smras pa / yan lag lnga ste /
translated: It has five members.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / btang snyoms dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / btang snyoms dang / bde ba dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Mindfulness, introspection, equanimity, pleasure, and one-pointedness of mind.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i yan lag du zhe na /
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa'i yan lag du zhe na /
translated: How many members does the fourth meditation have?

original: smras pa / yan lag bzhi ste /
analyzed: smras pa / yan lag bzhi ste /
translated: It has four members.

original: yan lag bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: btang snyoms yongs su dag pa dang / dran pa yongs su dag pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / sems rtse gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Pure equanimity, pure mindfulness, neither pleasure nor pain, and one-pointedness of mind.

original: de la bsam gtan dang po la ni dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / btang snyoms dag rtog pa dang ; dpyod pa'i sgo dag gis mngon par bsgrubs pas na /
analyzed: de la bsam gtan dang po la ni dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / btang snyoms dag rtog pa dang ; dpyod pa'i sgo dag gis mngon par bsgrubs pas na /
translated: In the first meditation, mindfulness, introspection, and equanimity are accomplished by the doors of investigation and analysis.

original: de'i phyir yod kyang ma smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yod kyang ma smos so //
translated: Therefore, they exist but are not mentioned.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la ni ngo bo nyid las byed pa dag yin yang /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la ni ngo bo nyid las byed pa dag yin yang /
translated: In the second absorption, they are by nature the same, but

original: sems dga' ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa yin pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: sems dga' ba'i nye ba'i nyon mongs pas kun nas dkris pa yin pas de'i phyir /
translated: since they are bound up with the affliction of mental joy,

original: nang yongs su dang ba'i ming gis bstan to ;
analyzed: nang yongs su dang ba'i ming gis bstan to ;
translated: they are taught by the name “inner clarity.”

original: / bsam gtan gsum pa la ni sems kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dang bral ba'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid de kho nas bstan te /
analyzed: / bsam gtan gsum pa la ni sems kyi nye ba'i nyon mongs pa de dang bral ba'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid de kho nas bstan te /
translated: In the third absorption, since it is free from that affliction of the mind, it is taught by its own characteristic alone.

original: de'i phyir dga' ba dang bral ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir dga' ba dang bral ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be free from joy and so on.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i gang dag yin pa de dag ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bas yin gyi /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i gang dag yin pa de dag ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bas yin gyi /
translated: Those of the first absorption are free from attachment to the desire realm,

original: dga' ba dang bral bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bral bas ni ma yin no //
translated: but they are not free from joy.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i gang dag yin pa de dag ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral bas yin gyi /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa'i gang dag yin pa de dag ni rtog pa dang dpyod pa dang bral bas yin gyi /
translated: Those of the second absorption are free from investigation and analysis,

original: dga' ba dang bral bas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dga' ba dang bral bas ni ma yin no //
translated: but they are not free from joy.

original: bsam gtan bzhi pa la ni de dag nyid shin tu yongs su dag par bstan to //
analyzed: bsam gtan bzhi pa la ni de dag nyid shin tu yongs su dag par bstan to //
translated: In the fourth absorption, they are taught to be completely pure.

original: de'i phyir bsam gtan thams cad la de dag gi tshul bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam gtan thams cad la de dag gi tshul bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, all the meditative concentrations should be understood in this way,

original: de yang ci rigs par ro //
analyzed: de yang ci rigs par ro //
translated: and in the appropriate manner.

original: ci'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi po de dag yan lag lnga pa dang / yan lag bzhi par rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsam gtan bzhi po de dag yan lag lnga pa dang / yan lag bzhi par rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are the four meditative concentrations established as having five members and four members?

original: smras pa / gnas pa'i rten dang / gnas pa la phan pa dang / gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / gnas pa'i rten dang / gnas pa la phan pa dang / gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said: because they are the basis of abiding, the benefit of abiding, and the nature of abiding.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang dmigs pa yid la byed pa dang / dmigs pa la yongs su dpyod pa dang / dmigs pa las mi 'phro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang dmigs pa yid la byed pa dang / dmigs pa la yongs su dpyod pa dang / dmigs pa las mi 'phro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Another enumeration: because of the mental attention to the object, the thorough analysis of the object, and the non-distraction from the object.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang phan 'dogs pa'i rten dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi rten dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi rten yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam grangs @178a * //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang phan 'dogs pa'i rten dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi rten dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi rten yin pa'i phyir ro // rnam grangs @178a * //
translated: Another enumeration: because they are the basis of benefit, the basis of superior mind, and the basis of superior wisdom.

original: gzhan yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen po'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen po'i phyir te /
translated: Another enumeration: because they are the antidote to the three types of afflicted abiding that are adverse.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas pa rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nye ba'i nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas pa rnam pa gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three types of unwholesome abodes?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i gnas pa dang / kun du rmongs pa'i gnas pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas pa dang / sdug bsngal ba'i gnas pa dang / kun du rmongs pa'i gnas pa'o //
translated: the unwholesome abode, the abode of suffering, and the abode of delusion.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang bsam gtan pa rnams kyi 'dod pa la longs spyod pa dang / chos mthun pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang bsam gtan pa rnams kyi 'dod pa la longs spyod pa dang / chos mthun pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, these three are to be regarded as being similar to the enjoyment of sensual pleasures by those who are devoted to meditation.

original: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi yang dag par bya ba ni gsum po 'di dag yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi yang dag par bya ba ni gsum po 'di dag yin te /
translated: For those who enjoy sensual pleasures, there are three things to be done.

original: de dag gis 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams rab tu phye ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams rab tu phye ba yin no //
translated: They are the things by which those who enjoy sensual pleasures are distinguished.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are:

original: longs spyod legs par yongs su tshol ba dang / yongs su btsal ba rnams la legs par longs spyod pa dang / de la dbang bsgyur ba la rang dbang yod pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod legs par yongs su tshol ba dang / yongs su btsal ba rnams la legs par longs spyod pa dang / de la dbang bsgyur ba la rang dbang yod pa'o //
translated: the proper search for sensual pleasures, the proper enjoyment of those that are sought, and the freedom to control them.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan pa rnams kyi yan lag kyang legs par bya ba gsum la brten nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /🔽de yang ci rigs par ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan pa rnams kyi yan lag kyang legs par bya ba gsum la brten nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste / de yang ci rigs par ro //
translated: Likewise, the limbs of the contemplatives are also established in dependence on the three good actions.🔽Moreover, they are established in dependence on the three good actions in whatever way is appropriate.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang bsam gtan pa rnams kyi yan lag ni dka' thub drag po'i gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang bsam gtan pa rnams kyi yan lag ni dka' thub drag po'i gnyen por rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Another explanation is that the limbs of the contemplatives are established as antidotes to the three kinds of severe asceticism.

original: de dag gi gnyen po yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There are three kinds of asceticism:

original: gnyen po med pa'i gnyen po dang / lus dang sems la gnod pa'i gnyen po dang / sems phyi rol du 'phro ba nye bar ma zhi ba'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: gnyen po med pa'i gnyen po dang / lus dang sems la gnod pa'i gnyen po dang / sems phyi rol du 'phro ba nye bar ma zhi ba'i gnyen po'o //
translated: asceticism that is not an antidote, asceticism that harms the body and mind, and asceticism that is the distraction of the mind that is not pacified.

original: ci'i phyir bsam gtan dang po la 'dod pa rnams las dben pa zhes gsungs nas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsam gtan dang po la 'dod pa rnams las dben pa zhes gsungs nas /
translated: Why is it said that the first meditation is secluded from the desire realm,

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa zhes gsungs she na /
translated: but it is said that the second meditation is secluded from evil and nonvirtuous things?

original: smras pa / 'dod pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su bstan pa'i phyir dang / nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / 'dod pa rnams kyi rang gi mtshan nyid yongs su bstan pa'i phyir dang / nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He replied: In order to teach the intrinsic identity of the sensual pleasures and in order to teach their identity as misfortune.

original: de la nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la nyes dmigs kyi mtshan nyid ni 'di yin te /
translated: Herein, this is their identity as misfortune:

original: 'dod pa rnams ni nyes par spyod pa kun nas bslang nas 'og tu ltung bar byed pa'i phyir sdig pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa rnams ni nyes par spyod pa kun nas bslang nas 'og tu ltung bar byed pa'i phyir sdig pa yin no //
translated: Sensual pleasures are evil because they cause one to fall into evil destinies, having been aroused by evil conduct.

original: dge ba skye ba dang mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir mi dge ba de yin no //
analyzed: dge ba skye ba dang mi mthun pa yin pa'i phyir mi dge ba de yin no //
translated: They are non-virtuous because they are not conducive to the arising of virtue.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir dang / sngon bsags pa'i las kyi kun nas @178b nyon mongs pa spangs pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang nyon mongs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir dang / sngon bsags pa'i las kyi kun nas @178b nyon mongs pa spangs pa yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Another explanation is that they are non-virtuous because they are the cause of the afflictions and because they are the cause of the karma that afflicts.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang khyim na gnas pa rnams kyi dngos po la yongs su spyod pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa spang ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir dang / rab tu byung ba rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas de spang ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //🔽rnam grangs gzhan yang 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir dang / gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang khyim na gnas pa rnams kyi dngos po la yongs su spyod pa'i sgo nas 'dod pa spang ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir dang / rab tu byung ba rnams kyi rnam par rtog pa'i sgo nas de spang ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro // rnam grangs gzhan yang 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir dang / gnod sems dang rnam par 'tshe ba'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Another explanation is that the first is taught for householders to abandon desire by means of fully enjoying objects and the second is taught for renunciates to abandon desire by means of concepts.🔽Another explanation is that the first is taught for the abandonment of desire-realm concepts and the second is taught for the abandonment of anger and violence-realm concepts.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang phyi rol pa'i drang srong rnams kyi 'thob pa'i rtags yongs su bstan pa'i phyir dang ; yongs su nyams pa rnams kyi dmod pa 'dor ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang phyi rol pa'i drang srong rnams kyi 'thob pa'i rtags yongs su bstan pa'i phyir dang ; yongs su nyams pa rnams kyi dmod pa 'dor ba yongs su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Another explanation is that the first is taught for the signs of attainment of non-Buddhist sages and the second is taught for the curses of those who regress.

original: ci'i phyir bsam gtan dang po la sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ma spangs she na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsam gtan dang po la sdug bsngal gyi dbang po ma spangs she na /
translated: Why is the faculty of pain not abandoned in the first absorption?

original: smras pa / de la de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len dang ma bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: smras pa / de la de'i phyogs dang mthun pa'i gnas ngan len dang ma bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: He said: Because he is not free from the negative reflex action that is in conformity with that.

original: gal te de la sdug bsngal gyi dbang po spangs par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de la sdug bsngal gyi dbang po spangs par gyur na /
translated: If he had abandoned the faculty of suffering,

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gnas pa'i khyad par dmigs par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir ma spangs pa kho nar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa dang / gnas pa'i khyad par dmigs par mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir ma spangs pa kho nar rig par bya'o //
translated: he would not have taken on the special state of the second concentration. Therefore, it should be understood that he did not abandon it.

original: gang gi tshe bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa la rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la phan 'dogs pa dag / bsam gtan rnams kyi rang gi sa la phan 'dogs pa dang / yongs su dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa la rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la phan 'dogs pa dag / bsam gtan rnams kyi rang gi sa la phan 'dogs pa dang / yongs su dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'jug pa yin no //
translated: When the concentrations, such as the first concentration, are assisted by the meditative development of the meditative concentration of investigation and analysis, etc., they are engaged in the concentrations in order to assist their own level and to purify it.

original: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis g-yo ba'i ming du bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis g-yo ba'i ming du bstan zhe na /
translated: Why did the Lord teach the name of the moving one?

original: smras pa / gzhan gyi sa la ltos te bstan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: smras pa / gzhan gyi sa la ltos te bstan pa yin gyi /
translated: He said: It is taught in relation to another level,

original: rang gi sa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi sa las ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in relation to its own level.

original: ci'i phyir bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa la 'dod pa'i khams kyi bar nas bzung ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa la 'dod pa'i khams kyi bar nas bzung ste /
translated: Why are the branches of the first absorption, etc. established in the desire realm,

original: gong nas gong du yan lag dag rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: gong nas gong du yan lag dag rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: and so on, in ascending order?

original: smras pa / mdor bsdu na rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis te /
analyzed: smras pa / mdor bsdu na rgyu rnam pa gsum gyis te /
translated: It is said: In brief, there are three types of causes.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po dang / rtogs pa'i phan yon dang / rtogs pas so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po dang / rtogs pa'i phan yon dang / rtogs pas so //
translated: The antidotes to opposing factors, the benefits of realization, and realization itself.

original: rgyu gsum po de dag ni bsam gtan bzhi po dag la yan lag lnga yongs su gzung ba dag la yang ci rigs par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu gsum po de dag ni bsam gtan bzhi po dag la yan lag lnga yongs su gzung ba dag la yang ci rigs par bya'o //
translated: Those three causes should be applied as appropriate to the five branches that are included in the four absorptions.

original: bsam gtan dar po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: bsam gtan dar po dang / bsam gtan gnyis pa la khyad par ci yod ce na /

analyzed: smras pa / ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs pa'i khyad par yod do // bsam gtan gnyis pa dang @179a * //

original: bsam gtan gsum pa la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the second and third absorptions?

original: smras pa / phan 'dogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i khyad par yod do //
analyzed: smras pa / phan 'dogs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i khyad par yod do //
translated: It is said: There is a difference in the perfection of benefit.

original: bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la khyad par ci yod ce na /
analyzed: bsam gtan gsum pa dang / bsam gtan bzhi pa la khyad par ci yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between the third and fourth absorptions?

original: smras pa / ting nge 'dzin yongs su dag pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i khyad par yod do /🔽// / bam po nyi shu pa /
analyzed: smras pa / ting nge 'dzin yongs su dag pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i khyad par yod do / // / bam po nyi shu pa /
translated: It is said: There is the difference that the purity of meditative concentration is fully completed.

original: ting nge 'dzin sgom pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin sgom pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: There are four kinds of cultivation of meditative concentration:

original: tshe 'di la bde bar gnas pa thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / ye shes dang mthong ba thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / shes rab kyi rab tu dbye ba thob par bya ba'i phyir dang / zag pa zad pa thob par bya ba'i phyir ro //

translated: for the sake of attaining a pleasant abiding in this life, for the sake of attaining knowledge and insight, for the sake of attaining the classification of wisdom, and for the sake of attaining the extinction of the contaminants.

original: gang zag rnam pa bzhi las brtsams nas ting nge 'dzin sgom pa bzhi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag rnam pa bzhi las brtsams nas ting nge 'dzin sgom pa bzhi rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The four kinds of cultivation of meditative concentration should be understood as being formulated on the basis of four kinds of persons.

original: gang zag bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zag bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of persons?

translated: The path of seeing is the attainment of the clear realizer of the truths.🔽The path of meditation is the attainment of the clear realizer of the truths.🔽The path of no more learning is the attainment of the clear realizer of the truths.🔽The path of seeing is the attainment of the clear realizer of the truths.🔽The path of meditation is the attainment of the clear realizer of the truths.🔽The path of no more learning is the attainment of the clear realizer of the truths.🔽The path of seeing is the attainment of the clear realizer of the truths.🔽The path of meditation is the attainment of the clear realizer of the truths.🔽The path of no more learning is the attainment of the clear realizer of the truths.🔽The path of seeing is the attainment of the clear realizer of the truths.
