original: bden pa mthong ba mngon par shes pa bul la sla ba'i lam la gnas pa ni dbang po rtul bas yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yin te /
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba mngon par shes pa bul la sla ba'i lam la gnas pa ni dbang po rtul bas yongs su nyams pa'i chos can yin te /
translated: The path of meditation is the attainment of the clear realizer of the truths.🔽The

original: des ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / rnam par rtog pa dag la dran pa nye bar gzhag par bya zhing shes bzhin du yang bya'o //
analyzed: des ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / rnam par rtog pa dag la dran pa nye bar gzhag par bya zhing shes bzhin du yang bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should establish mindfulness and be aware of the feelings, perceptions and saṃskāras in the world of desire.

original: bsam gtan rnams ni 'dod chags dang bral bas rab tu phye ba yin te /🔽de la 'dod chags dang bral ba ni rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnams ni 'dod chags dang bral bas rab tu phye ba yin te / de la 'dod chags dang bral ba ni rnam pa drug tu rig par bya ste /
translated: The dhyānas are distinguished by freedom from passion.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Therein, freedom from passion should be understood as sixfold:

original: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / gnod pas 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / ston pas 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / yang dag phul gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / kun du rmongs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / gnod pas 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / ston pas 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / yang dag phul gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / kun du rmongs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
translated: freedom from passion by nature, freedom from passion by harm, freedom from passion by teaching, freedom from passion by the highest, freedom from passion by delusion,

original: gnyen pos 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gnyen pos 'dod chags dang bral ba'o //
translated: and freedom from passion by counteraction.

original: @179b de la rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: @179b de la rang bzhin gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Freedom from passion by nature is as follows.

original: dngos po rang bzhin gyis mi gtsang ba yongs su longs spyod pa'i 'os ma yin pa dag la mi mthun pa nyid gang yin pa dang / de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dag la mi mthun pa nyid gang yin pa dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa la rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po rang bzhin gyis mi gtsang ba yongs su longs spyod pa'i 'os ma yin pa dag la mi mthun pa nyid gang yin pa dang / de bzhin du sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dag la mi mthun pa nyid gang yin pa dang / de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po las 'dod chags dang bral ba'i bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa la rtog pa dang dpyod pa la sogs pa mi mthun pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: and the unpleasantness of the second concentration, etc., which are free from the first concentration, etc., and so on.

original: de la gnod pas 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la gnod pas 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among these, freedom from harm is as follows:🔽The unpleasantness of freedom from the torment of the sexual act, which is the union of two with two.

original: gnyis kyis gnyis sprod pas 'khrig pa'i chos bstan pa'i yongs su gdung ba dang bral ba la mi mthun pa nyid gang yin pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa gzhan yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyis gnyis sprod pas 'khrig pa'i chos bstan pa'i yongs su gdung ba dang bral ba la mi mthun pa nyid gang yin pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa gzhan yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Other such things should be understood in the same way.

original: de la ston pas 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la ston pas 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among these, freedom from the teacher is as follows:

original: legs par zos pa dang / legs par 'thungs pa dang legs par tshim pa'i bza' ba dang / btung ba la mi mthun pa nyid gang yin pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa gzhan yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: legs par zos pa dang / legs par 'thungs pa dang legs par tshim pa'i bza' ba dang / btung ba la mi mthun pa nyid gang yin pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa gzhan yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is the dissimilarity of a good meal, a good drink, and a good satisfaction of hunger and thirst, and it is the dissimilarity of other things of that kind.

original: de la yang dag phul gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la yang dag phul gyis 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, the dissimilarity of the highest is as follows:

original: longs spyod dang phun sum tshogs pa ches gya nom pa dang / ches mchog tu gyur pa thob pa'i dman pa la mi mthun pa nyid gang yin pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa gzhan yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: longs spyod dang phun sum tshogs pa ches gya nom pa dang / ches mchog tu gyur pa thob pa'i dman pa la mi mthun pa nyid gang yin pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa gzhan yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is the dissimilarity of the inferior in relation to the attainment of the most excellent and sublime enjoyments and perfections, and it is the dissimilarity of other things of that kind.

original: de la kun du rmongs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la kun du rmongs pas 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, the dissimilarity of the confused is as follows:

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i phan yon mi shes pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la mi mthun pa nyid gang yin pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa gzhan yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i phan yon mi shes pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa la mi mthun pa nyid gang yin pa dang / de lta bu dang mthun pa gzhan yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: It is the dissimilarity of nirvāṇa for one who does not know the benefits of nirvāṇa, and it is the dissimilarity of other things of that kind.

original: de la gnyen pos 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'di lta ste /🔽sun 'byin pa gnyen po'am /🔽spong ba gnyen po'am /
analyzed: de la gnyen pos 'dod chags dang bral ba ni 'di lta ste / sun 'byin pa gnyen po'am / spong ba gnyen po'am /
translated: The detachment from desire through the counteragent is as follows:🔽the counteragent of rejection,🔽the counteragent of abandonment,

original: kun du 'dzin pa gnyen po'am /
analyzed: kun du 'dzin pa gnyen po'am /
translated: the counteragent of retention,

original: thag sring ba gnyen po las brten te /
analyzed: thag sring ba gnyen po las brten te /
translated: and the counteragent of distancing.

original: 'jig rten pa'am 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa spong ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'am 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam gyis nyon mongs pa spong ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of the defilements by means of the mundane or supramundane path.

original: ci'i phyir bsam gtan la gnas pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsam gtan la gnas pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called the basis of meditation?

original: smras pa / nang gi dmigs pa la sems nye bar gtad pa ni phyi rol du rnam par mi g-yeng ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / nang gi dmigs pa la sems nye bar gtad pa ni phyi rol du rnam par mi g-yeng ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is because the mind is fixed on the internal object and does not become distracted externally.

original: ci'i phyir bsam gtan la ting nge 'dzin zhes bya zhe na /🔽smras pa / shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa la sems @180a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsam gtan la ting nge 'dzin zhes bya zhe na / smras pa / shes bya'i dngos po dang cha mthun pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi dmigs pa la sems @180a * //
translated: Why is meditation called concentration?

original: ting nge 'dzin du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin du gnas pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is because the mind is fixed on the object of meditation, which is a mental image that is in conformity with the thing to be known.

original: ci'i phyir / bsam gtan la zhi gnas zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir / bsam gtan la zhi gnas zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is meditation called calm abiding?

original: smras pa / nyon mongs pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir gnas par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: smras pa / nyon mongs pa zhi bar bya ba'i phyir gnas par byed pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: He replied, “Because it is the basis for the pacification of the afflictions.”

original: ci'i phyir bsam gtan la rtse gcig pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bsam gtan la rtse gcig pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is it called “one-pointed concentration”?

original: smras pa / 'di ni gnyis yin te mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i dmigs pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa / 'di ni gnyis yin te mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i dmigs pa dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i dmigs pa'o //
translated: He replied, “It is twofold: the object of the stage of non-concentration and the object of the stage of concentration.

original: de la mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa gcig pa yin no //
analyzed: de la mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa gcig pa yin no //
translated: Among them, the object of the stage of non-concentration is one-pointed.

original: cig shos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: cig shos ni ma yin te /
translated: The other is not.

original: de'i phyir de la nye bar gtad pa'i sems ni rtse gcig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la nye bar gtad pa'i sems ni rtse gcig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the mind that is directed towards it is called “one-pointed.”

original: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yongs su nyams pa ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i yongs su nyams pa ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
translated: Among them, the degeneration of detachment should be known as tenfold.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: What are the ten?

original: lus ma snyoms pas kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: lus ma snyoms pas kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Degeneration through physical imbalance.

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la gnod pa drag pos reg pa las te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la gnod pa drag pos reg pa las te /
translated: For example, when someone is afflicted by a severe illness.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na shing shun gyis bdag gi ting nge 'dzin de ma mthong nas bdag 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: dper na shing shun gyis bdag gi ting nge 'dzin de ma mthong nas bdag 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: For example, it is like the story that a certain monk, who was not a master of concentration, did not see the concentration of a certain master of concentration.

original: bdag ting nge 'dzin de las yongs su nyams pa'am gcig tu ma gyur grang snyam mo zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: bdag ting nge 'dzin de las yongs su nyams pa'am gcig tu ma gyur grang snyam mo zhes smras pa lta bu'o //
translated: He said, “I think that I have fallen from that concentration or that it has become one thing.”

original: la la ni sngon ting nge 'dzin goms par ma byas pas rang bzhin gyis gnas len mang ba yin te /
analyzed: la la ni sngon ting nge 'dzin goms par ma byas pas rang bzhin gyis gnas len mang ba yin te /
translated: Some, because they have not cultivated concentration in the past, have a nature that is very distracted.

original: de gnas len mang po des yongs su nyams pa'i chos can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de gnas len mang po des yongs su nyams pa'i chos can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that great distraction, they are subject to falling away.

original: yul gtso bos kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: yul gtso bos kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: There is falling away due to the preeminence of objects.

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la yul rgya chen po mngon du gyur ba thob pa las te /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la yul rgya chen po mngon du gyur ba thob pa las te /
translated: For example, someone who has attained a vast object falls away from it.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na phyi rol pa'i drang srong 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar thob pa bud med gzhon nu mdog bzang po chags par 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten nas yongs su nyams par gyur ces grags pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na phyi rol pa'i drang srong 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi bar thob pa bud med gzhon nu mdog bzang po chags par 'gyur ba'i reg pa la brten nas yongs su nyams par gyur ces grags pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is well known that non-Buddhist sages who have attained the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception fall away when they come into contact with a beautiful young woman and become attached.

original: bkur stis kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni 'di ltar 'di na la la gzhan las rnyed pa dang bkur sti thob pa na yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: bkur stis kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni 'di ltar 'di na la la gzhan las rnyed pa dang bkur sti thob pa na yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: One falls away through honor and respect, as when someone falls away from meditative concentration when they obtain wealth and honor from others.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na lha sbyin lta bu'o //🔽brnyas pas kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni 'di ltar 'di na la la khros sam 'khrugs sam /
analyzed: dper na lha sbyin lta bu'o // brnyas pas kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni 'di ltar 'di na la la khros sam 'khrugs sam /
translated: it is like Devadatta.

original: brgyad bkag pa na yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: brgyad bkag pa na yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: One falls away through contempt, as when someone falls away from meditative concentration when they are angry, upset, or insulted.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na phyi rol pa'i drang srong dag 'khrug pa na yongs su nyams nas dmod pa 'dor bar yang byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na phyi rol pa'i drang srong dag 'khrug pa na yongs su nyams nas dmod pa 'dor bar yang byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: it is like the non-Buddhist sages who fall away from meditative concentration when they are angry and then curse.

original: nga rgyal gyis kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: One falls away through pride,

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la snyoms par 'jug @180b pa des bdag la stod par byed gzhan dag la smod par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la snyoms par 'jug @180b pa des bdag la stod par byed gzhan dag la smod par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: as when someone exalts himself and disparages others while in meditative concentration.🔽One falls away through over-estimation,

original: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni 'di ltar 'di na la la snyoms par 'jug pa de la rtog pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: mngon pa'i nga rgyal gyis kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni 'di ltar 'di na la la snyoms par 'jug pa de la rtog pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang ldan pa lta bu'o //
translated: as when someone is over-estimated by others because of that meditative concentration.

original: yid la mi byed pas kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: yid la mi byed pas kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: One falls away through lack of attention,

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la yid la byed pa'i rnam pa dang rtags gang dag gis snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ba de dag yid la mi byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la yid la byed pa'i rnam pa dang rtags gang dag gis snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ba de dag yid la mi byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: as when someone does not attend to the aspects and signs by which he has entered meditative concentration.🔽One falls away through lack of cultivation,

original: ma 'dris pas kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni 'di ltar 'di na la la las dang po pa yin zhing dge ba'i phyogs gsar pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ma 'dris pas kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni 'di ltar 'di na la la las dang po pa yin zhing dge ba'i phyogs gsar pa lta bu'o //
translated: as when someone is a beginner and has not yet attained the stage of comfort in the virtuous side.

original: rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs pa mang du byed pas kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: rang gi sa pa'i nyon mongs pa mang du byed pas kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: One also regresses through frequently generating the afflictions of one's level.

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la sred pa shas che ba'i bsam gtan pa'am /
translated: For example, some cultivate concentration with craving or

original: the tshom shas che ba'i bar gyis bsam gtan pa yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: the tshom shas che ba'i bar gyis bsam gtan pa yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: up to some cultivate concentration with doubt.

original: tshe dang bsod nams dang las zad pas kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur pa ni /
analyzed: tshe dang bsod nams dang las zad pas kyang yongs su nyams par 'gyur pa ni /
translated: One also regresses through the exhaustion of life, merit and karma.

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la skye ba'i gnas de nas 'og tu 'chi 'pho ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la skye ba'i gnas de nas 'og tu 'chi 'pho ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, some die and transmigrate from that birthplace to a lower level.

original: de la gang zag nyon mongs pa chung ba dang / dge ba'i phyogs chung ba ni skad cig mang pos dka' bas yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: de la gang zag nyon mongs pa chung ba dang / dge ba'i phyogs chung ba ni skad cig mang pos dka' bas yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhing /
translated: Among those, a person with small afflictions and small virtue regresses with difficulty through many moments and

original: skad cig mang pos dka' bas snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig mang pos dka' bas snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: enters meditative attainment with difficulty through many moments.

original: nyon mongs pa chung la dge ba'i phyogs che ba ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa chung la dge ba'i phyogs che ba ni /
translated: A person with small afflictions and great virtue

original: skad cig mang pos dka' bas yongs su nyams par 'gyur la /
analyzed: skad cig mang pos dka' bas yongs su nyams par 'gyur la /
translated: regresses with difficulty through many moments and🔽enters meditative attainment with ease through many moments.🔽A person with great afflictions and small virtue🔽regresses with ease through many moments and🔽enters meditative attainment with difficulty through many moments.

original: skad cig gcig kho nas myur du snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig gcig kho nas myur du snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: He enters quickly, in only one moment.

original: gang zag nyon mongs pa che la dge ba'i phyogs chung ba ni /
analyzed: gang zag nyon mongs pa che la dge ba'i phyogs chung ba ni /
translated: The person whose afflictions are great and whose wholesome side is small

original: skad cig gcig kho nas myur du yongs su nyams par 'gyur la /
analyzed: skad cig gcig kho nas myur du yongs su nyams par 'gyur la /
translated: quickly deteriorates completely in only one moment,

original: skad cig mang pos dka' bas snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig mang pos dka' bas snyoms par 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: and enters meditative attainment with difficulty, in many moments.

original: gang zag nyon mongs pa che ba dang dge ba'i phyogs kyang che ba ni /
analyzed: gang zag nyon mongs pa che ba dang dge ba'i phyogs kyang che ba ni /
translated: The person whose afflictions are great and whose wholesome side is also great

original: skad cig gcig gis myur du yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: skad cig gcig gis myur du yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhing /
translated: quickly deteriorates completely in one moment,

original: skad cig gcig gis myur du snyoms par 'jug par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skad cig gcig gis myur du snyoms par 'jug par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: and quickly enters meditative attainment in one moment.

original: de la gang zag 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin de las langs pa ni lan 'ga' ting nge 'dzin spel ma 'dres pa yid la byed pa la gnas so //
analyzed: de la gang zag 'dod chags dang bral ba thob pa'i ting nge 'dzin de las langs pa ni lan 'ga' ting nge 'dzin spel ma 'dres pa yid la byed pa la gnas so //
translated: The person who has attained freedom from attachment and has arisen from that concentration sometimes abides in the attention that increases the unmixed concentration.

original: lan 'ga' la ni ma 'dres pa la'o //
analyzed: lan 'ga' la ni ma 'dres pa la'o //
translated: Sometimes he abides in the unmixed.

original: ting nge 'dzin de las sgra'i rkyen gyis ldang ba la ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin de las sgra'i rkyen gyis ldang ba la ni /
translated: When he arises from that concentration due to the condition of sound,

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang @181a * //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang @181a * //
translated: It is the non-equipoised mental consciousness.🔽

original: lhan cig byung ba'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa gzhan kho na skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lhan cig byung ba'i rna ba'i rnam par shes pa gzhan kho na skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: and the other auditory consciousnesses that arise simultaneously with the nonconcentrated mental consciousness.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de nyid sgra 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa de nyid sgra 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that concentrated mental consciousness does not apprehend sound.

original: gzhan du na de so sor ma rig par ldang ba nyid mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan du na de so sor ma rig par ldang ba nyid mi rigs te /
translated: Otherwise, it would be illogical for it to arise from non-discernment.

original: de'i phyir sgra 'dzin pa tsam gyis ldang ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra 'dzin pa tsam gyis ldang ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it does not arise merely by apprehending sound.

original: sgra so sor rig nas 'dod na /
analyzed: sgra so sor rig nas 'dod na /
translated: If it desires to discern sound,

original: de'i 'og tu ldang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ldang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it arises after that.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa rdzogs te /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa rdzogs te /
translated: The ascertainment of the stage of concentration is complete.

original: rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo /
analyzed: rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo /
translated: The remainder of the treatise on ascertainment does not appear.

original: // / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni /
analyzed: // / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni /
translated: The ascertainment of the stage of non-concentration is as follows:

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also that which is naturally non-concentrated,

original: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga lta bu'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i tshogs lnga lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the five aggregates of consciousness.

original: shin tu sbyangs pa med pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
analyzed: shin tu sbyangs pa med pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a non-equipoise that is not serenity,

original: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa na spyod pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos rnams so //
translated: such as the mind and mental factors of the desire realm.

original: ma btsas pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
analyzed: ma btsas pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a non-equipoise that is not meditative concentration,

original: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la longs spyod pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: such as the mind of one enjoying the sense objects in the desire realm.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a non-equipoise that is distraction,

original: las dang po ba ting nge 'dzin la brtson pa rnams kyi sems 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: las dang po ba ting nge 'dzin la brtson pa rnams kyi sems 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: such as the mind of a beginner who is striving in concentration, distracted by the five sense objects.

original: bsdus pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a non-equipoise that is a gathering,

original: las dang po pa rnams nyid kyi sems nang du bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: las dang po pa rnams nyid kyi sems nang du bsdus pa'o //
translated: such as the mind of a beginner that is gathered inward.

original: ma thob pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
analyzed: ma thob pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a non-equipoise that is not attained,

original: de dag nyid kyi sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi sems rnam par g-yeng ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: such as the mind of those who are distracted.

original: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
analyzed: yongs su ma rdzogs pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a non-equipoise that is incomplete,

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa ma thob pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i yid la byed pa ma thob pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: of those who have not attained the mental attention that is the culmination of practice.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a non-equipoise that is afflicted,

original: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu thob pa ro myong bar byed pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu thob pa ro myong bar byed pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: of those who have attained the result of the culmination of practice but who experience it.

original: dbang med pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
analyzed: dbang med pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a non-equipoise that is powerless,

original: de dag nyid ni sems nyon mongs pa can gyis dbang ma thob pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid ni sems nyon mongs pa can gyis dbang ma thob pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: of those who have not attained the power of mind due to afflicted states.

original: rnam par ma dag pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
analyzed: rnam par ma dag pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a non-equipoise that is impure,

original: bag la nyal yang dag par ma bcom pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: bag la nyal yang dag par ma bcom pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: of those who have not completely destroyed latent states.

original: langs pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
analyzed: langs pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa yang yod de /
translated: There is also a non-equipoise that is arisen,

original: ting nge 'dzin thob pa las ma nyams pa langs pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob pa las ma nyams pa langs pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: of those who have attained concentration but have arisen from it without losing it.

original: yongs su nyams pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa @181b yang yod de /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa'i phyir mnyam par ma bzhag pa @181b yang yod de /
translated: There is also a non-equipoise that is regressed,🔽of those who have regressed from the result.

original: yongs su nyams pa rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba 'di la /
analyzed: yongs su nyams pa rnams kyi'o zhes bya ba 'di la /
translated: The first is for those who have regressed.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa dang po la brten nas ni sems gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'di lta ste /🔽rnam par bsdos pa'am /🔽rnam par rnags pa'am /
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa dang po la brten nas ni sems gnas par bya ba'i phyir 'di lta ste / rnam par bsdos pa'am / rnam par rnags pa'am /
translated: In dependence on the first stage of meditative equipoise, one should apprehend the signs, as before, in order to stabilize the mind.🔽That is, one should apprehend the signs of a bloated corpse, a worm-infested corpse,🔽a discolored corpse,

original: rgyas par snga ma bzhin du mtshan ma gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas par snga ma bzhin du mtshan ma gzung bar bya'o //
translated: a cut-up corpse, a fissured corpse, a gnawed corpse, a blood-besmeared corpse, a corpse-strewn cemetery, or a totally burned corpse.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa gnyis pa la brten nas ni yid la byed pa thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa gnyis pa la brten nas ni yid la byed pa thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson par bya'o //
translated: In dependence on the second stage of nonequipoise, one should strive to attain mental attention.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa gsum pa la brten nas ni dngos gzhi thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa gsum pa la brten nas ni dngos gzhi thob par bya ba'i phyir brtson par bya'o //
translated: In dependence on the third stage of nonequipoise, one should strive to attain the actual meditative concentration.

original: bzhi pa la gnas pa ni dang po nyid nas rnam par mi g-yeng par bya ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag par bya'o ;🔽/ sems rnam par g-yengs par gyur na yang /
analyzed: bzhi pa la gnas pa ni dang po nyid nas rnam par mi g-yeng par bya ba'i phyir dran pa nye bar gzhag par bya'o ; / sems rnam par g-yengs par gyur na yang /
translated: One who is established in the fourth stage should practice the applications of mindfulness in order to avoid distraction from the very beginning.

original: shes bzhin gyis myur ba myur ba kho nar phyir bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: shes bzhin gyis myur ba myur ba kho nar phyir bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: Even if the mind becomes distracted, one should quickly withdraw it by means of introspection.

original: lnga pa la gnas pas ni rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma yid la bya zhing zhum pa'i mtshan ma rtogs par bya ba la mkhas par yang bya'o //
analyzed: lnga pa la gnas pas ni rab tu dang bar 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma yid la bya zhing zhum pa'i mtshan ma rtogs par bya ba la mkhas par yang bya'o //
translated: One who is in the fifth stage should attend to the signs of faith and should be skilled in the realization of the signs of depression.

original: drug pa la gnas pa ni gdams ngag ma brjed par shas cher bsrung ba dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag par bya zhing /
analyzed: drug pa la gnas pa ni gdams ngag ma brjed par shas cher bsrung ba dang / dran pa nye bar gzhag par bya zhing /
translated: One who is in the sixth stage should protect the instructions from being forgotten, should be mindful,

original: tshul bzhin la brtson pa dang / rtag tu byed pa dang gus par byed pa la brtson par yang bya'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin la brtson pa dang / rtag tu byed pa dang gus par byed pa la brtson par yang bya'o //
translated: and should be devoted to proper effort, to constant practice, and to respectful practice.

original: bdun pa la gnas pas ni ting nge 'dzin chung ngu dang ngan ngon tsam thob pas chog mi shes par bya'o //
analyzed: bdun pa la gnas pas ni ting nge 'dzin chung ngu dang ngan ngon tsam thob pas chog mi shes par bya'o //
translated: One who is in the seventh stage should not be satisfied with the attainment of a small or inferior concentration.

original: brgyad pa la gnas pas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa la nyes dmigs su blta bar bya zhing /
analyzed: brgyad pa la gnas pas ni kun nas nyon mongs pa la nyes dmigs su blta bar bya zhing /
translated: One who is in the eighth stage should view the addictions as harmful

original: ro myang ba la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa skyes pa yang dang du mi blang bar yang bya'o //
analyzed: ro myang ba la sogs pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa skyes pa yang dang du mi blang bar yang bya'o //
translated: and should not acquiesce in the addictions that arise, such as relishing.

original: dgu pa la gnas pas ni ting nge 'dzin la rtag tu sbyar bar bya zhing mtshan ma rtogs pa la mkhas par yang bya'o //
analyzed: dgu pa la gnas pas ni ting nge 'dzin la rtag tu sbyar bar bya zhing mtshan ma rtogs pa la mkhas par yang bya'o //
translated: One who is in the ninth stage should always apply himself to concentration and become skilled in the realization of the signs.

original: bcu pa la gnas pas ni bden pa la mkhas pa la rtag tu shas cher brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: bcu pa la gnas pas ni bden pa la mkhas pa la rtag tu shas cher brtson par bya'o //
translated: One who is in the tenth stage should always strive to become skilled in the truths.

original: bcu gcig pa la gnas pas ni yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir bag yod par bya'o //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa la gnas pas ni yongs su mi nyams par bya ba'i phyir bag yod par bya'o //
translated: One who is in the eleventh stage should be heedful in order to avoid falling back.

original: bcu gnyis pa la gnas pas ni rab tu dben pa la brten par bya zhing /
analyzed: bcu gnyis pa la gnas pas ni rab tu dben pa la brten par bya zhing /
translated: One who is in the twelfth stage should rely on solitude,

original: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa yang rtag tu byed pa dang ; gus par byed pa'i sbyor bas rim gyis bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul bzhin yid la byed pa yang rtag tu byed pa dang ; gus par byed pa'i sbyor bas rim gyis bsgom par bya'o //
translated: and should always practice proper attention and respect, and should cultivate the stages in order.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa rdzogs te /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa'i rnam par gtan la dbab pa rdzogs te /
translated: The ascertainment of the stage of non-concentration is complete.

original: rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo /
analyzed: rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung lhag ma ni mi snang ngo /
translated: The remainder of the treatise on ascertainment is not evident.

original: // / sems yod pa'i sa las brtsams nas rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni /
analyzed: // / sems yod pa'i sa las brtsams nas rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni /
translated: The ascertainment beginning with the stage of the existence of mind is as follows:

original: sems kyi @182a * //
analyzed: sems kyi @182a * //
translated: The mind is the basis of all dharmas.

original: 'jug pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'jug pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: Engagement is to be understood in brief in five ways:

original: kun rdzob kyi tshul rnam par gzhag pa dang / don dam pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa dang / gnas dang gnas pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / lhan cig dngos por rnam par gzhag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pas so //🔽de la kun rdzob kyi tshul rnam par gzhag pas 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tshul rnam par gzhag pa dang / don dam pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa dang / gnas dang gnas pa rnam par gzhag pa dang / lhan cig dngos por rnam par gzhag pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba rnam par gzhag pas so // de la kun rdzob kyi tshul rnam par gzhag pas 'jug pa ni /
translated: through the establishment of the conventional, through the establishment of the ultimate, through the establishment of the basis and what is based on it, through the establishment of the simultaneous, and through the establishment of defilement and purification.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The engagement through the establishment of the conventional is as follows:

original: yid kyi sar sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yid kyi sar sngar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as previously explained in the stage of mind.

original: de la don dam pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la don dam pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pa bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now, the establishment of the ultimate should be explained.

original: don dam pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pas 'jug pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: don dam pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pas 'jug pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is engagement through the establishment of the ultimate?

original: mdor bsdu na rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam par shes pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, consciousness is twofold:

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: the fundamental consciousness and the evolving consciousnesses.

original: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gnas yin no //
analyzed: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni gnas yin no //
translated: The store-consciousness is the basis.

original: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gnas pa yin te /
translated: The active forms of consciousness are the things based on it.

original: de yang rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bdun te /
translated: They are of seven kinds,

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa nas /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa nas /
translated: from visual consciousness to

original: yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar te /🔽chu'i chu bo dang rlabs lta bu'am /
analyzed: yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar te / chu'i chu bo dang rlabs lta bu'am /
translated: the mental consciousness.🔽They are like the waves and the water,

original: me long dang gzugs brnyan lta bu yin no //
analyzed: me long dang gzugs brnyan lta bu yin no //
translated: or like a mirror and the reflections in it.

original: de ltar na 'di ni don dam pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pas gnas dang gnas pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni don dam pa'i tshul rnam par gzhag pas gnas dang gnas pa rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the basis and the things based on it according to the ultimate truth.

original: de la rnam par shes pa de dag thams cad ni sems zhes kyang bya /
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa de dag thams cad ni sems zhes kyang bya /
translated: All these forms of consciousness are called mind,

original: yid ces kyang bya /
analyzed: yid ces kyang bya /
translated: thought,

original: rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa zhes kyang bya ste /
translated: and also consciousness.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dngos su na sems yin te /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni dngos su na sems yin te /
translated: The store-consciousness is the mind in the primary sense,

original: 'di ltar de ni sa bon thams cad kyis kun du bsags shing nye bar bsags pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni sa bon thams cad kyis kun du bsags shing nye bar bsags pa yin no //
translated: because it is the accumulation and the collection of all the seeds.

original: de yang dus rtag par len pa'i rgyu la dmigs pa dang ; bye brag med par ram gcig tu snod la dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang dus rtag par len pa'i rgyu la dmigs pa dang ; bye brag med par ram gcig tu snod la dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, the mental faculty always has as its object the cause of appropriation, and it has as its object the body without making distinctions.

original: yid ni dus rtag tu nga dang bdag gi zhes rlom sems kyi bdag nyid can yin no //
analyzed: yid ni dus rtag tu nga dang bdag gi zhes rlom sems kyi bdag nyid can yin no //
translated: The mental faculty always has as its object the thought “I” and the thought “mine.”

original: rnam par shes pa ni yul so sor rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni yul so sor rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: Consciousness is the characteristic of the perception of the particular object.

original: sems yod pa'i gnas skabs ni /
analyzed: sems yod pa'i gnas skabs ni /
translated: The state of mind is as follows:

original: gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ma skyes na ni sems dang yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa gsum po de dag dus rtag par lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa ma skyes na ni sems dang yid dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa gsum po de dag dus rtag par lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug par rig par bya'o //
translated: If the consciousness that is engaged in the eye consciousness, etc., has not arisen, then the three, mind, thought, and the mental faculty, should be understood as always occurring and operating together.

original: gal te skyes na ni des na de'i lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug pa lhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te skyes na ni des na de'i lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug pa lhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: If it has arisen, then it should be understood that the three occur and operate together with it.

original: @182b de ltar na res 'ga' ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: @182b de ltar na res 'ga' ni bzhi'o //
translated: Thus, sometimes there are four,

original: res 'ga' ni brgyad kyi bar yang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni brgyad kyi bar yang lhan cig 'byung zhing 'jug par rig par bya'o //
translated: and sometimes there are eight that occur and operate together.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig gis ni cig car du yul gcig gam gnyis sam rab tu mang po dang rang gi yul dang gzhan gyi yul la yang rnam par rtog par byed pas na de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa de'i 'jug pa ni bsam
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa gcig gis ni cig car du yul gcig gam gnyis sam rab tu mang po dang rang gi yul dang gzhan gyi yul la yang rnam par rtog par byed pas na de'i phyir yid kyi rnam par shes pa de'i 'jug pa ni bsam
translated: The mental consciousness, on the other hand, is capable of conceiving a single object, two objects, or many objects, both its own object and the objects of others.

original: gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gyis mi khyab pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the engagement of the mental consciousness is said to be inconceivable.

original: gal te yid dus rtag tu rlom sems kyi bdag nyid can gyi rgyun gyis 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te yid dus rtag tu rlom sems kyi bdag nyid can gyi rgyun gyis 'jug pa yin na /
translated: If the mental faculty always engages in a continuum that is of the nature of conceiving,

original: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yid ces gang gsungs pa de ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na ;
analyzed: des na bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yid ces gang gsungs pa de ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na ;
translated: then how can the state that is called “the transcendent mental faculty” be established?

original: smras pa / ming tsam gyi brdas gdags pa yin gyi don ji lta ba bzhin du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: smras pa / ming tsam gyi brdas gdags pa yin gyi don ji lta ba bzhin du ni ma yin no //
translated: We respond: It is designated by the mere expression of a name, not in accordance with fact.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang de ni gnyen pos yang dag pa phyin ci ma log par sems pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang de ni gnyen pos yang dag pa phyin ci ma log par sems pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Another explanation is that it is the antidote that correctly and nonerroneously conceives.

original: gzhi des de ltar rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir yid de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhi des de ltar rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa nyid kyi phyir yid de ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of the operation of that kind of conceptualization on the basis of that, that mind is called the basis of mental consciousness.

original: de la res 'ga' ni thams cad kyang bde ba'i tshor ba kho na dang lhan cig gi dngos po mtshungs par ldan par 'jug go //
analyzed: de la res 'ga' ni thams cad kyang bde ba'i tshor ba kho na dang lhan cig gi dngos po mtshungs par ldan par 'jug go //
translated: Sometimes all of them operate in association with only the feeling of pleasure,

original: res 'ga' ni sdug bsngal dang ngo //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni sdug bsngal dang ngo //
translated: sometimes with the feeling of pain,

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang yang ngo //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang yang ngo //
translated: and sometimes with the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de ni dus rtag tu sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / rnam par smin pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de ni dus rtag tu sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang / rnam par smin pa'o //
translated: The feeling that is associated with the store consciousness is always the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain, and it is the result of evolution.

original: de yang ma shi'i bar du rnam par shes pa'i rgyun gyis 'jug pa thams cad pa bde ba dang ldan pa dag dang / sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dag dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa dag tu rgyun mi 'chad par rgyun gyis 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang ma shi'i bar du rnam par shes pa'i rgyun gyis 'jug pa thams cad pa bde ba dang ldan pa dag dang / sdug bsngal dang ldan pa dag dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa dang ldan pa dag tu rgyun mi 'chad par rgyun gyis 'jug pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, until death, all the moments of the stream of consciousness are uninterruptedly engaged in being associated with pleasure, being associated with pain, and being associated with neither pleasure nor pain.

original: de la de las gzhan pa'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum gang yin pa de ni bsgrubs pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa ma yin pa dang / res 'ga' 'byung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la de las gzhan pa'i tshor ba rnam pa gsum gang yin pa de ni bsgrubs pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa ma yin pa dang / res 'ga' 'byung ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Among them, the three kinds of feeling that are different from that should be understood as being derived from effort, not innate, and occurring only occasionally.

original: bsgrubs pa de mngon du gyur pa na /
analyzed: bsgrubs pa de mngon du gyur pa na /
translated: When that derived from effort is manifest,

original: lhan cig skyes pa de ni cha phra ba'i phyir yongs su gcad par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa de ni cha phra ba'i phyir yongs su gcad par dka' ba yin no //
translated: that which is innate is difficult to discern because it is subtle.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni don dam par rnam par shes pa rnams kyi lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa de ni don dam par rnam par shes pa rnams kyi lhan cig gi dngos pos 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, this is the way in which the engagement of consciousnesses in terms of their simultaneous mode of activity should be understood in an ultimate sense.

original: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni nyon @183a * //
analyzed: de la kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni nyon @183a * //
translated: The foundation consciousness is the cause of the six consciousnesses.🔽

original: mongs pa gang dang yang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mongs pa gang dang yang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: The store consciousness is not associated with any of the passions.

original: yid ni dus rtag tu ye yod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yid ni dus rtag tu ye yod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi po 'di lta ste /
translated: The thinking consciousness is always associated with the four passions that are universal in the realm of desire:

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / bdag la chags pa dang ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa dang lhan cig gi dngos pos mtshungs par ldan te /
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa'i rnam par 'jig tshogs la lta ba dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / bdag la chags pa dang ma 'dres pa'i ma rig pa dang lhan cig gi dngos pos mtshungs par ldan te /
translated: the view of a real self and a real world, the conceit “I am,” and attachment to one’s own views and moral conduct.

original: nyon mongs pa de dag kyang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par shes pa la 'gal ba med pa dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ye yod pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag kyang dge ba dang mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i rnam par shes pa la 'gal ba med pa dang / bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ye yod pa yin no //
translated: These passions are not incompatible with the good, the bad, or the morally neutral states of consciousness, and they are obscured and morally indeterminate.

original: de las gzhan pa rnam par brtags pa rnams ni /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa rnam par brtags pa rnams ni /
translated: The other passions are of two kinds:

original: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: those that occur in specific situations and those that are habitual.

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam ni ye yod pa'i nyon mongs pa bzhi po kun du 'gro ba de dag nyams par byed pa'i gnyen po ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam ni ye yod pa'i nyon mongs pa bzhi po kun du 'gro ba de dag nyams par byed pa'i gnyen po ma yin te /
translated: The mundane path is not the antidote that weakens those four ever-present afflictions that are always present.

original: 'di ltar de dag ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la yang kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams la yang kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because they occur even in those who are free from attachment.

original: / nyon mongs pa de dag ni gang du lus skyes par gyur pa'i sa de pa nyid de /
analyzed: / nyon mongs pa de dag ni gang du lus skyes par gyur pa'i sa de pa nyid de /
translated: Those afflictions occur in the very stage where the body is born.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba de dag nyid kun du 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba de dag nyid kun du 'byung bar rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that they occur even in those who are free from attachment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar de dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon las byung ba kho na yin pas dus rtag tu yod pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi yul gyi rkyen can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i sa bon las byung ba kho na yin pas dus rtag tu yod pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang gnyen po'i phyogs kyi yul gyi rkyen can ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise only from the seeds in the store consciousness, they are always present and are not conditions of the object that is the counteragent to their opposing class.

original: de dag ni 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba la ni lam mngon du gyur kyang rung ma gyur kyang rung ste kun du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag ni 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba la ni lam mngon du gyur kyang rung ma gyur kyang rung ste kun du 'byung ngo //
translated: They occur in those who are free from attachment to the mundane realm, whether or not the path is present.

original: slob pa bzhi mthong ba la ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mngon du gyur na ni mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: slob pa bzhi mthong ba la ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i lam mngon du gyur na ni mi 'byung ngo //
translated: The four learners do not manifest it when the supramundane path is present.

original: de las langs pa la ni kun du 'byung ste /
analyzed: de las langs pa la ni kun du 'byung ste /
translated: They manifest it when they arise from that path,

original: shin tu rtogs pa'i phyir dang / ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu rtogs pa'i phyir dang / ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they have fully understood it and have not abandoned it.

original: mi slob pa la ni rnam pa thams cad du kun du mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mi slob pa la ni rnam pa thams cad du kun du mi 'byung ngo //
translated: The nonlearner does not manifest it at all.

original: de dag ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba kho nas cig car spong bar rig par bya'o /
analyzed: de dag ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched kyi 'dod chags dang bral ba kho nas cig car spong bar rig par bya'o /
translated: They should be understood as being simultaneously abandoned by one who is free from attachment to the sphere of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: dper na de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dag ltar rim gyis spod ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan pa'i nyon mongs pa dag ltar rim gyis spod ba ni ma yin no //
translated: they are not abandoned gradually, as are the other defilements.

original: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu dang mthun pa dag ni kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i 'jug pa rnam par gzhag pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Such is the presentation of the process of affliction and purification.

original: sems yod pa'i sa rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung @183b ni de las mi snang ngo /
analyzed: sems yod pa'i sa rnam par gtan la dbab pa'i gzhung @183b ni de las mi snang ngo /
translated: The treatise on the ascertainment of the levels that have mind does not appear.

original: // / sems med pa'i sa las brtsams te rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni sems mi skye ba'i rgyu dag ni du /
analyzed: // / sems med pa'i sa las brtsams te rnam par gtan la dbab pa ni sems mi skye ba'i rgyu dag ni du /
translated: The treatise on the topics of the levels of consciousness begins with the question, How many causes are there for the nonarising of consciousness?

original: rgyu du dag gis ni sems skye bar mi 'gyur zhe na mdor bsdu na bdun po 'di dag ni sems mi skye ba'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: rgyu du dag gis ni sems skye bar mi 'gyur zhe na mdor bsdu na bdun po 'di dag ni sems mi skye ba'i rgyu yin te /
translated: By how many causes does consciousness not arise? In brief, there are seven causes for the nonarising of consciousness.
